loans.name: Мavluda

texts.ru:
Мавлуда живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Она имеет большой десятилетний  опыт в сфере животноводство и знает все тонкости этого дела. От скотоводство получает свой доход, который тратит на жильё, учебу детей и проживания. Мавлуда имеет 3 коровы и 4 баранов. Она также доит корову и получает парное и вкусное молоко.  Продавая молоко, она получает доход. Так же  она  вяжет теплые светера, шапочки, носочки на продажу и тем самым  покрывает ежедневные расходы семьи. 
 Сын помогает ей в скотоводстве и часто выводит скот на пастбище.Мавлуда планирует купить КРС и корм для них, но не имеет достаточную сумму на руках.  Мавлуда решила обратится в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. Очень надеется найти решения своих задач приобретённым кредитом. Заранее благодарит МДО «Арванд» за доверие и поддержку.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in a rural area, in a remote village. She has a decade of experience raising livestock, and knows all the details of the trade. She earns her income from animal husbandry, and the money goes to their house, the children's education, and living expenses. Mavluda has three cows and four sheep. She also milks a cow for fresh, delicious milk. She also earns money from selling milk. In addition she knits warm sweaters, hats, and socks to sell, to cover the everyday expenses of her family. Her son helps with the animals, and often takes them to pasture. Mavluda plans to buy cattle and their feed, but she doesn't have enough money available. Mavluda decided to ask MDO Arvand for a loan, which she hopes with solve that problem. She thanks MDO Arvand in advance for the trust and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Farruh

texts.ru:
Фаррруху  23 года.   Родился в семье учителей. Фаррух женат. Эта молодая семья живет вместе с родителями .  Несмотря на свою молодость Фаррух является заведующим  сельского клуба . Дополнительно он занимается перепродажей сухофруктов.  Хотя его жена помогает ему занимаясь пошивом одежды,    фонд зарплаты семьи недостаточен для поддержания жизни этой молодой семьи и совершенствования  жизненных условий.
 Наступила зима и Фарруху надо утеплять кров. Знакомые, которые брали в «Арванд» кредиты посоветовали ему взять для этой цели кредит. Фаррух обратился в Арванд. На полученный кредит Фаррух планирует купить печку и дрова.  Очень надеется на помощь и поддержку со стороны Арванд.
texts.en: Farruh is 23 years old. He was born into a family of teachers. Farruh is married. His young family still lives with the parents. Despite his young age, Farruh manages a town club. He also sells dried fruit. His wife helps him by working as a seamstress, but the family's income is not enough to support their young family and provide good living conditions. Winter has come and Farruh needs to heat their home. Friends that received loans from Arvand suggested that he use a loan. Farruh contacted Arvand. He plans to use the money to buy a stove and firewood. He very much hopes for support and help through Arvand.

loans.use: to buy a stove and firewood

loans.name: Behbat

texts.en:
Mrs.Behbat is 29 years old and a single mother of two. She lives in her ger in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her two daughters attend a local primary school and kindergarten.

Behbat divorced her husband and took custody of her daughters herself. She is working very hard to raise her daughters to be good, well educated people. She started a small amount of savings for both of her daughters, and she deposits a small amount every month, for their future.

She started working as a saleswoman in a local town, in 2011. She is now starting her own baby clothing and accessories retail business, in the local market. She is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT, with which to purchase starting inventory for her newly starting baby clothing and accessories retail business. She is a hardworking and strong woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her new baby clothing and accessories retail business

loans.name: Bulgantsagaan

texts.en:
Bulgantsagaan is 57 years old and lives alone in her small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her only daughter is married and lives apart. 

Bulgantsagaan works at a local museum as bookkeeper. She is now starting her own business of retail clothing in a local market since she will be retired soon and it will be better for her to start her own business in order to continue her income stability. Her daughter also helps her to start her business of retail clothing. 

She is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for her newly-begun retail clothing business. She is a hardworking and skillful woman.

loans.use: to purchase starting inventory for her newly-begun retail clothing business

loans.name: Chimedtseyen

texts.en:
Chimedtseyen is 44 years old, and she lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband works as a security guard at a local kindergarten. Her older son provides taxi services in town and her younger son studies at university. 

Chimedtseyen started her clothes retail business in the local market in 2000. She is now selling pajamas at her rental booth at the local market and now is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of new sets of pajamas and underwear to sell to local customers. Her family made up of hardworking, decent and diligent people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of new sets of pajamas and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from running a general store.

Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a 13000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, and other household goods to sell. 

Helen has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, sugar, eggs, coffee, and other household goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive junto a su esposo, utilizan el local de su negocio como casa también, ella junto a su esposo atienden la carpintería, tiene el negocio desde hace 8 años es apoyada por su esposo y tiene dos empleados, para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Comprará madera y pagará la instalación de la energía en su taller, con lo que espera usar un equipo especial que le facilite tallar la madera, entregar puntualmente sus pedidos, aumentar su producción, tener mayores ingresos y fortalecer su negocio.
 Sueña con tener un lugar propio donde ubicar su negocio y así ahorrarse el alquiler.
texts.en:
Maria and her husband live in a building that serves as both home and workshop.  They have operated a carpentry business for 8 years and have two employees.  
Maria will use part of this loan to buy supplies of wood for the shop and the rest to install electricity.  She needs power to use equipment for shaping wood and the investment will allow her to increase production.  The business will grow, she says, and generate more income.  
For the future, Maria hopes to buy a building so that she can forego the rent that she pays now.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to her carpentry shop.

loans.name: Ana Gilma

texts.es:
Ana,  necesita capital para invertir en eta temporada invertirá en la compra de cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos, con esta compra su cliente será fortalecido y podrá tener mejores ingresos.
Con el crédito anterior compro variedad de ropa y alimento para cerdos, lo que le facilito aumentar sus ventas, tener más clientes satisfechos, su negocio es más rentable lo que le facilita dar a su familia un estilo de vida mucho mejor.
texts.en: Ana is applying for a loan that she will use to buy pigs for her animals sales business.  She buys young pigs, fattens them and sells them for a profit.  Ana used part of her last loan to buy pigs and animal feed and the rest to buy clothes for her clothing business.  The investment helped her to satisfy demand from her customers and grow her business.  The business is profitable now and provides an income that allows Ana and her family to live better than before.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Sri Cendana Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut and all members of Sri Cendana group decided to continue borrowing from MUK. Because they need to increase the population of pigs, they need a new loan. They will still need loans until they can support their business by themselves.

Ni Ketut gets full support from her husband. He helps Ni Ketut to maintain the pigs. This loan will be used to purchase 3 superior piglets and feed. Now she has 5 piglets. Ni Ketut needs a vet who always be ready when needed. The profit will be saved as capital for her business.

One member couldn’t attend the disbursement because of illness.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior quality piglets and buy feed.

loans.name: Umarkhon

texts.ru:
Умархон воспитанный, ответственный и верующий  мужчина. Он женат. Умархон вместе с женой живут и работают на районе Яван. Умархон работает в финансовой организации охранником, там же его жена работает уборщицей. Умархон рад, что может больше времени проводить с женой. 
   Умархон работает по будням и по выходным у него свободное время. Он решил не тратить свое время в пустою, и начать бизнес животноводства. Умархон не бросит свою работу охранника, и скотоводством будет заниматься параллельно. Он уверен, что справиться со всеми обязательствами. Деятельность животноводства требует больших средств. И сумму, которую просит Умархон является маленькой для такой деятельности. Он начинает с малого и на сумму от кредита, Умархон намерен купить пару голов скота и начать бизнес. Умархон верит, что ему помогут, он заранее благодарен за помощь.
texts.en: Umarkhon is a respectable, responsible, and religious person. He is married. Umarkhon and his wife live and work in the Yavan region. He works as a security guard for a financial firm, and his wife works as a janitor there as well. Umarkhon is happy that he can spend more time with his wife. He works during the week and has free time on the weekend. He decided to start a livestock business instead of letting his time go to waste. Umarkhon is not going to leave his job as a guard, but is going to raise animals at the same time. He is sure that he can handle all his responsibilities. Animal husbandry requires a lot of capital. The sum that Umarkhon is asking for is small for this business. He is beginning small, planning to use the loan to buy two cows and start his business. He trusts that he will be helped, and thanks you in advance for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy a pair of cows to begin his livestock business.

loans.name: Sohibjon

texts.ru:
Сохибжон честный пунктуальный и целеустремленный мужчина живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района. Ему 25 лет, он женат, имеет одного ребенка. Сохибжон живет с родителями. Сохибжон с раннего возраста занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Он занимается откармливанием и размножением крупно-рогатого скота и имеет большой опыт.С куплей и продажей  занимается его отец. Кроме этого Сохибжон занимается выращиванием  риса.
 Сохибжон копит деньги на постройку нового дома поэтому он развивает свой бизнес по скотоводству. Для развития бизнеса он хочет купить еще несколько скотов. С этой целю Сохибжон обратился в Арванд за кредитом и на полученный кредит хочет купить скот. Заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Sohibjon is an honest, punctual, and goal-oriented man living in a rural area of the J. Rasulov district. He is 25 years old and has one child. Sohibjon lives with his parents. From a young age he was an entrepreneur. He raises and breeds cattle, an area he has a lot of experience in. He does the buying and selling with his father. In addition, Sohibjon also grows rice. He is saving money to build a new house, so he wants to expand his livestock business. To do so he wants to buy more cows. With this goal in mind Sohibjon came to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. He thanks Arvand for the support and help in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es:
José a sus 69 años de edad, es padre de un hijo pero por dificultades familiares no vive con él después de haberse separado de su esposa. Sin embargo, con empuje y mucha dedicación, le hace frente a la soledad y a la situación económica, trabaja como comerciante independiente hace más de 40 años, inició vendiendo pescado de manera ambulante por las diferentes calles de la ciudad pero, por reubicación de las autoridades de espacio público se quedó sin su puesto de trabajo, luego decidió montar una chaza en el sector de las funerarias y empresas de servicios exequiales de la ciudad, allí ofrece café, mecato, dulces, cigarrillos y otros productos, tiene muy buena clientela y labora todos los días de 6 am a 8 pm, así logra generar los recursos para pagar la habitación donde vive y su alimento diario.
Con el ánimo de aumentar su inventario solicita el apoyo del crédito, con el dinero comprará surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, dulces, café, productos desechables, cigarrillos, entre otros), así seguirá satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y mejorará el nivel de ingresos para su sustento.
José manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir soñando con adquirir su casa propia, para ello trabaja largas jornadas, esto le permitirá tener mejores condiciones de vida y podrá disfrutar una vejez tranquila.
texts.en:
José at 69 years old is the father of one child. But due to family difficulties he does not live with him after having separated from his wife. However with effort and much dedication he faces being alone and his financial situation. He has worked as an independent businessman for more than 40 years. He started selling fish in the various streets of the city, but due to relocation of public space by the authorities he was left with no place to work. 

José decided to open a stand in the area where the funeral homes and funeral services are located. He offered coffee, pastries, cigarettes and other products. He has a good clientele and he works every day from 6 am until 8 pm. Doing this he can generate the resources he needs to pay his lodging and meals. With the idea of increasing his inventory he is requesting the help of a loan. With the money José will buy stock wholesale (pastries, candy, sweets, coffee, disposable items, cigarettes, etc.). He will be able to satisfy the needs of his clients and improve the ingress of revenue for his sustenance. Jose manifests that his age doesn't stop him from wanting to acquire his own home. So he works long hours and this allows him to have better living conditions and he will be able to enjoy a peaceful old age.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (pastries, candy, sweets, coffee, disposable items, cigarettes, etc.)

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant and has been in this business for two years. She gets additional income from selling piped water. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, flour, rice, Irish potatoes, cassava and fish.  

Christine works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also buying a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because they are cooperative.    She resides in her own house and the family has access to  piped water but does not have access to electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas, flour, rice, fish , cassava, and Irish potatoes

loans.name: Bolormaa

texts.en:
Bolormaa is 45 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter, in a ger in Zavhan province, Mongolia.

Her husband, Tsoggerel, is currently unemployed and helps his wife to run their family business. They make dumplings and other, traditional food products. Her daughter, Oyun-Erdene, studies at a local secondary school.

Bolormaa has been producing frozen traditional dumplings and buuz (a traditional food similar to dumpling) for sale, since 2011. She makes the foods at home and sells them to local residents. She has already built close relationships with her loyal customers.

Now, she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT. She will use it to purchase large amounts of meat and flour, to produce large amounts of traditional dumplings and traditional baked goods. Lunar New Year is approaching, and it is the highest season for sales of traditional dumplings.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of meat and flour, for producing large amounts of traditional dumplings and baked goods

loans.name: Erhembayar

texts.en:
Erhembayar is a 46-year-old lady who lives with her husband and three children in their small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. Her husband runs a small grocery store in a spare room in small house in their plot of land. Her older son provides taxi service in town and the other two sons help their parents to run their businesses. 

Erhembayar runs a religious articles shop in another small room of the house. She has been selling a variety of products for years and is known within the area. She is now requesting a loan of 2,800,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory to prepare for the Lunar New year which is the high season of her sales. She and her family are hardworking and very compatible people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory to prepare for the Lunar New year which is the high season of her sales

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado entonces desea continuar participando en el proyecto porque le ayudo con el capital del negocio. 

Natividad continua dedicándose a la venta de verduras, granos secos y crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella compra de diferentes agricultores de Paucartambo verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, zanahorias, repollo, habas, tomates y otros para luego venderlos en su puesto de venta de uno de los mercados de Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos y verduras. Ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia ella tiene 53 años edad y tiene ochos hijos,
texts.en: Natividad is grateful to the lenders for the loan and she is happy for the support.  She wants to continue participating in the project because the capital helped with her business.  Natividad continues selling vegetables, dried grains, and raising small animals such as Guinea pigs.  She buys vegetables, like onions, carrots, cabbage, lima beans, tomatoes, and other things from different farmers in Paucartambo and has her stall set up in one of the local markets.  She has been doing this for several years and things are going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and needs a loan to buy dried grains and vegetables.  She is a hardworking, enterprising woman who gets her family ahead.  She is 53 years old and has eight children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela continua con la venta de fruta y venta de comestibles entonces ella también tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fruta. 

Ella nació en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta ciudad, ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta magnífica  relación tiene cinco hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Graciela is still selling fruit and groceries, and she has a stall in one of the markets in the town of Paucartambo where she sells the merchandise. She continues to run the business and tend to her customers with friendliness and courtesy. For that reason they always return to her stall. Graciela has had the business for several years and all is going well because of her hard work. She belongs to the 'Mamacha Carmen' Community Bank and now needs a loan to buy more fruit. 

Graciela was born in the lovely town of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco. She still lives there with her family. She is 54 years old, married, and has five children whom she is helping to get ahead.

loans.use: Buy fruit

loans.name: Nadila

texts.en: The proprietor of Day Spring, Nadila, is a hardworking 33-year-old lady from a suburb of the Mbarara municipality in Uganda. She grew up with her grandmother who was a teacher. She went to school and completed ordinary levels, but failed to get money to continue with her education. Due to that fact, she joined teaching college and graduated as a teacher. Because of the scarcity of jobs in Uganda, she decided to start her own school with the help of her grandmother in the same house where they were staying. Now that the house is becoming very old, she has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to renovate it so that she can attract more pupils to the school.

loans.use: To renovate the house that houses a nursery

loans.name: Bena

texts.en:
Bena is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the region of Mubende in Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past six years, Bena has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food and drinks. 

To help expand her business, Bena has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase and stock for more food and drinks, and will help Bena to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her two children. Bena hopes that in the future she will be able to enlarge her business. 

Bena is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bena who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase and stock more food and drinks

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbaatar is 44 years old and lives with his wife and 2 kids in their small house in Dornogovi province, Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and stays home. His older daughter has just gotten married and lives in Ulaanbaatar city. His younger 2 children are local secondary school students.

Ganbaatar has been running taxi services during his off-duty hours since 2011. He has been working at a local government unit for years and quit because of his medical condition. He is now requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and other necessary replacement items for his car to start his taxi service, and also to buy some furniture for his daughter's new home in Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other items for his car, and to buy some furniture for his daughter's new home

loans.name: Patrick Njai

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from seven years to 17 years. He describes himself as a serious person. He operates a retail store where he sells domestic goods. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the hiking of prices for goods. He will use the KES 13,900 loan to buy a gas cooker to enable his family to cook efficiently. His business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, his family will be stable.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Sonunbu

texts.ru: Сонунбу 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Сонунбу - среднее образование, очень порядочная, ответственная, добросовестная, умеющая правильно вести свое дело. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сонунбу занимается животноводством, стартовав 22 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сонунбу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 25 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на котором выращивает арбузы и дыни. Доход от полеводства примерно 150 000 сом (KGS) в год. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сонунбу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Сонунбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Sonunbu is 48 years old, married, and has one son with her spouse. Sonunbu has a high school education, is very fair, responsible, and conscientious, and follows her ethics. Sonunbu earns the primary income for her family by raising livestock. She started 22 years ago with 5,000 som (KGS) worth of animals. Thanks to her tireless work she now owns a dairy cow, 25 sheep, and a 1.0 hectare parcel of land where she raises watermelon and cantaloupe. The income from her field crops is around 150,000 som (KGS) per year. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further expanding her business, Sonunbu is asking the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy sheep and their feed. She will later sell them at the market for a profit. She plans to invest income from the loan into further expanding her number of livestock, and also plans to save some funds for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is from Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, and is happily married with six children. She generates income through fishing, which sustains her family's needs. However, because of the increase of her children's tuition fees, she also operates a food eatery and sari-sari store. These extra activities answer their needs.

In addition to that, Daisy has been a member of Paglaum MPC for three years. Because of her trust in the cooperative and her loyalty, PMPC assists her financial needs. She has a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for her eatery.

Daisy is thankful for the unending support of PMPC, which helps her grow in her own business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her eatery

loans.name: Florelba

texts.es:
Florelba es una campesina de 35 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Desde que era pequeña su familia le enseñó todas las labores del campo y, gracias a ello, hoy en día logra generar ingresos para su familia, tiene un galpón en el que cría y engorda pollos para la venta, los animales son vendidos entre sus familiares y amigos del municipio donde reside, así ha podido apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito solicitado será destinado a realizar adecuaciones del galpón y para comprar más pollos para engorde y posterior venta; así aumentará la capacidad de producción y generará mejores ventas e ingresos para su familia.
El sueño de Florelba es ampliar su negocio para poder aumentar más su producción y así garantizar una mayor rentabilidad que le permita dar a sus hijos una mejor educación y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida  en compañía de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
35-year old Florelba is from the rural areas. She is married and has two children. Ever since she was small, she was taught by her family all about working in the fields, and nowadays that is how she earns money to support her family. She has a shed where she raises chickens to sell to the friends and family in her neighbourhood. This is how she helps her husband financially.

The loan that Florelba is seeking will be used to repair the shed and buy more chickens to fatten and sell. Production will increase and more income for the family generated.

Florelba’s dream is to expand her business so that she can be sure of more sales and income. She will then be able to provide her children with a better education and enjoy a better standard of living with her family.

loans.use: repair the shed and buy more chickens to fatten and sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store, which has been running for twelve years now. Her income from the business is helping her with their household's everyday expenses. Her children are helping her to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefa hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Isunga Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Berna, a repeat customer has been operating a bar since 1999 as her major source of income. She practices small-scale farming to put food on the table.

She borrowed 200,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from Ugafode previously so that she could improve her agriculture, but since she operates a bar for additional income, she wants UGX.300,000 to buy soft drinks and local brew to sell to her customers so that she can get more returns.

She dreams of building a good house for her children. However, she is challenged by limited capital to invest in her business. She is hopeful that the loans, with the support of Kiva lenders, will gradually improve her status. She is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and local brew for selling

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 38-year-old, hardworking woman, with 4 children living  in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

She operates a retail shop as her main source of income but also rears goats,operates a transport business and practices crop production.She started this business using little funds from selling her goats and topped up using a loan from Hofokam.Despite her success, she faces challenges of limited capital and customers who don't pay her on time.  

Her vision is to continuously diversify business to include building houses for rent and expanding her businesses into new markets.
Rose is requesting for a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap, salt and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Mpanga  Tumanyane Group

texts.en:
Mpanga Tumanyane is a new group located in a rural area in the western region in Ntungamo district. It’s a group of women and men whose major activity is farming many of them are married and their children are in different elementary schools. They have jointly applied for loan of UGX.4,500,000 which they will share amidst themselves as the break down attached. They currently have a challenge of low productivity due to land degradation and they thought of acquiring loans to buy mulches to restore its fertility as well as pay tuition for their children. Their prime target is to change the lives of their families and also to take their children to better schools. But they are limited by capital and funds to enable them to achieve their dreams. With this loan they believe their production will improve and their livelihood will change and the society will develop.

In the photograph are the group members and the two Ugafode officials at the far left. Jenerous will particularly use the loan to buy mulches.

loans.use: to buy mulches.

loans.name: Muko Bakyara Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Vasta, a member of the women-dominated group in her village, is a mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She was inspired to join the group by her neighbor, who is the group chairperson.

She will use the loan to buy pesticides for her tomatoes, which she hopes to be harvesting in time for the festive season. And with the pesticides, she is optimistic the her yields will increase.

Vasta is hardworking and honest.The man on the far left is the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her tomatoes.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is a resident of Kyabwarugandaa village in Mbarara municipality and she has children. She got married when she was 17 years old to a man she loved but the parents were against it. But her husband had no source of income and looking after the children became a problem. She and her husband joined hands and got a loan from Ugafode which they used to start up a small retail shop. This shop has grown, supporting the family for survival. They have also managed to build a house and they are requesting a loan of UGX.1,500,000 to buy building materials and hire labour to complete the family residential house.

loans.use: To buy building materials and hire labour

loans.name: Wilbroad

texts.en: In addition to pigs, for which he acquired the previous loan, Wilbroad also rears goats. He applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX to help him buy more goats to sell. His major challenge is lack of enough capital to help him expand his business, a problem he hopes to overcome soon using the finances advanced to him. His future plan is to construct a permanent home for his children and take them to good schools. Wilbroad is a hard working and honest man who repaid his previous loan well.

loans.use: to buy more goats

loans.name: Swazi Twetungure Group

texts.en: Alice is a 48-year-old married woman with two children.  She is a proud member of the Swazi group which has ten members, most of whom are farmers. Alice has been a tea farmer since 2001.  She works seven days a week and dedicates nine hours per day to farming. Her tea farm is located in Swazi, a cell in Kyamuhunga sub county in Bushenyi District. Tea farming is the main activity in the area and she decided to concentrate the same being  the main source of income at that time. In addition to tea farming, Alice started a retail shop to supplement her income so that she can easily look after her children. The shop is located in the same area and she says it has indeed boosted her income. She hopes to use the loan to buy fertilizer to improve the quality of the soil. Alice has high hopes that the next season's harvest will be better and  she will earn more money. Despite the challenge of weather which affects her greatly, Alice is determined to increase the size of her farm so that she realizes bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 29-years-old and he has one child. His business is real estate.  His additional income is farming.  His other source of income is agriculture(livestock). He began the business because he dropped out of school at a young age. He will use the loan to buy construction materials to complete his house, because the current one is in shambles. He thanks Ugafode for reaching the rural poor and meeting their needs. He is hard-working. In the photograph is Richard and the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Rwanyanja Church Group

texts.en:
Herbert is a 50 year old married man with 7 children. He is a member of Rwanyanja Church Group and a resident of Rukungiri District. He is basically involved in agriculture and he specializes in coffee planting, supplementing them with banana plantations and other crops.

He has been practicing agriculture for quite a long time, and from his business he has been able to build a good house for his family, provide education to his children, and also provide other basic needs.

Through his group, he has secured a loan of UGX 800,000 from UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) with Kiva funds to buy more fertilizer. At the end of the season he expects high yields from his farm. The whole group secured a loan of UGX 4,900,000 and they are grateful to UGAFODE for the service rendered.

In the photograph are 11 clients; the eleventh member has not got a loan in this cycle though signed the waiver form.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his gardens.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the region of Kampala South in Uganda. She is married and has three children; none of them are currently in school. For the past three years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells women and men clothes and bags. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more women and men clothes and bags for the shop, will help Mariam generate greater profits, and will increase her working hours. Mariam hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a well-stocked shop. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more women and men clothes and bags for the shop

loans.name: Makwa

texts.en:
Makwa is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the region of Mbale in Uganda. He is married and has 7 children with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Makwa has been working hard to manage his restaurant, which sells food. 

To help expand his business, Makwa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food staff, and will help Makwa to generate greater profits and educate his children with the high profits earned. Makwa hopes that in the future he will be able to become richer through the profits earned. 

Makwa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Makwa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more food staff

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 32 years old and lives in the town of Koboko in the region of Arua in Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 22 years, Godfrey has been working hard to manage his produce business, which sells produce from various seeds to farmers. 

To help expand his business, he has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seeds to extract produce, and will help Godfrey to generate greater profits and take care of his family. He hopes that in the future he will be able to open another branch. 

Godfrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godfrey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Daler

texts.ru:
Далер житель района Яван. Ему 25 лет. Далер женатый мужчина и отец двух летней дочки. У него большая и дружная семья, состоящая из его матери, младшего брата, старшего брата с женой и детьми. Все они вместе живут. Старшему брату Далера 41 год у него четверо детей. Младшему брату 9 лет. Далер рад и благодарен Богу за то, что у него такая большая и дружная семья.
  Далер хочет начать новый бизнес. Он решил открыть свой продуктовый магазин. Далер нашел подходящее помещение для магазина, и осталось получить кредит, сделать ремонт и закупить первый товар для продажи. Он берет кредит, потому что у него мало начального капитала, но большое желания открыть магазин. Далер верит и надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Daler lives in the Yavan region. He is 25 years old, married, and has a two-year-old daughter. He has a large, friendly family comprised of his mother, younger brother, and older brother with his wife and children. They all live together. Daler's older brother is 41 and has four children. His younger brother is 9. Daler is happy and thanks God that he has such a large and wonderful family.

Daler wants to start a new business. He decided to open his own grocery store. Daler found a suitable place for the store, and now needs a loan to do repairs and buy the first products to sell. He is asking for a loan because he has little capital, but a great desire to open a store. Daler trusts in and hopes for your help.

loans.use: To open a store and bring in the starting inventory

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the  region of Mbale in Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past nine years, Jane has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soda, soap, cooking oil, bread, padlocks and tea leaves. 

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soda, soap, cooking oil, bread and sugar and will help Jane to generate greater profits and give her children a better education. Jane hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. 

Jane is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jane who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase soda, soap, cooking oil, bread and sugar

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es: Ana es socia del grupo “Mujeres Positivas”  conformada por 07 socias responsables, que buscan mejorar cada día. Ana de 48 años es  casada y tiene  04 hijos, actualmente sigue apoyando a 02 de ellos. Hace más de 01 año que cuenta con una bodega en su vivienda. Con su esfuerzo a logrado mejorar su casa. Con el fin de seguir implementando su negocio solicitó el crédito para la compra de abarrotes y bebidas. Su siguiente meta es de terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo “Mujeres Positivas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Ana es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste polo marón y pantalón negro.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Mujeres Positivas Communal Bank, which is composed of seven responsible women who are striving to improve themselves everyday. Ana is 48 years old, married and has four children. Currently she is still supporting two of them. 

She has had a grocery store in her home for more than a year. She requested a loan to purchase groceries and drinks in order to continue running her business. She has also worked to improve her house. Her next goal is to finish building her dwelling.

The Mujeres Positivas group is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they have provided. Ana is the first person on the left, wearing a brown top and black pants.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and drinks.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 54 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a person who is very responsible with her household obligations since she has always been known to provide the best for her family. She is happily married and has three children. Her businesses involve rice and hog raising production, which cater to the needs of her growing family. She has been in this service for 30 years.  Moreover, Delia, has been involved with PMPC for  three years. Consequently, she has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock of feed, among other items, so that she can continue to put bread on the table in her home.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of feed

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is happily married and has two kids. In 2003, she applied for membership to Paglaum MPC. Hearing all the benefits of being a member, she didn't hesitate to become one. She maintains herself as a credible member in good standing, and she always pays her loans in a timely manner. 

Recently, she has asked for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Through this project, she hopes to raise more income and be of help in the expansion of the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 61 years old  married, and a resident of Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She had one child that she sends to school. Starting with a loan of 2,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. 

Now, she is applying for a 3,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock, particularly basic commodities, for her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 50, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three kids. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so, she makes promising daily sales.  Evangeline has kept on running the store well for ten years even though there is increased competition from other stores.  Evangeline believes that with PMPC's support, as one family, they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Evangeline has reached her third year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of 18,000 PHP for the store. Expanding her inventory will provide additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of "member in good standing." She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain her store. From there, she hopes to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her sari-sari business

loans.name: Luz Gladis

texts.es:
Luz tiene 61 años de edad, 20 de ellos se ha dedicado a confeccionar su propia línea de blusas y camisas para dama, esta actividad se convirtió en su única fuente de ingresos luego de haber quedado viuda, tras el fallecimiento de su esposo. Con los ingresos que percibe por su labor, logró dar estudio a sus dos hijos y actualmente le genera el sustento diario, trabaja todos los días en compañía de una prima y la producción es vendida a sus familiares, amigos y  vecinos tanto en la ciudad donde vive, como en otro municipio de la región.
Solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, encajes y adornos), esto le permitirá sacar su producción y cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes, obteniendo como resultado un incremento en los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Luz manifiesta que su proyecto a futuro es ampliar su negocio, comprar más máquinas y generar empleo, para que éste sea más rentable y le brinde la posibilidad de mejorar las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 61 years old, and for twenty of those years she has earned her living sewing her own line of women’s blouses and shirts. This work became her only source of income after being widowed when her husband died. With the income she earns, she has managed to educate her two children and now she earns enough to support herself on a daily basis. 

She works every day with one of her cousins and sells what she makes to family members, friends and neighbours both in the area where she lives and further afield.

Luz is seeking a loan to buy supplies at wholesale prices (fabric, thread, buttons, lace, and decorative items). These purchases will allow her to continue sewing and complete her current orders. As a result she will earn more money for her work.

As a future project Luz wants to grow her business, buy more sewing machines, and employ more people. In this way her business will be more profitable and the standard of living of her family will improve.

loans.use: buy supplies at wholesale prices (fabric, thread, buttons, lace, and decorative items).

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He was able to buy spare parts and accessories for his tricycles. He has had this business for five years now and it helped in his everyday needs and expenses. He was able to also help his parents and siblings financially. He also has a small variety store where he sells grocery items and rice for retail.
 
He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. He will also use the money to buy grocery items for his variety store. His profits from his business will definitely help him sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Richard hopes to be more successful in business and dreams to buy his own house. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business, and he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of his tricycles

loans.name: Gladys Antonia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 20 y 19 años que estudian en Universidad. Su esposo trabaja de chofer.
Doña Gladys tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual vende variedad de productos tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, sodas, aguas,  helados,  entre otros productos de primera necesidad además de ciertos artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00  hasta muy  tarde en la noche, sus hijos le ayudan en su labor cuando ellos pueden y están desocupados de sus obligaciones, lleva más de 11  años con su negocio el cual le permite sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 7 años y le gusta porque con  los créditos ella mejora su negocio. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Twice a month the Community Bank La Immaculada meets in the town of Tosagua. It is known for being a lively town where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture or raise animals as the land is fertile.

48-year old Sra. Gladys lives in the town. She is married and has two children aged 20 and 19 who attend university. Her husband works as a driver.

Gladys runs a grocery from her house. She sells a variety of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, soft drinks, water, ice cream etc, as well as miscellaneous merchandise. She works there every day from 6 am until late at night. Her children help when they can and don't have other commitments.

Gladys has had the business for more than 11 years, and the money she earns helps support her children. She plans to use the loan money to buy more stock such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold meats, and other daily necessities. She has been part of the group for seven years and likes being a member as with the loans she can improve her business. Her future goals include continuing to work and seeing her children get good jobs.

loans.use: Buy more stock such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold meats etc.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Margie requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Margie has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is an enterprising man living in Hoima, Uganda. He sells soft drinks and produce. He started the business after realizing that farming alone could hardly meet his family's daily expenses due to its seasonal nature. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather changes pose challenges to his business growth, while his dream is to set up a food store that can sustainably supply his customers all year round.

Patrick is requesting for a loan to buy agricultural produce and soda to sell.

loans.use: to buy agricultural produce and soda to sell

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 39 years old, is divorced and has two daughters. She supports family through the income she earns from running a cafe in front of her house. She has been in this business for two years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Trang intends to take a loan to repair her shop and house. The repairs will enable her to improve her business and help her family improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her shop and her house

loans.name: Margaret's Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a member of this group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of 10 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 87 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Margaret has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving inputs for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 Kenyan shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Margaret is married and has 7 children.  She is 57 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Margaret has been a farmer for 30 years.  Margaret described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.
 							
Margaret first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Margaret joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed family and send children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Margaret plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Margaret’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.

Margaret and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is 29 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income through selling mobile phone components. Huong runs a beauty salon to earn a living. She started her business five years ago. She intends to take a loan to buy a scooter, which will help her to transport goods to her salon. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for transporting goods to work

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en: Thanh, 34, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. For the past year Thanh has been running a food stall in front of her house where she sells many kinds of dishes. She is requesting a loan to buy rice and raw food to make different dishes to sell, and also to buy a scooter for business transportation, which will help her to limit the time needed for preparing food to sell and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for transportation, as well as rice and raw food to make different dishes for selling.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Tuy, 47, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She earns an income running a beauty salon in front of her house. She started this business six years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of hair care products to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hair care products.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is 35 years old, and is married with two children. Her husband is a salesman. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past four years, Hong has been running a shop where she sells drinks such as milk and tea in front of her door. She started this business to help her cover her expenses and raise her children. Hong is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more flavoured milk and many kinds of soft drinks that she hopes will help to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy flavoured milk and soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of 6 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 73 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Joseph has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Joseph is 62 years old and has been a farmer for 46 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his eight children. The community and other farmers know Joseph as a friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and experienced farmer.

In addition to farming, he is also involved in community activities such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Joseph described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Joseph joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed his family. Because he is an active community member, Joseph wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Joseph has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Joseph's life because he has more profits from his harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support and is able to save money. In the future, Joseph hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, buy a goat, and invest in a business.

Joseph and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Renacer Con Fe Group

texts.es: Edith, quien en la fotografía aparece sentada de las primeras y con una blusa negra con flores rosadas, pertenece al Banco Comunal Renacer con Fe, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Acá los socios son la mayoría comerciantes ambulantes, vendedores en las ferias y además costureras. Edith trabajo 20 años en la Vega pero desde que fue en incendio, año 2009, dejo de tener su puesto en la Vega ya que los arriendos subieron mucho su precio, es por esto que decidió emprender de manera independiente y empezar a vender empanadas, humitas y sopaipillas. Su familia es muy emprendedora, ya que además sus hijos le han ayudado a salir adelante. El dinero que está solicitando es para poder comprar insumos como carne, aceite, harina, polos, choclos, ya que se ha quedado sin dinero para poder realizar sus comidas y venderlas. Espera que le vaya muy bien con las ventas porque su clientela le ha pedido productos, pero ella no tiene como realizarlos. Lo que más le ha gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de sentirse acompañada y apoyada por una institución, ha conocido mucha gente y eso la tiene muy contenta.
texts.en:
Edith, who appears seated in the front row of the photograph with a black shirt with pink flowers, belongs to the 'Renacer con Fe' Communal Bank in the city of Concepción. Most of the members here are itinerant business people, vendors in the markets and also seamstresses. 

Edith worked in La Vega for 20 years, but when there was a fire in 2009 she left her stall in La Vega because the landlords raised their prices a lot. This is why she decided to start a business in an independent manner and began to sell empanadas, tamales and sopapillas. Her family is very entrepreneurial; her children have also helped her to get ahead.

The money she is asking for is to be able to buy supplies like beef, oil, flour, chicken and corn, as she currently has no money to be able to make her foods and sell them. She hopes she does well with the sales, because her customers have asked her for products but she doesn't have any way to make them.

What she has liked most about working with Fondo Esperanza is feeling accompanied and supported by an institution. She has met a lot of people and that makes her very happy.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make empanadas, tamales and sopapillas

loans.name: Maudah

texts.en:
Maudah is a business woman in Ishaka Town and she has a retail shop which she operates six days a week. The retail shop is located along a highway and she started it in 1994 with the purpose of earning enough money to improve the living standards of her family. 

Maudah would like to use the loan money amounting to one million shillings to buy more stock for the shop so that she can make higher profits which will help her improve the standards of her family and expand her business in the long run. Her clients are mainly the people in Ishaka and the neighboring places. Her biggest challenge is lack of adequate capital, but she believes that this will be overcome if she gets the UGAFODE loan and she hopes that the standard of living of her family will improve with the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her retail shop

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a coffee grower in Bubaare - Ishaka and he has done this since 1993. He started growing coffee because he had hopes that he would earn enough profits from the business and be able to cater to the needs of his family. In addition to coffee growing, Moses also does mobile trade which boosts his income in a given period. He works two days on the coffee garden and concentrates on the mobile trade for the other days of the week. 

Moses would like to use the 500,000 shilling loan to buy mulches for the coffee garden so that he can have improved harvests. His clients are mainly people from the same local area and he believes that they have played an important role since they are ready for his products. He is very hard working.

loans.use: To buy mulches

loans.name: Kyewanula Kigasa Group

texts.en:
The group is composed mainly of women and a few men whose major activity is agriculture. They fall into different categories including divorcees, widows, single mothers and a few who are married.

Scovia is a single mother of four children. She is divorced from her husband, who had another wife. Her four children are all in school. In addition, she looks after her nephew who is an orphan.

Scovia is mainly an agriculturalist who grows crops and raises goats and chickens. She supplements the farming with income from a small retail shop. She resorted to farming in 2000 after separating from her husband so that she could fend for her children and take them to school. She does all this single handedly.

She will use the loan to buy goats and pigs to sell.  She will use the rest of the money to renovate her house, which is in a bad state, in preparation for Christmas. She is very hard working.

The third person standing behind, third right is the Ugafode Credit Officer.

loans.use: to buy goats and pigs

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a maize farmer who also deals in motorcyle taxi transport. He began his business to earn income to look after his family, and pay tuition for his children. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizer. 

He hopes to have a good maize plantation that attract more clients. His challenge is changes in climate. He is hard working.

In the photo is the client (left) and the Ugafode Credit staff in the client's maize garden.

loans.use: To buy fertilzer

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, a third time borrower who lives in a rural setting. All her children are attending schools.

She is an agriculturalist as well as businesswoman who has a kiosk that sells food and beverages as well as charcoal trade. She is also involved in agricultural activities. She has been in the above activities for the last five years and above.

According to her, through the above business she has been able to educate her children and has also improved her income. She actually used the previous loan to pay tuition. She will use this loan also to pay tuition for her daughter who is about to sit for her end of semester exams. She would otherwise miss the exams if she does not clear the tuition.

Mariam says her customers are basically people from the market area such as fellow traders and customers who come to buy foodstuffs. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost her businesses. She is described as a hardworking woman who has been able to achieve a lot from her strength. Finally, she appeals to fellow women to be innovative and hard working.

loans.use: to pay tuiton for her daughter.

loans.name: Queens Way Devt Group

texts.en:
Resty is a married mother of two and a member of Queens Way Development Trust. She operates a small shop along a high way in the outskirts of Kampala.

Resty is a hard working lady whose ambition and vision are to develop her shop to a wholesale level. Her major problem is limited income; she hopes that in future she can access more of the low interest loans to ably develop her business. She will use the loan to buy more goods to sell in the retail shop.

loans.use: To buy house hold use items for selling in the retail shop

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is 28 years old, married, with 3 children. She applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX, to improve on her salon. She has a challenge of low business turnover from the salon. She decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to buy more hair dryers for the salon and more products like hair oils and relaxers in order to have increased income. She wants to send her children to a better school with the increased profits.

loans.use: To buy a drier and more beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.en:
Passaic, New Jersey, is a city teeming with small businesses, and Brunilda is a proven businesswoman with a winning plan. She learned that barbers, beauty stylists, mortgage lenders and many other professionals need to take certification tests in order to operate legally. With these professions popping up on every street corner, Brunilda realized she could open a testing center to help these up-and-coming entrepreneurs pass their certifications.

With strong contacts among businesses in her community, she is confident her testing center will succeed. She will use this loan to purchase computers and office furniture needed for the testing center.

loans.use: to purchase computers and furniture for her testing center.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Bob is a proud, lifelong resident of the Jersey Shore with ample experience in construction. On October 12, 2012, he started his own business. Luck couldn’t have been worse—seventeen days later, Superstorm Sandy struck and wiped out everything Bob had. 

Although his family, home and business were all affected, Bob fought on. He is still rebuilding, but has succeeded in keeping his business running while employing four workers. Unfortunately, Bob is unable to bid for many big-ticket contracts because he lacks a Bobcat loader. With this piece of equipment, his business can take off and he can even take part in Sandy rebuilding contracts. 

He will use this loan to purchase a used Bobcat.

loans.use: to pay for a used Bobcat loader.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is a 41-year-old married woman.

Her financial condition is not good, so she has to think many times before starting any task. Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for many years (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw which consists of a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to bear jerks over roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles during driving. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto rickshaw.

She requested a loan so that her husband can maintain the rickshaw body so that he could drive it smoothly.

Yasmin thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a moto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda. He has one child. For the past two years, Sam has been working hard to manage his Electronics shop, which sells electronic materials. 

To help expand his business, Sam has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronic items, and will help Sam to generate greater profits and construct his residential house. Sam hopes that in the future he will be able to become the area electrical supplier. 

Sam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.


"

loans.use: to buy more electronic items to sell in his electronic shop.

loans.name: Ramulah

texts.en:
Ramulah is a hard-working woman.  Ramulah is 16 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the region of Iganga in Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  For the past two years, Ramulah has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which designs clothes. 

To help expand her business, Ramulah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more material and it will help Ramulah generate greater profits, which she will use to pay her school fees.  Ramulah hopes that in the future she will be able to open a boutique. 

Ramulah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy  more material.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She has a business of green bananas and has been in this business for five years. 

She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. 

She works at the market and sells at wholesale only six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring of owning a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to educate her children up to university. 

She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Marlin

texts.en: Marlin is 43 years old, a male and married. He has six (6) children 13, 11,9,7,5 and 3 years old respectively of whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer and he works as bodaboda (motorbike) business. He has been in this business for eight years based at Kijiwetanga. In his business he earns a monthly income of ksh.4200. He is taking his third loan of ksh.20,000 which he intends to use it in repair,servicing,buying spare parts and maintaining his motorbike.His previous loan of ksh.27500 paid back successfully. Marlin will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to educate his children and have a bright future.

loans.use: To do repairs, servicing, buying spare parts and maintaining his motorbike.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is 54 years old, a male and married. He has three children, ages 15, 10 and 8 years old, whom he supports. He is a farmer. He has been in this business for twelve years. In his business, he earns a monthly income of 4,550 Kenyan shillings. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer. He is taking out his first loan of 10,000 Kenyan shillings, which he intends to use to purchase farm inputs. Paul will use the anticipated profit to improve his farming. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to expand his farming and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs for his farming.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 35-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as a determined person. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell. 

She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are ordinary customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to reach the whole market and be more competitive within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Lery Lethy

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Lery, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos 28, 26 y 14 años de edad, la menor estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella.  Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Lery  tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual vende variedad de productos tales como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 21h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su esposo por su parte también tiene un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres en el mercado local negocio en el cual también invierten parte del crédito, ella lleva 6 años en su negocio el cual le da  ganancias por el bien de su familia y a su vez esta al tanto de su familia ya que tiene su negocio en casa.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar víveres, frutas y legumbres para el negocio del esposo. Está en el Grupo De Crédito 6 años y le gusta porque con uno de los  créditos empezó su negocio. Sus metas son darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
