La Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Tosagua. This city is known as a very dynamic place where the majority of the inhabitants engage in agriculture and animal raising. It is an area with great vegetation. Sra. Lery lives in this place. She is 48 years old, married and has three children, who are 28, 26 and 14 years of age. The youngest is in school and is the one who lives with her. Her husband is a trader.

Doña Lery has a store in her house where she sells a variety of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 11 p.m. and at times even later. Her husband also has a business selling fruit and vegetables in the local market. They will invest part of the loan in his business. She has run her business for 6 years. It not only generates an income for her family’s well being, but also allows her to tend her business and take care of her house at the same time. 

She will use the loan to stock her store. She will purchase supplies as well as fruit and vegetables for her husband’s business. She has been in this communal bank for 6 years and likes it because she began her business with one of the loans. Her goal is to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to purchase provisions as well as fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Timisewa

texts.en:
Timisewa is a twenty-nine year-old married man with four children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has been in the cocoa business for four years. Due to the desire to increase his income, he wants to expand his business and become a leading cocoa seller to the big companies that buy cocoa from Bundibugyo.  He gets additional income from selling fish, which is the main food source used by the natives. He is challenged by limited capital for expansion and the seasonal challenges that lessen his productivity.
Timisewa is asking for a loan to buy fish and cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy fish and  cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

She has operated a kerosene selling business for the past two years. She cites transportation costs as her major challenge.

She is requesting a loan to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of kerosene for resale

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a fifty-year-old married man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.He has six children who all go to school. He has a drug shop and has been in this business since 1999. He has other sources of income from cocoa harvests, plus his salary from his teaching job. 

He is challenged by his customers who do not pay on time while his dreams are to expand his drug shop business and educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification.

Ezekiel is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ma. Judea

texts.en:
Ma. Judea is 43 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Judea runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for ten years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like chips, spices, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Ma. Judea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like chips, spices, eggs, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para invertir en el negocio comprando pan, embutidos, aderezos, papas y bebidas, ya que son parte de los ingredientes necesarios para mantener su negocio activo y seguir teniendo los ingresos que necesita para cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Con el préstamo anterior adquirió la materia prima para su negocio, obtuvo más clientes satisfechos, mayores ventas y con sus ganancias ha podido cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Maria needs capital to invest into her business and buy bread, sausages, seasonings, potatoes, and drinks, which are part of the necessary ingredients to keep her business active and continue to have the income she needs for her household expenses.

She used the previous loan to buy supplies which led to more satisfied customers, increased sales, and her earnings allowed her to repay her debts.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is a 44-year-old woman. She lives with her son in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money through making and selling trowels for bricklayers. For seven years, she has run this business to support her family and feed her son. Huong would like a loan to purchase more materials to increase her production of trowels. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to increase her production of trowels.

loans.name: Mui

texts.en: Mui is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy a larger stock of materials to increase her production of slippers. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger stock of material to make slippers.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson is an old customer aged 35 years old, Married with 2 children, and  he deals with banana plantation. He applied for a loan of UGX.2000,000 to improve on his farming business. He has a challenge of low business turnover from his subsistence farming and low market purchase, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase on man power and expansion on both his farm land and agricultural. He hopes this will increase his business turn over. In the photograph is Nelson (center) his wife (left) and the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy mulches

loans.name: Yafesa

texts.en: Yafesa lives in the city outskirts and does welding to earn a living. He has a family of four children who are all in school. He is a trustworthy person whose hard work is paying off. He is mainly challenged by frequent power cuts which constantly disrupts his work. He needs money to buy iron sheets for his house so that he can stop renting and use the money he usually spends on rent to develop his business further. He is hard working.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets

loans.name: Abdiqadir Ali

texts.en: Abdiqadir Ali is a 24-year-old single boy. He studies Information Technology at Admas University College and he is also a cashier of Al-Xufad Primary Schools. He needs a laptop to prepare university assignments, read lessons when given in soft copy, and also to store data of the school.  His problem is that he has no laptop, and it’s difficult for him to have efficient practices. He would like to have a laptop as a loan. He requested a laptop from Kaaba and now he is waiting for it. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Abdiqadir will make monthly payments. After university, he hopes to work as an IT officer.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man who is 50 years old with children who are all in school.

Wilson rears cattle in Kagaramira village; he sells some cows to neighborhoods for slaughtering and to butchers from all corners. He also earns some money selling milk from the cows. He has been in this business for fifteen years. He also sells goats to add to his source of income. He wants a loan of 5,000,000 UGX to buy building materials for completion of his homestead so that he can conveniently house his children well. He will use the money from selling cows to repay the loan.

The major challenges of rearing cattle are diseases which attack the cows, competition, price fluctuations, and theft of cows. Wilson is a hardworking and self-motivated man.

His dream is to save up enough money to become an extensive agriculturalist.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Lovis

texts.en: Lovis is a repeat customer aged 33 years old, and she applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to improve on her business through buying more stock to adequately serve the needs of her customers. She has a challenge of low business turnover from her retail business, so she decided to come to UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for a loan to expand her business and in increase her profits in the long run. In the photograph is Lovis (right) with the Ugafode credit officer inside her retail shop.

loans.use: to buy retail stock for her store.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 43 years old and is married with three daughters. She and her husband have been running a shop from their house where they make and sew clothes for 7 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Mai is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of materials to increase her productions of clothes. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of materials to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 41 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. 

For this reason, Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to fix his rickshaw and wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. 

Safia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nuraddin

texts.en:
Nuraddin is 40 years old. He is married and the father of two school-aged children.

Nuraddin has worked very hard his whole life. He is a simple farmer who works tirelessly to provide for his family. Each year he sets some new goals for himself, and thanks to his perseverance he achieves them.

Nuraddin's objective is to be a serious farmer. With this goal in mind, he has requested a loan and he is hoping to receive your help. Having had cattle at home for domestic use for many years, he knows everything there is to know about livestock and raising cattle. He has to provide the animals' feed and will raise the crop himself this year, as the cost is expensive at the bazaar in cold months.

loans.use: To raise a crop of animal feed to provide for his animals.

loans.name: Badamgarvaa

texts.en:
Mr. Badamgarvaa, 53 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife has been working as a technologist at a cookies factory since 2007. He himself is a bus driver and has lots of experience. His daughter lives separately and is currently unemployed. 

So, he decided to provide a job opportunity to her daughter by launching a new business. He wants to rent a stall at a trade center and give his daughter the responsibility of selling clothes. For this cause, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT. The rent fee and the cost of buying clothes at wholesale are estimated to be around 4,000,000 MNT. 

Income generated by clothes sale will be split between him and his daughter. This business is very helpful because he will retire soon, and his daughter needs a job urgently.

loans.use: to buy clothes and pay the stall rent fee.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Ankhbayar, 29 years old, lives with her husband, two children, and mother-in-law in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been selling vegetables by renting a stall at a market since 2000. Her daughter studies at high school, and her son stays at home, cared for by her mother-in-law. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, and cabbages in large quantities. Then she will store them in a warehouse until next spring, when the price of vegetables increases. 

The borrower is very hardworking individual who is the main income generator for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables in large quantities.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap is 38 years old. He lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia, and is married with one child. 

Sopheap has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 per day. His wife, who joins him in the picture, is a garment worker who makes an income of $6 each day. To improve the family’s finances, Sopheap is requesting a loan of $1,400 to purchase cattle to breed for calves to sell. In addition, these cattle can be used for tilling his farmland. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business and send his child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed for calves to sell.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 37 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling vegetables and pork for more than ten years, earning approximately $8 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $7 each day. To improve her family’s finances, Mai asks for a loan of $700 to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she wants to build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to breed and resell when they gain weight.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Virginia dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 57  años de edad, es madre soltera de 6  hijos  mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos el cual es su compañía.
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora que le toco trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella antes preparaba alimentos en su casa y enviaba a entregar, hasta que con la ayuda de los créditos recibidos del grupo decidió arrendar un local y montar un pequeño restaurante, ella trabaja de jueves a domingo, prepara almuerzos y meriendas y los domingos solo meriendas, ella trabaja sola y tiene su comedor por más de 8  años, siempre le ha ido muy bien ya que sus clientes la prefieren por la sazón que le pone a sus platos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The La Inmaculada Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Tosagua.  This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants work in farming and livestock as it is an area with a lot of vegetation.

This is where María lives.  She is 57 years old and she is the single mother of six adult children.  One of her children lives with her and he keeps her company.  

María is a very hardworking woman who has had to work very hard to get her children ahead.  She used to make food at home to be delivered until, with the help of the loans she received from her bank, she decided to rent a space and set up a small restaurant.  She works Thursday through Sunday making prepared lunches and snacks and on Sundays only snacks.  She works by herself and she has had her restaurant for over eight years.  It has always done well for her because her customers prefer her for the way she seasons her dishes. 

She will use this loan to buy rice, meat, fish, and other supplies to make her prepared foods.  She has been with her communal bank from the beginning and she likes it because of the help it has given her to get ahead.  Her dream is to own her own space.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, fish, and other supplies

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit is 46 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She is married and she has two very pretty daughters; one of them has graduated medical college and her smaller daughter is a student of the Pedagogical Institute in Vanadzor city. Margarit’s husband is disabled and it is obvious that all the care of her family is on her woman's shoulders, and she manages to overcome all the problems because of her great will and love toward her family members. It has already been 10 years that she has been earning their living by running a clothes-trading business in a wholesale market of their city on a rented stall. She sells woman clothes, underwear, and night dresses. As she says, she always meets her customers with a smile and great wishes to help them with their choice of clothes. In her business her daughters help Margarit greatly.

She asks for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to buy a women's winter clothing collection, since now the demand is great.

loans.use: to buy women's winter clothes collection, since now the demand is great

loans.name: Ma. Nerrisa

texts.en:
Ma. Nerrisa is 38 years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

Ma. Nerrisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Ma. Nerrisa has been in this business for fuve years and sells a variety of items as retail. 

In the future Ma. Nerrisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, eggs, etc

loans.name: Zarah Jane

texts.en:
Zarah Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Zarah Jane requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc.

Zarah Jane has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Zarah Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, vegetables, meat, spices, etc

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan is a 48-year-old villager and a married father of four, living in a very rural area of south-central Albania. 

For about 15 years, he has been pursuing livestock and this has been the family’s source of income. In addition to selling raw milk, he’s been selling homemade cheese as well, and locals comment on his talents at making one of the best cheeses in their market. The market he has been selling in is a town in close proximity.

With this loan, Ramazan wants to build a stable for his animals. He has a goal for the near future -- to increase the number of animals to 50. Thus, the new stable would be big enough to fit all of these animals.

loans.use: to build a stable for 50 animals.

loans.name: Nui

texts.en: Nui is 35 years old and is married with three children, a son and two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. For seven years he and his wife have been running a shop from their house where they make and sew clothes. They started this business to cover their expenses and to generate income to raise their children. Nui is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a larger quantity of materials to increase his production of clothes. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities, and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more materials to increase his production of clothes.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is 42 years old and is married with three children, a son and two daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife has been running a food stall to support their family. Mai has run a business teaching music and selling musical instruments for 6 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and to generate income to raise his children. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying better quality musical instruments to increase the quality of his teaching. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his business activities, and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy better quality musical instruments for teaching.

loans.name: Metrine's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of nine group leader farmers in the Webuye District with Metrine selected as the Kiva representative.  Metrine has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 90 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Metrine is married and has 4 children.  She is 43-years-old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  Metrine has been a farmer for fifteen years.  Metrine described her harvest as poor last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

Metrine first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Metrine joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer, hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Metrine plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Metrine’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family.
 
Metrine and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 29 years old. She is married and lives with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a retired soldier who receives support of $4 daily from the government. Her children are garment workers. They earn about $7 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finance, Saroeun is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase materials to run a massage shop. By doing so, she will earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to run a massage shop.

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Net is 49 years old. She is married and lives with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are employed. They makes an income of $10 daily. 

To improve her family’s finances, Net is requesting a loan of $1,500 for her son to purchase a motorbike to re-sell. By doing so, her son will help generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for the family.

loans.use: purchase a motorbike for her son to re-sell.

loans.name: Sarann

texts.en:
Sarann is 54 years old. She is married and lives in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housekeeper. Her husband is a truck driver who makes an income of $10 per day. 

Sarann is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase spare parts to fix her husband’s truck. This money will help her husband’s delivery service improve and earn more income. In the future, she would like to purchase an excavator for renting out, and rebuild her house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to fix her husband's truck.

loans.name: Mourn

texts.en:
Mourn is 46 years old. She is married and lives with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling cakes and desserts for more than five years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a truck driver who makes an income of $5 each day. Her children are employed. They earn about $15 daily. 

Due to a lack of funds, Mourn is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase construction materials to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to run an additional business of raising poultry.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix her house.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta continua con la venta de comida y sigue atendiendo el restaurante y la pollería entonces ella tiene un pequeño local en la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a consumir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como verduras, carnes, pollos, papas, arroz y otras cosas más. 

Asunta nació en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco y vive junto con su familia en esta ciudad, ella tiene 53 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Asunta is continuing with her business selling food; she continues to tend to her restaurant and roasted chicken business.  She has a small restaurant in the city of Paucartambo where she sells her products. She manages the business and tends to her customers with friendliness and courtesy, which is why they always return to her business.  She's had this business now for a number of years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Asunta belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Carmen."  At this time, she needs a loan to buy supplies such as vegetables, meat, chicken, potatoes, rice, and other products.

Asunta was born in the beautiful city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.  She lives with her family in this city.  She is 53 years old, and is in a common-law marriage from which she has 6 children to provide for.

loans.use: to buy supplies (food products) for her restaurant

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is 42 years old. She is widowed and lives with five children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Four of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $20 each day. 

Due to the difficulty in her family’s transportation, Sorn is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This purchase will help her children commute to work on time and reduce transportation expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child gain a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Luz Alba

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 45 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos quienes son el motivo para trabajar día a día.
Tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en el campo de la confección, inició trabajando en diferentes empresas pero, luego de tener a su último hijo, tomó la decisión de independizarse y montar un taller de confección en su casa, para continuar siendo productiva, sin descuidar su hogar.
Actualmente presta el servicio de confección a terceros, quienes le llevan la producción a su hogar y casi todos los años adquiere un contrato grande para elaborar los uniformes de diferentes escuelas públicas de la ciudad.
Esta actividad ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos durante muchos años y Luz quiere dar permanencia y continuidad a su negocio, por ello solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, cierres, entre otros), esto le permitirá terminar a tiempo su producción y entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna a sus clientes, logrando adquirir nuevos contratos para seguir generando ingresos para su familia y para reinvertir capital en su negocio, pues quiere cumplir el sueño de tener su propia línea de producción de uniformes, garantizando una mayor rentabilidad para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz, who is 45 years old, is married and is the mother of three children, who are her motivation for working every day.

She has more than 20 years of experience in the field of dressmaking. She began working in different businesses, but after having her youngest son, she decided to become independent and set up a dressmaking workshop in her home, in order to continue being productive without neglecting her household.

Now she offers dressmaking services to third parties, who bring the work to her home, and almost every year she gets a big contract to make the uniforms of various public schools in the city.

This business has been her principal source of income for many years, and Luz wants to give permanence and continuity to her business. To do that, she is applying for a loan to invest in the wholesale purchase of supplies (fabrics, thread, buttons, and fasteners, among other items). This will allow her to finish her production on time and turn over the orders to her customers in a timely manner, thus succeeding in acquiring new contracts to continue generating income for her family and to reinvest capital in her business, since she wants to achieve her dream of having her own line of production of uniforms, guaranteeing a better profitability to offer better living conditions to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (fabrics, thread, buttons, fasteners, etc.)

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling purified water in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Julieta is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of purified water to sell to customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of purified water to sell.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en: Melody is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, coffee, noodles, canned goods, etc. Melody has been in this business for 3 years. In the future Melody would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie is married with four children. She is 43 years old and has three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, chips, eggs, noodles, soft drinks, etc. Rosemarie has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, 46 years old, is married and has two daughters. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family through the income she earns from a shop selling soft drinks and coffee. She has been in this business for 17 years. Lan intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy soft drinks to sell at her shop. The additional capital will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is 51 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City.  Yen runs a business making and sewing clothes at home. She started her business 5 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger quantity of fabric and sewing materials to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Chau

texts.en: Chau, 39, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. Chau has been running a food stall in front of her house for 18 years. She sells many kinds of soups, meals and noodles for people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different foods like fish, meat, vegetables and better quality ingredients to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy meat, fish, rice, vegetables, and better quality ingredients.

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men would like to take a further loan to buy more clothes to sell from her stall. Men's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: Cornelio continua dedicándose a la venta de carne de corderos, vacuno, porcino, pollo, pescado y res, él tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos y el puesto de venta esta implementado con la necesidad básicas, él administra su negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a comprar al puesto de venta. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar carne. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Cornelio is continuing with his business selling lamb, beef, pork, chicken, fish, and other meats.  He has a small sales stall in one of the markets of the city of Paucartambo where he sells his products.  The stall is equipped with the basic necessities. He manages his business and tends to his customers with a lot of kindness and courtesy, and for this reason they always come back to buy at his stall. He has been in this business for several years, and it is going very well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. He belongs to the communal bank “Mamacha Carmen” and on this occasion he needs a loan to purchase meat. He is grateful for and values the loan, and he is committed to making his monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy meat

loans.name: Oeurn

texts.en:
Oeurn is 56 years old. She is widowed and resides with one child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her child is a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. 

To improve her family’s finance, Oeurn is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase farmland to expand her business. By doing so, she will generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house.

loans.use: to purchase farmland to expand her business

loans.name: Lot

texts.en:
Lot is 59 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $12 each day. 

To improve her family’s livelihood, Lot is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase farmland for rice cultivation. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for rice cultivation

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is married to a farmer who operates a little farm for a living. She helps by growing and harvesting bananas, and she earns well for the family. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) and has borrowed a new loan to buy fertilizer and pay for the replanting cost for bananas. 

She is hopeful to gain more profit from her farm to pursue their plan of having a general store in the future

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for the replanting cost for bananas.

loans.name: Reth

texts.en:
Reth is 45 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a soldier who makes an income of $3 each day. One of her children is also employed in a garment factory and earns about $4 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Reth is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase timber to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase farmland to cultivate rice and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase timber to build a new house

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.en:
Feliciano is operating his own farm to make  a living. He has been doing this for more than ten years, earning well for the family. He has joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has borrowed a loan to finance the costs of weeding his farm.

He is determined to gain more profit from his farm with his effort and the investments he had provided. In the future, Feliciano wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to finance the costs of weeding his farm

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 49 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Angelita has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

Angelita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Amira

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 76 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tienen 9 hijos mayores de edad,  dos de ellos aun viven en su casa.
Doña Rosa al verse sola después de la muerte de sus marido le toco trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos, gracias a Dios y a la ayuda de los créditos ella logro sacarlos adelante ya que ahora son mayores de edad y se defienden por si solos, ella tiene un pequeño quiosco en el cual por las noches vende comida, con ella trabaja uno de sus hijos que es el encargado de vender en el lugar mientras ella prepara los alimentos en su casa, prepara los deliciosos secos de gallina, arroz con menestra y carne, empanadas de verde entre otros alimentos que son del agrado de sus clientes, lleva más de 20 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, gallinas y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The "La Inmaculada" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Tosagua. This city is known for it's dynamism. The majority of it's inhabitants work in agriculture or raise animals, it being an area of lush vegetation.

Rosa lives here. She is 76 years old. Her husband died a number of years ago but she has 9 children from this union, two of which still live at home. Rosa seeing herself as being alone with the passing of her husband had to work very hard to get on with her children. Thanks to God and the loans she managed to get them ahead and now they are all adults and can fend for themselves. 

Rosa has a small kiosk where she sells meals at night. One of her children is in charge of selling the meals while she prepares the food at home. She makes delicious chicken stews, rice with legumes and meat, green empanadas along with other dishes that are enjoyed by her clients. She has been doing this for 20 years and it has allowed her to get ahead. 

Rosa will use this loan to buy rice, meat, chicken and other foodstuffs for the preparation of her meals. She has been with this communal bank since it's inception. She likes it for the help it provides through the loans. Her dream is to own her own business location.

loans.use: to buy rice, meat, chickens and other foods.

loans.name: Eudosia Orolia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Eudosia, tiene 77 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tienen 10 hijos mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Eudosia es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta  salir adelante ella por sus propios medios, se dedica a vender zapatos de todo tipo y modelos, ella desde que tenía 18 años empezó con este negocio, vende puerta a puerta ya que le gusta salir a vender sus productos ya que de esta forma se gana su sustento diario y se entretiene realizando sus recorridos. 
Este crédito es para comprar zapatos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le han brindado en todo este tiempo para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the communal bank "La Inmaculada" meets every 15 days.  This place is known for being very dynamic.  Most of the residents work in agriculture or raise animals, as this is an area with a lot of vegetation.  

This is where Eudosia, 77, lives.  A number of years ago her husband died, but from that marriage she has 10 grown children who are independent.

Eudosia is a very hardworking woman who likes to get ahead through her own efforts.  She has a business selling all types and models of shoes.  Eudosia started out in this business when she was 18 years old selling door-to-door. She liked going out to sell her products because in this way she could earn money to support herself, and she enjoyed going around to sell her products.

This loan will be used to buy shoes.  Eudosia has been in her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help that she's gotten over time that has allowed her to get ahead.  Her dream is to have good health so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Carmen Presentacion

texts.es: Carmen Presentación tiene 59 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, adorno, ferretería, artefactos, repuestos de carros y otras cosas  más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo clavos, jaboncillos, cortones, tarjetas, audífonos y entre otras cosas más.
texts.en: Carmen Presentación is 59 years old, married, and has four children.  She sells cleaning products,  decorations, hardware, artefacts, car parts, and other things.  She has had this business for several years and things are going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into her work.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she is asking for a loan to buy nails, soaps, cards, headphones, and other things.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y por el apoyo brindado pues desea continuar participando en este proyecto porque pudo incrementar el capital del negocio, ella continua con la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo habas, cebada, papa entonces ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Paucartambo donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a consumir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos como por ejemplo maíz, habas, cebada, trigo,  y otras cosas más. 

Pilar nació en la ciudad de Sicuani pero vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 53 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Pilar thanks the lenders for this loan and for the support being provided, as she wants to continue participating in this project because she was able to increase the capital in her business.  She is continuing with her business selling dried grains such as beans, barley, and potatoes.  She now has a small sales stand in the market of the city of Paucartambo where she sells her products.  She runs the business and tends to customers very kindly and courteously, which is why they always return to buy from her.  She's had this business for a number of years  now, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  Pilar belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Carmen."  At this time, she needs a loan to buy dried grains such as corn, beans, barley, wheat, and other grains.

Pilar was born in the city of Sicuani, but she lives with her family in the beautiful city of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco.  She is 53 years old and is in a common-law marriage that produced 3 children who she helps to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy dry grains like corn, lima beans, barley, wheat and others.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn runs a retail business in their community to make a living. She has been selling woven nipa for many years and she earns enough for their daily needs. She borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro finance to buy additional palm leaves and woven nipa to resell in order to gain more returns. In the future, she wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional palm leaves and woven nipa to resell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She has a food production business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Gemma is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Odinakhan

texts.ru: Одинахан 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Старшая дочь замужем, остальные школьники. У Одинахан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Одинахан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Все дети и супруг вовлечены в сельском хозяйстве и помогают на поле. Благодаря упорному труду Одинахан и ее семьи, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 25 овец, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,08 ГА, на которой выращивает кукурузу, клевер - для обеспечения скота необходимыми кормами, а также рис на продажу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Одинахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку легкового авто для использования в сельском хозяйстве, транспортировка сельхозудобрений, урожая для продажи на рынках, а также перевозка скота на скотный рынок на продажу. Наличие собственного автотранспорта позволит Одинахан сэкономить на перевозке урожая. У Одинахан появится возможность довозить сельхозпродукцию до самого выгодного покупателя. Доходы от кредита Одинахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Odinakhan is 43 years old, married and together with her husband is raising 4 children.  Her oldest daughter is married, but the rest of her children are still in school.  Odinakhan has a high school education.  As a main source of income, Odinakhan raises livestock and grows crops, a business that she started 23 years ago with a purchase of cattle for 8,000 som (KGS).  All of her children and her spouse are involved in helping her with the farm work.  Thanks to Odinakhan's hard work, she now has three milking cows and 25 sheep.  She also has a 1.08 hectares of land where she grows corn and clover for the cattle feed as well as rice for sale.  Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).  

In order to expand her business, Odinakhan turned to the microfinance bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase a car.  The car is needed to transport harvested crops and cattle to the market for sale.  Having her own means of transport, will allow Odinakhan to save on the transporting costs and will give her the opportunity to reach her best customers.  Profits from her business, Odinakhan is planning to re-invest into her enterprise and to set some aside for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase a car so she can transport crops and cattle to the market

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and married, with eight children.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid no fewer than 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from boarding house.

Evelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao is requesting a new loan to buy paper, materials, and printing equipment. 

Thao's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy paper, materials, and printing equipment

loans.name: Hudson's Group

texts.en:
Hudson is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of 9 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 99 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Hudson has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Hudson is married and has three children. He is 71 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community activities in groups, such as the savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Hudson has been a farmer for 18 years. He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

Hudson first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Hudson joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Hudson plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home and save for the future. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Hudson’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.
  							
Hudson and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.
							
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en:
Cuc is 36 years -old and married. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a bricklayer. 

For 17 years, Cuc has run a general store at her house. She sells milk, beverages, stationery, confectionery, and some household electrical goods. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of products to sell, such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy groceries, such as eggs, sugar, and sanitation items.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a member of this group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 72 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  

Jane has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Jane is 52 years old and has been a farmer for 17 years.  Jane works as a farmer to provide for her six children.  The community and other farmers know Jane as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  Other than farming, she is also involved in her community groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group and burial committee.  

Jane described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
							
Jane first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Jane joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer, hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed family.  She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  

Jane plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business.  She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Jane’s own life was improved because she has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money, and feed the family. 
 
Jane and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nim

texts.en:
Nim, 42, is a farmer from a rural village in Prey Chhor district in Kampong Cham province. She is a widow who lives with an adult son who is a construction worker.

Nim is the family's main breadwinner. She farms rice to cover her family’s needs and also works as a wedding chef in her village.

To continue running her farm in a sustainable way, Nim is asking for a 1,000,000 KHR loan through HKL to buy a plot of land to enlarge her farm. She hopes to have an abundant harvest through this investment so she can increase her income and meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Den

texts.en:
Den is 40 years old and is married. She has a daughter and a son, and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a local factory. 

She has run a shop selling beverages, fruit juice and coffee at her house for 20 years. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of beverages, fruit juice and coffee to sell at her shop.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy beverages, fruit juice and coffee for selling at her shop.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet, 62, is married and has four children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a security guard. 

Tuyet started a shop selling beverages three years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of beverages to restock her shop and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
This is Soledad. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy products for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, for 18,000 PHP, to buy various products to sell in her business, including newspapers, cigarettes and beverages. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Soledad hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a new house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various products to sell in her business, including newspapers, cigarettes and beverages.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 43 years old and is married with two children, a son and a daughter. He and his wife have been running a food stall to sell fish noodles in front of their door for twelve years. He started this business to cover his expenses and to generate income to raise his children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a better quality of fish, noodles, vegetables, and new furniture. He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business. 

He hopes that through the loan, he will be able to expand his business activities and have money to reinvest in his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish, noodles, vegetables, and new furniture for his food stall.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is married and blessed with two children. She manages a retail store and sells a variety of products such as rice, canned goods, sugar, beverages, breads, chips, cooking oil, and  food seasonings. 

Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 33,000 to buy additional grocery items to display and offer in her retail store. She works hard on this business so that she can able to give her children the basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to display and offer in her retail store.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Dinah works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming rice. Dinah is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dinah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet, who is married,  manages a retail business for a living. She has been doing this for many years, selling rice and different kinds of grocery goods and she earns well for their daily needs. 

She had joined Gata Daku Multi Purpose Cooperative and had borrowed a loan to buy additional bags of rice to resell. She wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of rice to resell

loans.name: Lolakhan

texts.ru: Лолахан 44 года, замужем воспитывает троих детей. Супруг находится на заработках в России, так как здесь у себя на Родине не смог найти подходящую работу, чтобы обеспечить семью. Ежемесячно высылает семье в Кыргызстан большую часть своей зарплаты для поддержания своей семьи. А Лолахан в это время не сидит сложа руки, а занимается торговлей фруктов и овощей с 2004 года, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 4,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Лолахан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Лолахан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - для оптовой покупки фруктов и овощей, для дальнейшей розничной продажи населению. Доходы от кредита Лолахан планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на проведение свадебного торжества для старшего сына.
texts.en: Lolakhan is 44 years old, married and has three children.  He husband is currently working abroad, in Russia, because he could not find an adequate job at home to be able to provide for his family.  Each month, he sends the bulk of his earnings back to his family in Kyrgyzstan. For her part, Lolakhan is not sitting on her hands, she has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2004, using an initial sum of 4,000 som (KGS) as her start-up capital.  Lolakhan was able to grow her business to a point where she now has permanent clients and is making 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further expand her business, Lolakhan turned to the mircofinance bank of Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables that she can resell.  Some of the profits from her business, Lolakhan is planning to reinvest back into her enterprise and save the rest for the wedding celebration of her oldest son.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for reselling

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 41 years old and widowed with three children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlyn has been in this business for 14 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Arlyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Pictured in his workshop, Yousef is a 33-year-old man from a small village near Bethlehem. He was married recently and now lives with his wife in a rental in the village.

For the past ten years Yousef has been working in a blacksmith shop he owns. He learned to be a blacksmith from his father. His business is good and earns him a good income, but he would like to make some improvements.

Yousef is applying for a 3,000 USD loan through FATEN to buy new equipment and machinery for his workshop. This will help him to increase both his productivity and income.

loans.use: to buy new equipment and machinery for his workshop.

loans.name: Mayra Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Mayra, tiene 28 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 11, 9 y 3 años de edad,  los dos mayores  estudian en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Mayra con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudar a su marido a salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, allí en su hogar ella también se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos lo cual no le quita mucho tiempo y le deja ingresos extra que le sirven para los estudios de sus hijos ya que esto es lo más importante para ella. Tiene 8 años dedicada al comercio y a la cría de animales mucho más.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, ropa de niños y zapatos para aprovechar la temporada que es cuando mas vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Su sueño es darle lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This area is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents are farmers and raise animals.  It’s an area of great vegetation.

Mayra lives here.  She is 28 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children, ages 11, 9, and 3.  The two oldest ones attend school and the youngest attends kindergarten.  Her husband is a driver.

Mayra sells clothing and shoes or all types, so that she can earn some money and help her husband with the household expenses.  She sells door to door and also out of her home, where other customers go.  She also raises chickens and pigs, which takes lots of time but provides her extra income which she uses to pay for her children’s education, which is the most important thing for her.  She has been a merchant for eight years and raising animals even longer. 

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, children’s clothing, and shoes to take advantage of the season when her sales are greatest.  She has been with the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the loans help her finance her business.  Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of PHP 7,000 to buy bread and beverages to sell. Mary Ann's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business in order to meet her customers' demands. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bread and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta works hard to support her family. Loreta is married, and she has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell.  She has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Loreta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rovilla

texts.en: Rovilla has been operating a general store for many years and earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan from GDMPC. She used her previous loan to improve her business. Recently, she borrowed a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to resell. She always finds ways to augment their living situation. In the future, she wants to expand her business to have a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 40 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cresilda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cresilda has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Paz

texts.en:
Ma. Paz is 56 years old, married and has five children, one of whom is in school.

Ma. Paz is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Paz has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Paz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dalia Lucía

texts.es:
Dalia, a sus 53 años de edad, es madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar luego del fallecimiento de su esposo.
Luego de muchos años de trabajar en una empresa, se quedó sin empleo y debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares, estaba buscando oportunidades de negocio, por medio de un hermano se involucró en la producción y distribución de cubos de azúcar, su negocio lo inició en un municipio del oriente antioqueño, pues allí los costos de producción eran más bajos que en la ciudad, trabaja todos los días y la producción es vendida en diferentes cafeterías, restaurantes y tiendas de la región.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar insumos al por mayor y para pagar el trámite para obtener el registro INVIMA exigido por las autoridades competentes para poder distribuir bien sus productos, esto le permitirá acreditar mejor su negocio y se dará a conocer su marca y sus productos, mejorando notablemente las ventas y los ingresos para su familia.
De esta forma, Dalia desea seguir trabajando para sacar adelante su negocio, posicionar su marca y comenzar a distribuir sus productos en otras ciudades, así garantizará una mayor rentabilidad y estabilidad económica para disfrutar un mejor bienestar y condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dalia, who is 53 years old, is the mother of a son and the head of her household, following the death of her husband.

After many years of working in a business, she was left without a job, and due to the need to generate income to pay the family expenses, she was looking for business opportunities. Through a brother, she became involved in the production and distribution of sugar cubes. She began her business in a  town in eastern Antioquia, since the productions costs there were lower than in the city. She works every day, and her products are sold in different cafeterias, restaurants, and shops in the region.

Now she is applying for the help of a loan in order to buy supplies wholesale and to pay the fees to obtain the health department registration required by the relevant authorities in order to be able to distribute her products more widely. This will allow her to strengthen her business more and have her brand name and her products become known, substantially improving their sales and the income for her family.

In this way, Dalia wants to continue working to advance her business, position her brand, and begin to distribute her products in other cities. Thus she will guarantee better profitability and economic stability to enjoy greater well being and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies and pay the fees to obtain health department registration

loans.name: Othman

texts.en:
Othman is a 39 years old married man from Bethlehem city. He is a father for three sons and one daughter. for the bas few years, Othman decided to buy a small booth to sell soft drinks and light sandwiches in the main street. It is a good business and he has his loyal customers. Othman would like to develop his booth but he does not have enough money

Othman took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a machine for hot drinks. This will develop his booth and also his income. 
Othman appears in the photo in front of his booth.

loans.use: to buy a machine for hot drinks for his booth

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
