Vanny is 39 years old. She is married and resides with a two-year-old child in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been running a tailoring shop for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a policeman who makes an income of $4 daily. 

To improve her family’s finance, Vanny is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a farmland to use for rice farming. By doing so, she will be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a farmland to use for rice farming.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
Emilia agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, detergentes, gaseosas y pan entonces ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde expende sus productos por lo tanto ella administra el negocio y a tiende a sus clientes con mucha amabilidad y cortesía por ese motivo siempre regresan a consumir. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar fideos, detergentes, gaseosas y otras cosas más para incrementar el capital del negocio. 

Emilia vive junto con su familia en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos a quienes saca adelante.
texts.en:
Emilia is grateful to the lenders for the loan and she is happy for the support.  She continues to sell primary needs products such as rice, sugar, noodles, detergents, soft drinks, and bread.  She has a small store in her home where she sells her products.  She manages it and serves her customers in friendly and courteous way.  For this reason the always return to buy from her.  She has had this business for several years and things are going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she needs a loan to buy noodles, detergents, soft drinks, and other things to increase her working capital.

Emilia lives with her family in the lovely city of Paucartambo, within the Cusco department.  She is 38 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has three children.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan helps her husband manage their farm. She also operates a general store where she spends most of her time. Her previous loan from GDMPC was used for additional capital for the business and she successfully repaid it. 

Susan requested another loan, which she will use to purchase additional grocery items to sell. She always wants to improve her business and use her earnings for her children's studies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 37, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Her husband earns money through his business repairing scooters. Mai helps her husband to sell spare parts and also is running a food stall to sell breads with pork to support her family. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of spare-parts to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy spare-parts to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong would like to take a further loan to buy more materials to make clothes to sell from her stall. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials for making clothes.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María es una madre soltera de 3 hijos a los que sacó adelante con gran esfuerzo y compromiso. 
Se dedica hace varios años a trabajar en un parqueadero lavando carros y de manera independiente vende comidas rápidas en las tardes, con el fin de complementar los ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos de su hogar.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas, desechables, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer la demanda y mejorar las ventas.
María tiene como proyecto para un futuro a mediano plazo poder adquirir su casa propia, en la cual pueda brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, para ello manifiesta que seguirá trabajando arduamente para seguir avanzando hacia el cumplimiento de su sueño.
texts.en: María is a single mother of three kids for whom she has progressed with great strength and commitment. She has worked several years in a car lot washing cars, and independently, she sells fast food in the afternoons with the goal of supplementing her income to settle her basic household expenses. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of wholesale supplies (bread, cold cuts, salsas, sodas, disposable wares, among others). This will allow her to be able to have available the products to meet the demand and improve her sales. María has as a project for the near future to be able to acquire her own house in which she can afford her children a better quality of life. For this to happen she will continue working hard to continue advancing to the pursuance of her dream.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (bread, cold cuts, salsa, sodas, disposable wares, among others)

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.
 
Ahlam is a 30-year-old married woman from a small village near Tulkarm city. She is a mother of ten children; six sons and four daughters. Ahlam's husband is a worker in the construction field with a very low and unstable income, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He also has been working as a farmer for four years. He takes care of the olive trees he has. He sells the olive oil outside the city, and exports part of it outside Palestine.
 
Ahlam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband buy more olive seedlings to expand his farm. By taking this loan, the family's income and their living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to help her husband buy more olive seedlings to expand his farm.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy more kinds of soft drinks, such as green tea and flavored drinks. Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy green tea and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en: Jenalyn operates a retail store in her village.  She is married and blessed with two children. She has been selling provisions for a year. The income she makes from her sales is used to pay school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips and food seasonings for her business.

loans.name: Miriam Cielo

texts.es:
Miriam, a sus 44 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 hijos por los que continúa luchando para sacar adelante.
Hace más de 23 años se ha dedicado a trabajar en el campo de las ventas, inició en un negocio que era propiedad de su suegra, tiempo después trabajó como empleada en otros almacenes y, en el año 2008, con el ánimo de generar mejores ingresos y de estar más tiempo con su familia, comenzó su propio negocio, una papelería, en la que además ofrecía servicio de fotocopias, fax y vendía cosméticos y accesorios; su negocio tuvo muy buena acogida en el sector y hace dos años le incluyó el servicio de confección aprovechando que estudió técnica en diseño de modas, por ello vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y presta el servicio de arreglos de modistería, así ha logrado generar los recursos económicos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
El crédito lo solicita para comprar una máquina recubridora e insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos y botones) y artículos de papelería (cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, cartulina, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y con la máquina optimizará mejor el tiempo de producción y podrá entregar los pedidos con una terminación de excelente calidad, así mejorará no solo las ventas de papelería, sino la prestación de sus servicios.
Miriam tiene como proyecto para el futuro, la acreditación y el crecimiento de su negocio y generar oportunidades de empleo, pues ha tenido muy buena acogida en el sector y cree que podría aumentar la rentabilidad con la expansión del mismo, así podrá ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Miriam at 44 years of age is married and is the mother of three children for whom she keeps struggling to get ahead. For more than 23 years she has been working in the field of sales. She began in a business that belonged to her mother-in-law. Later she worked as an employee in other stores. In the year 2008 with the desire to generate more income and spend more time with her family she opened a stationary shop. It also offered photocopying and fax services and she sold cosmetics and accessories. Her business was well received in the area and two years ago she added sewing services taking advantage of having studied fashion design. She sells the dresses she makes herself and also does alterations of clothing. Doing this she makes the money to help her husband with the finances of the household.  

The loan Miriam is requesting is to buy a wrapping machine (an industrial sewing machine) and supplies wholesale (fabric, thread and buttons) and stationary items (notebooks, pens, markers, Bristol board, etc.). This will allow her to continue her work and with the machine she can minimize the production time and deliver the products with a high quality finish. So she will not only increase the sales of stationary but improve her services.

Miriam sees in the future the strengthening and expansion of her business generating employments opportunities. She has been well-received in the field and believes that she can improve the profitability with an expansion. She can then provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a wrapping machine (an industrial sewing machine) and supplies wholesale (fabric, thread and buttons) and stationary items (notebooks, pens, markers, Bristol board, etc.)

loans.name: José León

texts.es:
José se dedica hace muchos años a trabajar de manera independiente, realiza todos los trámites ante la secretaria de tránsito, imprentas, traspasos, entre otros; aprendió la actividad de manera empírica y trabaja en el mismo horario de tránsito.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos (papelería y tinta para la máquina), esto le permitirá continuar prestando sus servicios y mejorar la calidad del mismo, obteniendo como resultado un incremento en sus ingresos.
José manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es continuar acreditando su negocio y más adelante tener la capacidad para instalar una oficina donde pueda ofrecer sus servicios de trámites y asesorías.
texts.en:
José has worked on his own for many years. He does all kinds of paperwork for the Secretary of Transportation such as printing, transfers, and more. He learned this activity empirically and works the same schedule that they keep.  

The loan he asked for will be invested in buying materials (paper and typewriter ink). This will allow him to continue offering his services and improve their quality, obtaining an increase in income. 

José says that his biggest wish is to continue financing his business and in the future having the capacity of installing an office where he can offer his paperwork and assistance services.

loans.use: to buy materials (paper and typewriter ink).

loans.name: Adresita

texts.en:
Adresita is married and has five children. She manages her piggery business to make a living, which she has been doing for six years. She earns a good living from this business and wants to expand it. 

Adresita requested a loan from GDMPC, which she will use to buy piglets. She hopes to improve her business and renovate her house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase piglets

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Psychology in Ozamiz City. She is married and she wants to pursue her education for a better living with her family in the near future. With Gata Daku Multi- Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) her dreams would be realized. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to cover the cost for miscellaneous school expenses. She wants to work successfully after finishing her course.

loans.use: to cover the cost for miscellaneous school expenses

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa, 49, is married and has two children. She lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Hoa has been running a shop, selling soft drinks in front of her house for 30 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more different soft drinks to better satisfy her customers. She will also use part of the loan to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and generates a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua con la venta de verduras, granos secos y crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella compra de diferentes agricultores de Paucartambo verduras como por ejemplo cebollas, zanahorias, repollo, habas, tomates y otros para luego llevarlos y  repartirlos en el valle de Kosñipata entonces al terminar de repartir y vender con el nuevo capital  ella compra frutas para después distribuirlo a diferentes revendedoras del mercado de Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar productos secos y frutas.
texts.en: Fernanda is grateful to the lenders for the loan and she is happy for the support.  She continues to sell vegetables, dried grains, and raise small animals such as Guinea pigs.  She buys things like onions, cabbage, lima beans, tomatoes, and other things from different Paucartambo farmers and delivers then in the Kosñipata valley.  When she is finished delivering and selling, she uses the new capital to buy fruit to later distribute to different resellers in Paucartambo  She has had this business for several years and says that things are going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen “ communal bank and needs this loan to buy dry goods and fruit.

loans.use: to buy dry goods and fruit.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is married with three children and helps his wife in managing their own retail store, aside from his transportation service business, to make a living. He earns well from this business so that he is able to provide for his family. James borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy additional grocery goods to resell.  In the future, James wants to have an improved living situation with his family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en: Ronnie is married with three children and operates a business buying and selling motorcycles to make a living.  He has been doing this for ten years and he earns well from the business. Ronnie borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance for additional capital for his motorcycle buying and selling business. He wants to improve his business and is hopeful enough to gain more profit to buy another unit for the family.

loans.use: to buy and sell motorcycles

loans.name: Graciela Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Graciela, tiene 66 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen siete hijos  mayores de edad e independientes, una hija vive cerca de su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Graciela es una gran esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su marido en su negocio, el tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad de  en el que vende frutas y legumbres. Trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 16h00, el se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos para poder vender y tener para el sustento diario, tienen  5 años con este negocio y a pesar de que el trabajo es duro y sacrificado tiene que hacerlo para poder tener para el pan diario.
Este crédito es para  comprar frutas y legumbres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 5 años  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudarle a su marido y así juntos salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  This area is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents are farmers and raise animals.  It’s an area of great vegetation.

Graciela lives here.  She is 66 years old, married, and has seven adult children on their own.  One of her daughters lives near her.  Her husband is a merchant.

Graciela is a good wife who is asking for this loan to help her husband with his business.  He has a stall in the city market, where he sells fruits and vegetables and works from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm.  He goes to the main market at dawn to buy the best products so he can sell them to earn daily sustenance.  They have been doing this for five years.  Even though it’s a hard business that demands lots of sacrifice they must do it to bring home the bacon.

This loan will help buy fruits and vegetables.  She has been with the communal bank for five years and she likes it because she can help her husband with the loans and they can get ahead together.  Her dreams are for good health for herself and hers.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 
Hind is a 25 years old married woman from Jabalia city. she is a mother for two small kids; a son and a daughter. Hind's husband works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income, which is not enough to cover all the family needs. He has also worked in painting houses for four years, it is a good business and helps the family in part of their expenses. 
Hind took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy new tools for his painting business. by taking this loan, the family income will be improved and also their living conditions.

loans.use: to help her husband to buy new tools for his painting business

loans.name: Serjantsan

texts.en:
Mr. Serjantsan is 48 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in their Ger (traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife runs a small business of traditional boots and costume production by order at home. His daughter is 12 and a local school student.
 
Serjantsan has been providing transportation services business between soums (districts), and runs an animal pelt and other livestock parts retail at the local market. He is a hardworking person who is passionate about his family's bright future. 

He is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of animal pelt and other items to resell to local manufacturers.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of animal pelt and other items to resell to local manufacturers.

loans.name: Jesica

texts.es: Jesica agradece a los inversionistas por el apoyo brindando y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado, ella continua trabajando en una entidad del estado en el área de gerencia municipal pero requiere el préstamo para uso personal, ella estudio la carrera técnica de analista de sistemas entonces el dinero del préstamo es para pagar su matrícula del curos de especialización, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: Jesica is grateful to the lenders and is happy for the support.  She continues to work for a state agency in municipal management and needs a loan for personal use.  She is studying for a technical systems analyst career and she will use the money to pay for her tuition for her specialty courses.  She is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and she is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her monthly payments responsibly and on time.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Donnaviel

texts.en:
Donnaviel is married, with one child. She helps her husband in their motorcycle selling business to make a living. Her husband is also an official in their village. 

Donnaviel has received a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to buy another motorcycle to resell. She dreams of having more sales to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle to resell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda owns and operates a snack-food vending stand in the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than three years, earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, used for purchasing ingredients. 

Recently, Rosalinda has taken out a new loan to purchase raw ingredients to prepare assorted snacks in order to meet orders and customers' demands. Her hopes and dreams are to have a better future and improve her living situation.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients to prepare assorted snacks for sale

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 34-year-old lady. She is living with her son and daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband is a turner by profession; he manufactures and renews the spare parts of vehicles. He has been operating a lathe machine for many years and can easily renew or manufacture the spare parts of various vehicles. 

His lathe machine has become out of order due to continuous work, and it needs maintenance. He has spent all his savings to buy a cast iron to manufacture spare parts and does not have money to fix the lathe machine. Therefore, Asia requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and buy cutting tools. 

She is relaxed now because she hopes that her husband can easily operate his lathe machine again. Asia is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine and buy additional cutting tools.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu, 46 years old, is married and has two sons. She and her husband supports family through the income they earns from selling food at their stall. They have begun this business for 25 years. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dieu intends to take a loan to increase her working capital to buy furniture for her food stall and pay school fees for her children. The new furniture will enable her to attract more customers to her stall. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her food stall and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Gannorov

texts.en:
Mr. Gannorov is 52 years old and lives with his wife and six children in their Ger (a traditional yurt house) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife and children help running their family business of traditional boots and shoes manufacturing at home. His older daughter works at a local company, and the other five children are under 16 years of age and all help their parents. 

Gannorov has been working at various fields to support his family and children. He is a hardworking and decent man who is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of shoes and boots inventories to increase his sales. 

He said: "My children are small now and have not started generating income yet. We have been spending as much we make. I would like to send all my children to universities or colleges to become well-educated in the future".

loans.use: to purchase large amount of shoes and boots to increase his sales

loans.name: Keav

texts.en:
Keav is 48 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. 

She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $1 daily. Her husband runs a cutting service. He cuts palm trees and earns $10 per day. Two of her children are employed in a rice mill. They earn about $14 each day. 

To improve her family’s finances, Keav is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service. By doing so, he will generate additional income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William es un campesino de 32 años de edad, muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 5 años de edad. Desde que era muy joven aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo y, gracias a las  enseñanzas de su padre, hoy en día posee cultivos de cebolla de rama y aguacates, además trabaja como administrador en una finca de la región donde vive. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas al por mayor (insecticidas, abonos, larvicidas, entre otros), que requiere para seguir cuidando sus cultivos y obtener una cosecha más productiva, así podrá hacerle frente a los desafíos que se le presentan por los constantes e inesperados cambios de clima que afecta sus cultivos. William desea seguir trabajando arduamente para hacer crecer su negocio y, en un futuro sueña con adquirir una parcela propia para ampliar sus cultivos y generar mejores ingresos, que le garanticen una estabilidad económica favorable para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
William is a 32 year old farmer.  He is very hardworking and dedicated to his family, made up of his wife and two children, ages 4 and 5.  He learned to work in the fields when he was very young, thanks to his father’s teachings.  Now he has green onion, and avocado crops.  He also works as a farm manager in his area.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies in quantity (insecticides, fertilizer, larvacide, and other things).  He needs these so he can continue with his crops and obtain a more productive harvest.  In this way he will be able to face the challenges he has due to the constant and unexpected climate changes that affect his crops.  William wants to work arduously to grow his business and acquire his own parcel of land in the future so he can expand his crops and generate better income that will guarantee financial stability for his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jessey's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of nine group leaders of farmers in Webuye district, with Jessey selected as the Kiva representative. Jessey has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 83 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 Kenyan Shillings (KES).
							
Jessey is 48 years old and has been a farmer for 26 years. Jessey works as a farmer to provide for his four children. The community and other farmers know Jessey as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community's activities, such as the savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Jessey described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.
							
Jessey first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Jessey joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, new farming methods, and fertilizers and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed the family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader, and as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Jessey plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Jessey’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, more farm training, and more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. 

Jessey and his group need the loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en: Maritess is 33, married to a security guard and blessed with three children. Maritess owns and operates a fruit vending business on the street. Her business originated with her parents and she inherited it to have a source of income. She always makes sure that she manages her business well and earns more profit. She is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy various kinds of fruit to sell to her customers. She will do her best to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy various kinds of fruit to resell.

loans.name: Tung

texts.en:
Tung, 48, is married and has a daughter. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife has runs a general store. He earns an income running a business making shoes. 

He started this business 17 years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a sewing machine and materials to increase his production of shoes and better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and other materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is separated with three children. He has been managing his own transportation business for fifteen years. He earns well from this, so that he was able to provide for his family's needs. 

He borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to repair the vehicle and cover the costs for licenses renewal. 

Elmer wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle and cover the costs for licenses renewal.

loans.name: Melisa's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of eight group leaders of farmers in Webuye district, with Melisa selected as the Kiva representative. Melisa has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 89 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.
							
Melisa is 52 years old and has been a farmer for 28 years. Melisa works as a farmer to provide for her five children. The community and other farmers know Melisa as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community's activities, such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Melisa described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
							
Melisa first enrolled in One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Melisa joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, the new farming methods, and the fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

Melisa plans to use the money she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Melisa ’s own life was improved because she has more profits from the harvest, more farm training, and more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family.  
							
Melisa and her group need the loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizers through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	
						
The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Buumarjan

texts.ru: Буумаржан 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей дошкольного возраста. У Буумаржан - высшее образование, она работает преподавателем в местной школе, пользуется уважением и большим авторитетом среди сельчан, как высококвалифицированный учитель. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Буумаржан занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Буумаржан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, и 2,0 ГА земли на которой она ежегодно со своей семьей сажает фасоль для продажи. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Во избежание риска и различных заболеваний скота, Буумаржан дважды в год проводит вакцинацию скота. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS) от реализации молока и полеводства, также есть зарплата, которую она получает ежемесячно. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Буумаржан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Буумаржан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Buumarjan is 33 years old, married, and, together with her spouse is raising 3 preschool-aged children.  Buumarjan has a higher education, and works as a teacher in the local school.  As a qualified teacher, she enjoys respect and authority amongst the villagers.  Buumarjan's work in livestock and farming, which she began 11 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 15,000 KGS, serves as her family's major source of income.  Thanks to Buumarjan's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows and 2 hectares of land, on which she and her family plant beans to sell.  Her husband helps with the housework.  To limit the risk of her cattle developing disease, Buumarjan gives antibiotics to her animals 2 times per year.  Her monthly income, which comes from milk and crops, as well as her monthly salary, is 12,000 KGS.  With the goal of increasing the size of her herd, Buumarjan turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to purchase cows for breeding.  WIth the increased income from her loan, Buumarjan plans to continue to increase the number of cattle in her herd, and also plans to save towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 30-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.
 
Her husband provides white wash and oil paint services to his customers in the community. Sometimes he has to go out of the city as well. Her husband has a new contract for white wash and oil paint services on a newly constructed house but he does not have paintbrushes or rollers to provide this service.

Sumaira requested a loan for her husband to buy new paintbrushes, rollers, kerosene oil etc. Her husband’s savings are very small, which is why he is unable to buy new tools to provide white wash services. She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her husband.

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy paintbrushes, rollers, and paints

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok is 52 years old. He is married and resides with his two children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He has been working in construction for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 per day. His wife is employed in a garment factory. She makes an income of $4 daily. His children are also employed in a garment factory. They earn about $10 each day. Due to the lack of funds, Sok is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to fix his house. This money will help him to provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, he would like to run an additional business to make more money for the family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his house

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Ángela una joven de 19 años que estudia la carrera de Administración y Finanzas en un reconocido instituto. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera  al ver que era su vocación, pues desde muy joven siempre le interesó administrar su propio negocio. Actualmente trabaja en un banco en el área de promotora de servicios, la cual le permite cubrir con algunos gastos de sus estudios. Agradece a  su madre, pues es ella quien le brinda su apoyo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de sus pensiones del instituto. El deseo de Ángela es de terminar satisfactoriamente su carrera y ser competitiva en su rubro. Agradece a Kiva por apoyar  a jóvenes con ella.
texts.en: Angela is 19 years old and is studying for a career in management and finance at a well-known institution. She decided to study for this career when she realized that this was her vocation; she has been interested in managing her own business since she was very young.  She currently works as a service promoter for a bank, which allows her to cover some of her education expenses.  She is grateful to her mother because she supported her.  She will use the money from this loan to pay her education expenses.  Angela wants to complete her studies and be competitive in her field.  She is grateful to Kiva for helping young people like her.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Nojod

texts.en:
Nojod is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Nojod, 36 years old, is a married woman from a small village near Qalqilia city. She is a mother of two young sons. Nojod's husband is an employee in the public sector with a very low income that is not enough to cover all the family needs. He also sells seasonal fruits and vegetables in the local market. He buys them from local farmers. 

Nojod took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her husband to buy fruits and vegetables to resell. By taking this loan, the family income and  living conditions will improve.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron, age 56, lives with her husband and three single children in Baray district, Kampong Thom. Her oldest child is married and lives separately. In order to generate income to cover the household expenses, Ron and her husband manage a business growing and harvesting rice both for sustenance and for sales. Her children assist her in the everyday farming work. So far, she has not had any problems that keep her from continuing her work.

She will use the loan to build a room for bathing and a household latrine to improve the family’s sanitation and hygiene. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Ron to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a room for bathing and a household latrine

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: Don Alberto es originario de la ciudad de Somoto, padre de tres hijos ya independientes. Tiene 66 años de edad. Es un hombre muy trabajador, lo que le ha permitido salir adelante en su vida. Su meta es tener su vivienda con una red sanitaria adecuada y limpia. Solicita el crédito para saneamiento de su vivienda, con el fin de obtener un hogar con las mejores condiciones sanitarias. Estima que el crédito será beneficioso ya que tendrá una vivienda segura. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando las condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en: Alberto is from Somoto and is the father of three adult children on their own.  He is 66 years old and is a very hardworking man and this has allowed him to get ahead in life.  His goal is to have a sanitary and clean home.  He is asking for this loan to sanitize his home so that he can have sanitary conditions.  He estimates that this loan will be helpful and he will be able to have a secure home.  His plans for the future are to continue making home improvements.

loans.use: to sanitize his home.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 40 years old and married with three daughters. She and her husband have been running a food stall to sell bread and dumplings in front of their door for 15 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Phuong is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more breads and dumplings to sell from her stall and to pay school fees for her children. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy bread and dumplings to sell and to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Joseph's Group

texts.en:
Joseph is a member of the group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 69 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Joseph has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet to cultivate.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.
	
Joseph is married and has seven children.  He is 52 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  He is active in his community in the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Joseph has been a farmer for 23 years. He described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  

Joseph joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  He joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, obtain fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school.  

Since Joseph likes being a leader and an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Joseph has become more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Joseph's life because he has more profits from harvest, farm training, and farm group support. He was able to save money and feed his family.  In the future, Joseph hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, to repair the home, to save for the future, to buy a cow, and to invest in a business.
  							
Joseph and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 41 years old, is married and has two sons. Her husband works in a local hospital. She supports her family with the income she earns from making clothes and selling soft drinks. She began these activities 17 years ago. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy soft drinks to sell. The capital will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and helps her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Rakhima

texts.ru: Рахиме 58 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. Две дочери замужем, сын вместе со своей семьей проживает с Рахимой. У сына четверо детей, которые помогают Рахиме по хозяйству. У Рахимы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Рахима занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Рахимы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, а также имеет земельный надел размером 0,65 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, кукурузу и овощи. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), кроме этого старший сын помогает материально, он работает строителем. Зарплату отдает матери для поддержания семьи. Картофель, кукурузу и овощи Рахима продает за наличный расчет, в год доход от полеводства составляет около 80 000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Рахима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Rakhima is 58 years old, married, and, together with her husband, raised 3 children.  Her two daughters are married, and her son and his family live with Rakhima.  Her son has four children, who help Rakhima with housework.  Rakhima has a secondary education.  Rakhima's work in animal husbandry and farming, which began 25 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 3000 KGS, serves as the major source of income for Rakhima's family.  Thanks to Rakhima's hard work, she now has in her care 2 milk cows, and also 0.65 hectares of land, on which she raises potatoes, corn, and vegetables.  Her monthly income is 10,000 KGS, though her son, who is a construction worker, also contributes financially.  His income goes to his mother to help the family.  Rakhima sells potatoes, corn, and vegetables for cash, and her yearly income from crops is about 80,000 KGS.  With the goal of further increasing the size of her herd, Rakhima turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to purchase cows to fatten and resell at  the market for a higher price.  With the income earned from the loan, Rakhima plans to continue to increase the size of her herd.

loans.use: to buy cows to fatten and resell

loans.name: Gulshaiyr

texts.ru: Гулшайыр 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Старший сын находится на заработках в России, дочь замужем, остальные дети школьного возраста. У Гулшайыр - среднее образование, она работает в частной хлебопекарне и получает ежемесячно зарплату. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Гулшайыр занимается полеводством, стартовав 24 года назад, с 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулшайыр, на сегодняшний день имеется: 0,67 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает хлопок для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулшайыр обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку семян, удобрений и ядохимикатов. Доходы от кредита Гулшайыр планирует вложить в строительство сарая для содержания скота и затем закупить скот и заниматься дополнительно животноводством.
texts.en: Gulshaiyr is 42 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, is raising 5 children.  Her eldest son is working in Russia, her daughter is married, and the rest of her children are school-aged.  Gulshaiyr has a secondary education, and works in a bakery, from which she receives a monthly income.  Gulshaiyr's work in farming, which began 24 years ago with 3000 KGS, serves as a source of additional income for her family.  Thanks to Gulshaiyr's hard work, she now has 0.67 hectares of land, on which she plants cotton yearly.  Her monthly income is 13,000 KGS.  With the goal of increasing her family's economy, Gulshaiyr turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides.  With the increased income from the loan, Gulshaiyr plans to invest in the building of stables for cattle, and then purchase livestock for breeding.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz es madre cabeza de hogar, ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos y actualmente también vela por el bienestar de su madre quien se encuentra con dificultades de salud.
Hace algunos años  montó su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en una calle principal del barrio donde reside, allí ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar y ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para dar alimento a su familia y solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Solicita el crédito impulsada por la necesidad de comprar surtido al por mayor (mecato, galletería, café, panela, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener más variedad de inventario disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades, mejorando así el nivel de ventas y el margen de ganancias que obtiene.
Luz manifiesta que hasta el momento no ha tenido ningún desafío con su negocio, por ello quiere seguir trabajando para darle continuidad y permanencia en el tiempo, generando mejores ingresos para velar por el bienestar de su madre y sus hijos y poder disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is a single mother. She has supported her two children and currently also looks after the well-being of her mother, who has health problems.

A few years ago she started her own business, a grocery store located on a main street in the neighborhood where she lives. She offers all kinds of basic products and has managed to generate enough income to feed her family and meet the basic expenses of her household. She is requesting the loan because of the need to buy merchandise at whole-sale prices (baked goods, cookies, coffee, brown sugar, grains, etc.). This will allow her to have a greater variety of inventory on hand to offer to her customers and satisfy their diverse tastes and needs. She will be able to improve her sales and her profit margine.

Luz explains that so far she hasn’t had any difficulties with her business. She wants to keep working so she can provide continuity and permanence, and generate improved income so she can take care of her mother’s and children’s wellbeing and be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise at whole-sale prices (baked goods, cookies, coffee, brown sugar, grains, etc.).

loans.name: Solidaridad Group

texts.es: La Alcancía “SOLIDARIDAD” está representada  por  07 socias todas mujeres emprendedoras. Yvon  de 50 años es casada y tiene 02 hijos que siguen estudios universitarios. Yvon tiene una  ferretería donde vende toda clase de  materiales para construcción, su negocio está ubicado en un local que alquila por más de 10 años durante todo ese tiempo su negocio ha prosperado mucho y eso la hace muy feliz, en el trabajo comparte labores con su esposo ambos trabajan para sacar adelante a su familia  El crédito solicitado lo destinará para la compra de materiales como tuberías, fierros y cemento. En el futuro desea abrir otra sucursal de su negocio El grupo quiere agradecer a los inversionistas por este préstamo. La Sra. Yvon es la segunda de la izquierda esta con ropa color negra.
texts.en: The “SOLIDARIDAD” bank is represented by seven enterprising woman.  Yvon is 50 years old, married, and has two children who study at university.  Yvon has a hardware store and sells all kinds of construction materials.  Her business has been located in a rented location for ten years and it has prospered very much.  This makes her very happy and she shares the work with her husband.  They both work to get the family ahead.  She will use the money from this loan to buy materials such as pipes, metal items, and cement.  In the future she wants to open another branch of her business.  The group wants to thank the lenders for this loan.  Yvon is the second person from the left, wearing black.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra is a 34-year-old married woman from a small village near Qalqilia. She is a mother of two young sons and one daughter. Nasra is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo. Her husband has a small sewing workshop that he has owned for five years.

Nasra obtained a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her husband buy a new sewing machine for his workshop which will increase his productivity and ability to complete more orders. By taking this loan, the family income and living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a sewing workshop.

loans.name: Jiydegul

texts.ru: Жийдегул 44 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Двое из них самостоятельные проживают отдельно, остальные с родителями. У Жийдегул - среднее образование, она работает техничкой в школе-моет полы, окна, стены. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Жийдегул занимается животноводством, стартовав 14 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Жийдегул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 кобыла, 3 овцы, 4 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жийдегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку жеребят для увеличения поголовья скота. Условия для содержания скота имеются, заготовлено 400 штук прессованного сена и 1 тонна ячменя, также имеет земельный надел размером 1,20 ГА для внутрихозяйственного пользования. Доходы от кредита Жийдегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство недостроенного дома.
texts.en: Jiydegul is 44 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, is raising 4 children.  Two of them are living by themselves, away from their parents.  Jiydegul has a secondary education, and works cleaning floors, windows, and walls in a school.  Jiydegul's work in animal husbandry, beginning 14 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 KGS, serves as a source of additional income for her family.  Thanks to Jiydegul's hard work, she now has in her herd 3 milk cows, 1 mare, 3 sheep, and 4 goats.  Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS.  With the goal of continuing to increase her economy, Jiydegul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan to purchase foals for breeding.  For the care of animals, she has procured 400 pieces of pressed hay, 1 ton of barley, and 1.2 hectares of land.  With the increased income from the loan, Jiydegul plans to invest in further increasing the size of her herd, and also plans to save towards construction on her unfinished house.

loans.use: to buy foals

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es:
Blanca a sus 52 años de edad, se caracteriza por su amabilidad y carisma, vive con su esposo, sus dos hijos menores y dos nietos que quedaron bajo su custodia.
Para ayudar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar, ella produce  y vende arepas de maíz entre los vecinos de la vereda donde reside, además vende minutos a celular, así genera ingresos para su familia, ya que con el salario que gana su esposo no se solventan todas las necesidades básicas.
Con el ánimo de complementar los ingresos, ella desea iniciar con la venta de ropa (jeans, camisetas, chaquetas, entre otros), aprovechando que en la vereda habitan muchas personas y así evitaría el largo traslado hacia la cabecera municipal, para ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido de mercancía al por mayor (jeans, camisas, ropa interior, entre otros) para dar inicio a su proyecto productivo y continuar generando dinero para aportar a las finanzas familiares.
Blanca manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder brindar bienestar y una buena educación a sus dos nietos, por ello quiere seguir luchando incansablemente para garantizar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Blanca, at 52 years of age, is known for her friendliness and charisma. She lives with her husband, her two younger children, and two grandchildren who are in her custody. To help her husband with the household expenses she makes and sells corn tortillas to neighbors on the street where she lives. She also sells cell phone minutes to generate income for her family since the salary her husband earns doesn't cover all their basic needs. 

With the motivation to supplement their income, Blanca wants to start selling clothing (jeans, tee shirts, jackets, among others). By making the most of the fact that there are many people who live on her street she will avoid the large move to the big city. For this, Blanca requests a loan with which she will buy wholesale supplies (jeans, shirts, undergarments, among others) to jump-start her project and continue earning money to support the family finances. Blanca says that her biggest hope is to be able to provide well-being and a good education for her two grandchildren, that is why she wants to continue fighting tirelessly to guarantee better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of wholesale supplies (jeans, shirts, undergarments, among others).

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La  señora  Fidelina es una persona emprendedora, honesta, responsable  y seria, vive  con su familia en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de  mercadería nueva y usada lo cual hace desde hace más de 4 años.
Doña Fidelina tiene su  negocio en su casa de habitación y también distribuye sus productos lugares cercanos a  esta, dicha  actividad  forma la mayor parte de sus ingresos. 
Doña Fidelina el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, camisas, short, blusas, vestidos etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercancía que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos.
Doña Fidelina espera que  a un corto plazo  su negocio siga  creciendo y  convirtiéndose en  el  más conocido de su barrio y seguir  apoyando a su familia. 


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del 2013
texts.en:
Fidelina is an enterprising, honest, responsible, and serious lady who lives with her family in a southern Honduras community.  She buys and sells new and used merchandise and has done so for more than four years.

Fidelina has a business in her home and also distributes her products to nearby areas, which provides the main part of her income.

Fidelina needs this loan to buy pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, dresses, etc.  She expects her sales to increase because she will have more merchandise to offer her customers and meet their needs, thanks to this loan.

Fidelina wants to continue to support her family and have her business to grow in the short term to become the most well known in the neighborhood.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2013

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilia dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to have better living conditions. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, wire and baskets

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is a 48-year-old married woman. She lives with two sons and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works as a driver for hire. Thuy earns money by selling noodles and pork. She has had this business for 25 years. 

Thuy would like a loan to purchase higher quality ingredients to make better food for selling. She would also like to use a part of the loan to repair her kitchen. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her current customers and attract additional customers. 

Thuy also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that her family may face.

loans.use: to buy noodles and pork and to repair her kitchen.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en: Muoi is requesting a new loan to buy a motorbike that will help her to save time transporting goods. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for transporting business-related goods.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 52 years old, married, and a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Clemencia requested a 29500 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Clemencia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Nhom

texts.en: Nhom would like to take another loan to buy a sewing machine. Nhom's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Gladys Mercedes

texts.es: Gladys tiene 31 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos. Originaria de la ciudad de Estelí. Es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora. Su meta es tener un hogar con las mejores condiciones e infraestructura. Solicita el crédito para saneamiento de vivienda, con el fin de brindar un hogar seguro a sus hijos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que tendrá un hogar limpio y digno, con las mejores condiciones para su familia. Su plan futuro es seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su hogar.
texts.en: Gladys is 31 years old and the mother of two children.  She is from the city of Estelí and is an enterprising and hardworking woman.  Her goal is to improve her home’s infrastructure and living conditions.  She is asking for this loan to sanitize her home so that she can provide a safe home for her children.  She estimates that this loan will be of great help because she will have a clean and dignified home with better living conditions for her family.  Her future plans are to continue to improve the quality of life in her home.

loans.use: to sanitize her home.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo brindado pues desea continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayudo con el capital del negocio, ella continua venta de combustible de forma artesanal, él tiene cilindros y baldes donde guarda la gasolina y petróleo y el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, él pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más combustible.
texts.en: Julio is grateful to the lenders for this loan and he is happy about the support.  He wants to continue participating in this project because it helped him with his business.  He is continuing with his fuel business and he has buckets and cylinders where he stores gasoline and oil.  His business is located in his home.  He has been doing this for several years and things are going very well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  He is a member of the “Mamacha Carmen” communal bank and he needs this loan to buy more fuel.

loans.use: to buy more fuel.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван в Виноградово имеет в собственном пользовании 50 соток земли. Возле дома он построил 2 теплицы общей площадью 10 соток. Иван занимается выращиванием капусты и перца. В бизнесе задействована вся семья. Иван — женат, у него 4 детей. 
Иван хочет приобрести удобрения для теплиц, дрова для отопления и пленку для сохранения тепла внутри теплиц, а также семена для посева на сумму в 15 000 гривен. Со временем планирует построить дома еще одну теплицу и расширить хозяйство.
texts.en: Ivan owns 50 acres of land in Vinogradovo.  Next to his home Ivan built 2 greenhouses, which are 10 acres in area, in which he raises cabbage and peppers.  Ivan is married and has 4 children, and his business involves his entire family.  Ivan wants to buy fertilizers for his greenhouses, firewood, plastic to keep the inside of the greenhouses warm, as well as seeds for planting, all for 15,000 UAH.  With time, he plans to build a house and an additional greenhouse, and also expand his personal economy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, wood, seeds and plastic film for his greenhouses

loans.name: Sergio Andrés

texts.es:
Sergio a sus 20 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor que impulsado por sus ganas de salir adelante y con el apoyo de sus familiares inició su propio negocio, una charcutería y licorera en la que trabaja de jueves a domingo hasta las horas de la madrugada, ofrece un ambiente para pasar un rato ameno.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una planta de sonido, mesas, sillas, una carpa y surtido al por mayor (mecato, gaseosas y licores), esto le permitirá mejorar la capacidad instalada y podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, además tendrá mayor nivel de ventas y mejorará los ingresos.
Sergio, con su dinamismo y empuje, quiere seguir trabajando con disciplina y constancia para poder adquirir un local propio, más amplio, en el que pueda ofrecer oportunidades de empleo y así garantizar una rentabilidad mayor para seguir reinvirtiendo en su actividad y aportar a la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sergio is 20 years old. He is a young entrepreneur who, motivated by his desire to get ahead and with the support of his family members, started his own business, a delicatessen and liquor store. He works there Thursday through Sunday, until the early morning hours. His place offers an atmosphere that where it is nice to spend some time.

He will use the loan that he is requesting to buy a sound system, tables, chairs, an awning, and stock at whole-sale price (baked goods, soft drinks, and liquors). This will allow him to improve his location and he will be able to offer better service to his customers. He will also have better sales and improve his income.

Sergio, with his dynamism and drive, wants to continue working with discipline and perseverance so that he can buy his own larger location. There he would be able to offer employment opportunities and guarantee better profitability so he can continue re-investing in his business and also contributing to his household budget.

loans.use: to buy a sound system, tables, chairs, an awning, and stock at whole-sale price (baked goods, soft drinks, and liquors).

loans.name: Racquel

texts.en: Racquel is a single entrepreneur in Clarin, Misamis Occidental who sells motorcycles to make a living. She has been doing this for five years and she earns enough that she is able to support her parents' needs and save a portion for her future. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro finance to add to her capital to be able to buy another unit of motorcycle to sell. She wants to improve her business to gain more income for a better future.

loans.use: to buy another unit of motorcycle tosell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 54 years old and married with one child in school, Regina works very hard to provide for them.

Regina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, egg, chips, etc.

Regina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items at retail. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, etc

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 29 years old, married, and the mother of two children. 

Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning routinely. For this reason, Rabia has contacted Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband wants to repair the engine’s piston and one wheel and wants a loan in order to pay the labor costs for the repair.  This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Rabia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business. Rabia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay labor costs to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Walubengo's Group

texts.en:
Walubengo is a member of this group in Webuye District.  She is pictured here in a group of seven One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 84 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Walubengo has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with her hand raised.  She and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet to cultivate.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 KES for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

Walubengo is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 27 years.  She works as a farmer to provide for her seven children. The community and other farmers know Walubengo as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer.  In addition to farming, she is also involved in community groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee.  Walubengo described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.

Walubengo joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling for the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  She joined One Acre Fund so that she could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, obtain fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school.  Because she likes being a leader and an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers.  Walubengo has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Walubengo's life because she has more profits from harvest, farm training, and farm group support. She was able to save money and feed her family.  In the future, Walubengo hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send her children to school, to repair the home, to save for the future, and to buy a cow.  

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Walubengo and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left side of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for growing maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sulatana is a 26-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about six years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early, because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family.  This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time.

Sultana requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use the loan to fix his rickshaw and to buy spare parts for the vehicle such as tires, bolts, headlight, tubes etc.

loans.use: to fix a rickshaw and buy spare parts

loans.name: Bong

texts.en:
Bong, 49, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business 30 years ago. She sells phone cards and cigarettes. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of phone cards and a set of nail files and paints for her daughter to work as a manicurist. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy phone cards to sell in her store and a set of nail files and paints for her daughter's business

loans.name: Nuevo Paraiso #  1  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días los socios  del Grupo De  Crédito Nuevo Paraíso # 1. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellos hace poco y al conocer de los beneficios que brinda la institución decidieron unirse  y  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda la  institución.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Rita, tiene 45 años  de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 8 años que estudia en una escuela de la localidad. El esposo es policía retirado.
