Doña Rita para lograr algo por su cuenta y con la ayuda del primer crédito que recibió del Grupo De Crédito empezó su negocio, construyo una pequeña granja en la cual cría pollos, empezó con muy poco pero y con el paso de los días y meses fue aumentando la cantidad de pollos, ella los compra pequeños y los mantiene de dos a tres meses y luego cuando tiene un peso adecuado los vende por libras o enteros a vecinos de la zona o a comerciantes que llevan a otras partes a comercializar, son dos años que lleva con esta actividad que le permite ganarse algo sin salir de su casa.
Este crédito es para comprar alimento y medicinas para los pollos. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan para salir adelante. Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de una socia y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Nuevo Paraíso # 1 credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo.  The members have different businesses and are merchants, provide services, and do other activities.  A short time ago they decided to join the institution so they can get loans.

Rita is one of the members.  She is 45 years old, married, and has an eight year old son who attends a local school.  Her husband is a retired police officer.

Rita used the money from the first loan to start her business.  She built a small farm where she raises chickens.  She began with very little and increased her number of chickens over the following days and months.  She buys them small, raises them for two or three months and then sells them by the pound or whole to area residents or to merchants who sell them in other areas.  She has been doing this for two months and it allows her to earn money without having to leave home.

She will use the money from this loan to buy feed and medicine for her chickens.  She has been with the credit group since the beginning and she likes the assistance that helps her get ahead.  Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

The two small photos are of members who were not able to attend when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is thankful for the financial assistance extended to him as he was able to buy more hair and beauty products for his salon. His business has been running for 15 years and is continuously growing. His income from the business is helping with his everyday needs and expenditures. He is able to help his parents and siblings as well.

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan. He will be incorporating the loan to buy beauty and hair products for his salon. His profits from his business will definitely help sustain his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Mario hopes that his business lasts longer and he dreams of saving for the future. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and hair products for his salon.

loans.name: Chereza Gem

texts.en: Chereza Gem is single with an only child. She manages a motorcycle rental business to earn a living. She solely provides the needs of her child. After she joined GDMPC, she borrowed a new loan to purchase tires and spare parts. She dreams of improving her life and wants to see her child finish studying in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Charles' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 9 group leader farmers in Kakamega North District with Charles selected as the Kiva representative. Charles has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is pictured on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 91 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.							

Charles is a reliable member of the community. He is married and has 8 children. Charles is 60 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 23 years to support his family. In addition to this, Charles is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group and savings group. He described his harvest last year as excellent. He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.			

Charles joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and has continued working with One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods and earn enough to feed his family. Charles also chose to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. Charles is also involved in the community's peace coordination. Charles plans on using future profits from the harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business. His life has improved by working with One Acre Fund because he has more profits from the harvest, was able to save money, and feed the family.							

Charles and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

loans.use: to allow farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan was given to Maria to improve her business. She is married and has four children. Maria opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital . She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko drinks, noodles, body lotion, fish, coffee, sugar, salt and slippers. She is generating a good income from her business.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado pues desea continuar participando en este proyecto porque le ayudo con el capital del negocio, ella continua dedicándose a la compra y venta de queso, ella compra sus quesos de la ciudad de Sicuani para luego venderlo en la ciudad Paucartambo. Ya son varios años que se dedica a  este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mamacha Carmen” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más quesos.
texts.en: Elvira is grateful to the lenders for the loan, and she is happy with the support offered. She wishes to continue participating in this project because it helps her with capital for her business. She continues to work buying and selling cheese. She purchases her cheese in the city of Sicuani and later sells them in the city of Paucartambo. She has been in this business for several years, and it's going very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She belongs to the communal bank "Mamacha Carmen", and with this opportunity, she needs the loan to purchase more cheese.

loans.use: to buy more cheese.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai would like to take a further loan to buy a hair pressing machine and hair care products. Mai's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a hair pressing machine and hair care products.

loans.name: Abdel Hay

texts.en: Abdel Hay is an 18-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Abdel Hay undertook training in electrical machines maintenance. He works in a small store that he opened last month. It is a good business and earns a good income. Abdel Hay would like to improve his store and buy all the necessary tools and products for his work. Abdel Hay took a USD Murabha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy all the necessary tools and repair parts for his maintenance workshop. By taking this loan, Abdel Hay will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. Abdel Hay appears in the photo while he was working in his workshop

loans.use: to buy all the necessary tools and repair parts for his maintenance workshop

loans.name: Abdimalik

texts.ru: Абдималик 25-летний молодой человек. Он проживает в районе Вахш с женой, родителями, сестрой, братом, невесткой и племянниками. В течение 5 лет Абдималик вместе с братом занимается производством муки. У них во дворе дома имеется мукомольня, в котором они измельчают пшеницу. Ремесло мельника им перешло от отца. Это их семейный бизнес. Мукомольня, которой они сейчас пользуются очень устарела. Абдималик просит кредит, чтобы купить новую модернизированную мукомольню, благодаря которому качество их продукции улучшится и таким образом увеличится количество продаж. Этот кредит им очень нужен.
texts.en:
Abdimalik is a young man of 25 years.  He lives in the Vaxhsh region along with his wife, parents, sister, brother, sister-in-law, and neices and nephews.  For the last five years Abdimalik and his brother have been in the business of producing flour.  They have a flour mill at their home and they grind wheat.  Their father was a miller and passed the trade to them.  It's their family business.  

The flour mill that they are currently using is very old.  Abdimalik is requesting a loan to buy a new, modern flour mill.  With a new mill they will produce higher quality flour, which will increase their sales.  They need this loan very badly.

loans.use: to buy a new flour mill

loans.name: Rumiya

texts.ru: Румия студентка Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Она учится в факультете экономики. Она родилась 1995 года. Румия живет с родителями. Отец и мать Румии простые рабочие. После окончания школы Румия поступила в экономический факультет на договорной основе. В настоящее время она студентка первого курса. В университете Румия не отстает от своих однокурсников, учится на четверки и пятерки, среди сокурсников ее очень уважают и дорожат ее дружбой. Она принимает активное участие в студенческих мероприятиях и жизни института. В свободное время Румия по дому помогает маме, читает художественную литературу. Румия запрашивает займ, чтобы оплатить годовой договор университета за учебу. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rumiya attends the Tajikm State University of Commerce. She studies in the College of Economics. She was born in 1995, and lives with her parents. Her parents are simple working people. After graduating from high school, Rumiya was admitted to the College of Economics as a self-paying student. She is now a freshman. Rumiya keeps up with her fellow students, receiving high grades. Her fellow students respect her and value her friendship. Rumiya takes an active part in university events and student life. In her free time, Rumiya helps her mother with household tasks and reads works of fiction. Rumiya is requesting a loan from IMON International in order to pay her annual college tuition, and hopes for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her college tution

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1976 году. Зилола замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Зилола уже несколько лет занимается предоставлением услуги компьютерных услуг. Она имеет своих регулярных клиентов благодаря хорошему сервису. Зилола всегда старается, чтобы ее дети получили хорошее образование. Ее дети учатся в частной школе. Она должна оплатить за учебу детей в школе, но не имеет денег. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zilola is a hard working woman.  She was born in 1976.  Zilola is married and is raising 3 children.  For several years she has been in business offering computer services.  She has regular clients as a result of her good service.

Zilola does everything she can so that her children will get a good education.  Her children study in a private school and Zilola has to pay their tuition but she doesn't have the money.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for education of her children

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Doña Maritza de 37 años de edad es una persona trabajadora, tiene dos hijos menores de edad los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, su mayor preocupación es cuando sus hijos se le enferman pues no cuenta con seguro para ellos por estar en edades de  13 y 15 años y no hay cobertura médica; sin embargo  Maritza siendo Secretaria en una Institución del Estado y con ayuda de su esposo quien es Maestro de Obra en Construcción ha logrado mejorar su hogar, ahora necesita realizarle un Pequeño Porche a su vivienda, pues con sacrificio propio logró comprar una parte de materiales así  como arena, pero aun le falta comprar Piedrín, Cemento y Hierro, para  lo cual solicita este crédito.  De esta manera contar con mayor espacio en su hogar y mejorar las condiciones de vida  de  su Familia.
texts.en: Maritza, who is thirty-seven years old, is a hardworking person. She has two dependent children. Her greatest worry is when her children get sick since she doesn't have insurance for them because they are aged thirteen and fifteen and there is no medical coverage. However, Maritza, being a secretary for a state institution, has managed to improve her home with the help of her husband who works as a construction foreman. Currently, she needs to build a small porch for her home, so she managed to buy a portion of the materials such as sand with some sacrifice. However, she still needs to buy gravel, cement, and iron; therefore, she is applying for this loan. In this way, she will be able to have more room in her home and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, and iron.

loans.name: Lovender

texts.en: Lovender helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living. She has helped him manage and harvest corn for more than five years, earning good money for the family. Lovender has successfully repaid her previous loans from GDMPC, which she used in their farm and other business. Now, Lovender has borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and new varieties of seeds for their corn production business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve their living.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and new varieties of seeds

loans.name: Necitas

texts.en:
Necitas is a widow and has four children living with her. To make a living, she manages their own rice farm. 
To improve her farm, she has borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer for her rice farm. She hopes to gain more profit from their farm to improve their living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is married with eight children. She helps her husband working in their own farm to make a living. She has been harvesting vegetables and selling them at the market. Now, Fe has borrowed a new loan to fertilize her garden and buy additional vegetables to resell. She hopes to improve the farm to gain more profit, for the better living of the entire family.

loans.use: to fertilize her garden and buy additional vegetables to resell

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is 45 years old; she is the mother of three children.
Her husband owns a wood shop, in which he sells planks, wooden boards, timber, chipboard, nails, and door locks to the furniture manufacturers. He purchases wood accessories from nearby markets and sells them to the carpenters. In his area, a lot of carpenters are ready to buy wood accessories on a daily basis. The raw material’s prices have been increasing day by day, which has exceeded his purchasing power. 
Therefore, Nighat requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband would be able to buy raw material such as planks, chipboard, door locks, and nails etc to earn maximum profit.

loans.use: To buy planks, chipboard, door locks, and nails.

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian works hard to support her family. Christian is married and has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Christian has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Loc

texts.en: Loc would like to take a further loan to buy more soft drinks and masks to sell from her stall. Loc's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and masks for selling.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona, age 56, is from the village of Zemo Teleti.  She is living with her husband and grown son. The family earns their main income from an agricultural business. Specifically, Nona breeds one milking cow and makes cheese for selling as well as for family consumption.  She also has 12 chickens and sometimes sells eggs. 
In order to generate a stable monthly income, Nona decided to start up a grocery store in her village and sell various food products. The family has already built a store and now is requesting a loan to buy stocks of merchandise, such as meat and dairy products, oil, pasta, rice and other products. Nona and her husband will work as salespersons and serve their clients in a friendly way. The family will get monthly income and they will be able to cover household expenses, as well as improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start up a grocery store

loans.name: Murotkhol

texts.ru: Муротхол жизнерадостная женщина. Ей 53 года. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Муротхол работает в государственной организации. Она работает более 13 лет. Муротхол имеет 0.5 га земли. Она выращивает лук. Ее муж помогает ей по выращивания лука. Муротхол заботливая мать для своих детей. Она всегда старается для их благополучия. Муротхол должна провести свадебное торжество своего сына, так как он хочет жениться, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Murotkhol is a cheerful 53 year old woman.  She is married and has 3 children.  For 13 years, Murotkhol has worked in a governmental office.  Murotkhol also has 0.5 ha of land where she raises onions.  Her husband helps her with growing the onions.  She is a very caring mother to her children.  She does everythign she can for their well-being. 

Since her son wants to marry, Murotkhol has to throw the wedding party but she doesn't have the money.  She is requesting a loan of $1,000 (USD) for throwing the wedding party.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's wedding party

loans.name: Buvaysha

texts.ru: Бувайша много лет назад потеряла своего мужа. Он умер от серьёзной болезни. Бувайша мать двоих детей. Ее детям 20 и 25 лет. Она сама вырастила своих детей и посвятила всю свою жизнь своим детям. Бувайша всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Данное время ее дочь учится в университете в Киргизии. Ее сын наемный работник. Бувайша работает контролером в общежитии технического колледжа. Она имеет маленькую зарплату. Бувайша уже давно страдает от зубной боли, но не имеет денег для лечения. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для лечения зубов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Buvaysha is the mother of two children and many years ago, she lost her husband to a terrible illness.  Her children are 20 and 25 years old.  Buvaysha raised them by herself and dedicated her life to them.  Buvaysha has always dreamed of her children getting higher educations, and her daughter is currently studying in a university in Kirgizia.  Her son is a day laborer.  Buvaysha works as a monitor in the dormitory of a technical college and earns a small salary.

For a long time Buvaysha has been suffering from tooth pain but she doesn't have any money for treatment.  She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) for dental treatment.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her teeth

loans.name: Los Vecinos De Juan Parra-El Tambo Group

texts.es:
DORCA,TIENE 45 AÑOS ES MADRE SOLTERA CON 1 HIJO, ELLA PERTENECE AL GRUPO LOS VECINOS DE JUAN PARRA, ELLA ES PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO.

DORCA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA HACE 11 AÑOS , Y GRACIAS A LOS INGRESOS DE ESTE NEGOCIO APOYA A SU PADRE,UNO DE SUS HERMANOS Y A SU HIJA.
ELLA SE DEDICA 6 HORAS DIARIAS A SU NEGOCIO,  CON EL APOYO DE SU HIJA
GRACIAS A LOS INGRESOS DE SU NEGOCIO A PODIDO SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJA QUE SE ENCUENTRA PREPARÁNDOSE EN UNA ACADEMIA PARA PODER INGRESAR A LA UNIVERSIDAD.
SU MAS GRANDE SUEÑO ES DE QUE SU HIJA SEA UNA PROFESIONAL RECONOCIDA; Y TENER UN LOCAL PROPIO PARA SU RESTAURANT.

DORCA AGRADECE EL APOYO DE BUENAS PERSONAS, QUE CONFÍAN EN ELLA, AUN SIN CONOCERLA.
DORCA VISTE UNA CASACA MARRON (EN LA PARTE SUPERIOR TENEMOS A ENMA Y LETICIA, QUE LLEGARON TARDE A LA REUNIÓN)
texts.en:
45-year old Dorca is a single mother with a son. She is president of the Los Vecinos de Juan Parra group. For the last 11 years Dorca has earned her living selling food. With the income she has helped her father, one of her siblings, and her daughter. She works about six hours daily and is assisted by her daughter. 

Dorca helped her daughter by enrolling her in an academy where she is preparing for university courses.

Dorca’s greatest wish is to see her daughter become a well-known professional. She would also like to own a restaurant. She is grateful for those wonderful donors who trust her even though they don’t know her.

In the photo Dorca is wearing a brown jacket. (The pictures at the top are of Enma and Leticia who arrived late to the meeting.)

loans.use: buy rice, oil, vegetables for soup, milk etc.

loans.name: Arellys

texts.es: La Joven Arellys de 21 años de edad, dia a dia trabaja como conserje en una empresa privada, ella es una persona luchadora con ganas de superar, casada, su esposo es Pintor Automotriz, no tienen hijos aun, Arelys con sacrificio ha ido obteniendo su propia vivienda, su mayor preocupación es cuando tiene problemas de salud, ya que su salario es bajo y hay medicamentos que están fuera de cobertura del seguro,   aun así se esfuerza por mejorar su vivienda y tiene la necesidad de repellar las paredes de su habitación, para lo cual necesita este crédito que será  invertido en compra de arena y cemento para realizar la obra,  con esto estará aportando a que sus sueños se cumplan de contar con una vivinda digna, para darles condiciones y comodidad a sus futuros hijos que tanto anela.
texts.en:
The young Arellys, at 21 years old, works day in day out as a caretaker at a private company. She is an energetic person with the will to overcome; married, her husband is an auto body painter, they do not have children yet.

Arellys has made sacrifices to get her own home. Her biggest worry is when she has health problems, as her salary is low and there are medicines that are not covered by insurance.

Even so, she tries hard to improve her home, and she needs to plaster the walls of her room, for which she needs this loan, which will be used to buy sand and cement to do the building work. This will make her dream of living in a decent house come true, in order to give them the conditions and comfort for the future children they yearn for.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to plaster a room.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a 33-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with two young children. She raises and sells hogs to help augment the income of their household. Her business started 2 years ago.

Mary Ann is asking for a loan to buy pig feed like starter feed, grower feed, and gestating feed (for lactating hogs) for fast and healthy growth, in order to get the hogs sold on time. 


In the future, Mary Ann would like to expand her hog-raising business and increase business profitability for her children’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy pig feed like starter feed, grower feed and gestating feed (for lactating hogs)

loans.name: Edward's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Chwele District with Edward selected as the Kiva representative. Edward has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised.  Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 65 other individual farmers represented in this group.  The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.		

Edward is 48 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years.  Edward works as a farmer to provide for his six children.  The community and other farmers know Edward as hardworking, reliable and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group and savings group.  Edward described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.							

Edward joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Edward joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and send his children to school.  Because he is an active community member, Edward has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Edward's life because he has more farm training and is able to feed the family.  In the future, Edward hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and buy a cow.  

Edward and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.  One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers.  Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru:
Аличон житель района Вахш. Аличон примерный семьянин. Он женат и имеет двух дочек и двоих сыновей. Его жена и сыновья помогают ему продвигать его деятельность. Аличон на своем парнике выращивает лимон и продает его на рынке района Вахш. Аличон такой деятельностью занимается около 5 лет. Он отличается от других продавцов рынка своим личным обонянием, вежливостью и качественными товарами. Аличон всегда вкладывает в свой урожай душу. Он хочет, чтоб его товар понравился покупателям.
   К приходу зимы Аличон подготовился и посадил урожай. Чтобы спасти свой урожай нужно срочно отремонтировать крышу. Крыша парника остро нуждается в ремонте. Аличон просит кредит, для покупки арматуры, проводов и палатки, чтобы отремонтировать крышу и спасти урожай лимона.  Аличон надеется, что его труд не пропадет, и он получит свой урожай.
texts.en:
Alijon lives in the Vakhsh region and he is an ideal family man.  He is married and has two daughters and two sons.  His wife and sons help him keep his business moving forward.  Alijon has a hothouse where he raises lemons, which he sells at the Vakhsh regional market.  He has been in this business for about 5 years.   His politeness, high quality lemons, and his keen sense of smell all set him apart from his competition.  Alijon puts his whole heart into his work.  He wants his clients to be pleased with his lemons.

Alijon prepared and planted a crop in time for the onset of winter.  However, the crop needs to be saved because the roof of the hothouse is in dire need of repair.  The roof needs repairs very badly.  Alijon is requesting a loan to buy fittings, wire, and tenting so he can repair the roof and save his crop of lemons.  Alijon hopes that his work won't have been in vain and that he will have a harvest.

loans.use: to buy fittings, wire, and tenting for hothouse repairs

loans.name: Sokheang

texts.en:
Sokheang is 53 years old and has a family with five children. She is dedicated to a farming business, working alongside her husband on their own farmland located in Kampong Cham province. Sokheang and her husband inherited the land from their parents. She has been doing farming for ages and also, in her spare time, raises some poultry and pigs at home for additional income.

This will be her first loan, which enables her to build a room for bathing and a safe toilet for the household. She hopes to improve their health and her family’s sanitation. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate, which has helped to encourage Sokheang to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a room for bathing and a safe toilet for the household.

loans.name: Dong

texts.en: Dong is requesting a new loan to expand her business by purchasing a wider range and larger quantity of beverages and coffees to sell at her store. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and coffees.

loans.name: German Horacio

texts.es: German es casado,padre de un nino de 5 años de edad, trabaja como docente en una escuela publica; en conjunto con su esposa quien es estilista han venido mejorando su vivienda, por ser una familia unidad y con proyectos a futuros.  Con el credito anterior lograron poner verjas a su vivienda y cuenta con seguridad en la misma, pues aun le quedan mejoras por realizar, esta vez se propusieron la inversion del repello de paredes y poner ceramica en la sala de su vivienda, para lo cual con esfuerzo propios empezaron esta obra, pero necesita terminarla, por lo que requiere este prestamo para la compra de la ceramica y el pago de mano de obra, brindando con esto mejores condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
German is a married father of a five-year-old child, who works as a teacher in a public school. Together with his wife who is a stylist, he has been improving the house in order to be a united family with plans for the future.

With their previous loan, they were able to put bars on their house and they rely on the security it provides. Even so, there are improvements left to do, this time they propose making an investment in plastering the walls and tiling the living room of their house. With some effort, they started this job, but they need to finish it, so they need this loan to buy tiles and to pay for the labor, thus providing better conditions in their home.

loans.use: to buy plaster and tiles for his house.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana’s husband has been selling sanitary goods such as water pumps, water taps, geezers, sinks, joints, water pipes, joints, elbows and showers for many years and earning a healthy income. Rehana is 45 years of age, living along with her husband and five children in Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide all facilities and higher education to her children. 
Earlier her husband was busy in another business of selling construction goods which proved to be a low profit generating business. He established a new business and hopes this business will prove more beneficial than the last one. He retained a list of good customers in a short time and this business is going well. He wants to make a further investment to complete the remaining inventories for his newly started business but he does not have enough money. Therefore, Rehana requested a loan so that her husband can buy the remaining stock for his sanitary shop. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy sanitation goods such as water pumps, taps, showers, water pipes and geezers

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is 39 years old and married with four children. Nelida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa roof making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa leaves and bamboo.  Nelida has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the nipa roof making business for five years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Nelida aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa leaves and bamboo

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en: Alfreda provides for the needs of her children with her vegetable-farming business. With more than 10 years in this line of business, she earns well and has successfully repaid her previous loans taken at GDMPC. She used these loans to purchase fertilizers. Currently, she is borrowing a new loan to buy organic fertilizers. Her dream is to improve her family's standard of living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Jelita

texts.en: Jelita is married and she helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. She borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative to buy fertilizers for her new plot of garden. She wants to have a good harvest this cropping season and to use her profits to repair their house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida’s age is 50; she is married and lives with her husband and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a job in a firm and earns very low wages. Abida owns a small clothing business at home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them at higher prices in her community. The ladies of the town like her garment collection and selection a lot. Her family members appreciate her for her efforts. 

Now the winter season is going on, and Abida wants to buy clothes for the winter season to sell. But she does not have enough cash on hand due to household expenses. Abida has requested a loan so she can buy clothes for the winter season to fulfill the demands of her customers. She wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide a better standard of living for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell at home by herself.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nilda works hard to support her family.

She has a roofing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Nilda is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more nipa palm leaves and bamboo for her roofing business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa palm leaves and bamboo for her roofing business.

loans.name: Nguyet

texts.en:
Nguyet is 49 years old and married with two children, a son and a daughter. Her husband is a driver for hire. Nguyet has been running a food stall in front of her door for 10 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate an income with which to raise her children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nguyet is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more soft drinks and dumplings to sell at her stall. She also will use a part of her loan to repair her house for better living conditions. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the production of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and dumplings to sell and to repair her house.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van, age 53, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a daughter and her husband. Van's husband earns money through his business of selling decorative plants. Van is selling garments and plastic household items to support her family. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of garments to meet her customers' needs. She hopes that as a result of establishing her business, she will ensure that her children will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy garments for selling.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina plants and harvests corn and other crops on their farm to make a living. Doing this for more than thirty years, she earns good enough for their daily needs. She had successfully repaid her previous loan that she used on their farm.

Currently, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microfinance to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. In the future, Felina wants to make improvements to her house and to have better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith owns and operates a service-based business providing transportation in their community. She has been in this business for eleven years to make a living. She earns well from the business and had successfully repaid her previous loan used in her business.

Currently, she borrowed a new loan to buy spare parts and paints for repair. She planned and hoped to buy another vehicle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and paints for repair

loans.name: Patrocenia

texts.en:
Patrocenia is a widow who earns a living from a banana farm. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microfinance to be used for weeding maintenance, post harvest and fertilization costs. She wants to gain more harvest out of the investments provided to improve her farm.

She plans to save a portion of her returns for future emergencies.

loans.use: for weeding maintenance, post harvest and fertilization costs

loans.name: Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group

texts.en:
Moureen is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine Group.  She is aged 28 with 4 children and is living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She is operating a drug shop alongside farming in order to boost her income. She started this business in order to manage looking after her family that was so demanding in terms of basic needs. She is mainly facing challenges of high prices and high license for health activities. However, she has a vision of educating her children to higher levels of learning. Moureen has asked for a loan to buy drugs for her drug shop to sell.

She is a member of Bunyonyi Ageteraine group where each member guarantees the other to get a loan. There are seven members in the photo but only six will take the loan.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell in her drug shop

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a 51-year-old woman from Sachkhere district. She lives with her son, grandson and mother-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Besides that, the only source of the family's income is Ketevan's job working as a nurse and getting 200 GEL per month. This income is hardly enough for the family to meet their basic needs, so Ketevan decided somehow to improve her salary and start another activity.

She couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions (because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue) until the Start Up program, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo, began. The program allows rural poor like Ketevan to get a chance to start or re-start a business. 

She requested a loan of 1,200 USD to begin trading clothing. She plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell among her friends and neighbors. This will be a huge support for this hardworking woman to earn a living and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Fanny Alexandra

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Credito Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora  Fanny, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos  hijos de 7 y 5 años que estudian en una escuela de la localidad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. 
Doña Fanny al verse sola con sus dos hijos y para que a estos no le falte nada lucha muy duro día a día, se dedica a la venta de pescado por libras o pescado pequeño, ella instala un pequeño puesto en las afueras de su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes día a día a surtirse de sus productos,  en ocasiones se desplaza hasta las playas de Manta a comprar a los barcos pesqueros directamente pero también le entregan en su negocio ciertos comerciantes mayoristas. Esta es su forma de ganarse el sustento propio y el de sus hijos, son dos años que lleva con este negocio el cual con la ayuda de los créditos aumenta cada vez más. 
Este  crédito es para comprar pescado, lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan en la institución para sacar adelante a su familia. Sus sueños tener su casa propia y que a sus hijos no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The "Calle 1 de Enero" loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its artisan products which are known nationally and internationally.  It is from here that the famous Panama hat comes.

And it is here that 26-year-old Fanny lives.  She is a single mother to two children, aged seven and five years old each.  They both attend the local school.  Fanny lives with her parents.

As Fanny is alone with her two children, she fights very hard every day so that they do not need for anything. Fanny works selling fish by the pound or selling small fish.  She has a small stall just outside her house where her customers come day after day to stock up on her products.  On occasion Fanny heads to the beach in Manta to buy directly from fishermen but she also buys from other bulk sellers.  This work allows Fanny to earn a living to support herself and her children. She has had the business for two years and, with the help of the loan, it is always growing.

This loan will used to buy fish.  Fanny has been with the loan group for three loan cycles and she likes it because the institution provides her with what she needs to help her family get ahead.  Fanny's dreams are to have her own house and for her children not to need for anything.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego es una persona muy tranquila, recta, disciplinada, por sobre todo en su vida de estudiante. Su familia es humilde, responsable y por sobre todo muy cumplida. Quiere ser un profesional importante, es por eso que está estudiando la carrera de Derecho, para poder ser un buen profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus clases y cuotas, lo que le permitirá seguir estudiando y destacándose como estudiante.
texts.en:
Diego is a very quiet, well-behaved student.  His family is poor, responsible and very courteous.  Diego wants to study and be a professional.  He is studying law so that he can be a good professional and help other people.

Diego is applying for this loan in order to pay for classes and tuition fees.  This will allow him to keep studying and be a very good student.

loans.use: to pay for classes and university fees.

loans.name: María Fernanda

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón MontecristiM,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 10, 8 y 4 años, los dos mayores  estudian en escuela y el menor en jardín de infantes. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa privada.
Doña María con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos de todo tipo, sabanas, edredones, entre otros productos que ella vende, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes razón por lo cual en ocasiones no tiene el capital necesario para comprar mercadería es allí cuando los créditos le ayudan mucho. Son 5 años dedicada al comercio con el cual le da para los estudios de sus hijos ya que esto es lo más importante para ella. 
Este crédito es para  comprar ropa, sabanas, zapatos entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The "Calle 1 de Enero" loan group meets every fortnight in the Montecristi canton, an area known for its rich, pre-colonial culture and for its artisan products which are known nationally and internationally.  It is from here that the famous Panama hat comes.

And it is here that 33-year-old María lives.  She is married and has three children, aged ten, eight and four years old respectively.  The two oldest children attend school while the youngest is in nursery.  María's husband works for a private business.

With the intention of earning some money on her own and in order to be able to help her husband to get ahead, María works selling clothes, all types of shoes, bedsheets, duvets and other products.  She sells from door-to-door and also sells from her home, where customers visit her. María sometimes sells on credit and so does not always have the capital that she needs to buy merchandise.  At these times, the loans are of great help to María.  María has been running this business for five years and, with her income, she is able to pay for her children's education..  Her children are the most important thing in María's life.

This loan will used to buy clothes, sheets, shoes and other items to sell.  María has been with the loan group since the beginning and she likes it because they allow her to finance her business.  María's dream is to give her children the best that she can.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets, shoes and more.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrian es un abogado recibido, pero es un profesional que sabe que la única forma de poder ser alguien en la vida es poder seguir estudiando, ya que sabe que es la única forma de poder salir adelante.
El está estudiando para ser profesor universitario, ya que quiere poder ayudar a las personas que al igual que el quieren aprender y estudiar.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas y también en gastos de transporte y agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo
texts.en:
Adrian is a lawyer but he is also a professional who knows that the only way to be someone in life is to keep studying, he knows this is the only way to get ahead.

He's studying to be a university professor as he wants tot help people who want to learn and study like him.

He ask for this loan so that he can invest it in his university fees and also on transport costs. He's grateful for the help he's receiving.

loans.use: Pay for university fees and transport costs

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella vivía con sus abuelos, pero ambos ya fallecieron, por lo que se quedó sola, tuvo muchos inconvenientes en la vida, pero no se dejó caer.
Es una persona muy luchadora y por sobre todo quiere salir adelante. Está estudiando la carrera de Derecho y Notariado,  ya que así podrá desarrollarse como persona y como profesional. Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en las cuotas de su universidad, para que así pueda seguir luchando por mejorar y crecer.
texts.en:
Aurora is from the city of Carapeguá.  She used to live with her grandparents but they died so she was left alone.  She had a lot of problems in life but didn't let them stop her.

Aurora's a very determined person and above all she wants to get ahead.  She's studying law and notary services because she'll be able to grow as a person and a professional.

She's requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can keep on striving to improve and grow.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
Alberto es una persona que está trabajando y estudiando al mismo tiempo, comenta que es algo muy sacrificado el estudiar y trabajar al mismo tiempo, pero lo hace, ya que es la única forma de poder crecer.
Está siguiendo la carrera de contabilidad, con lo que quiere poder tener su propio negocio y aplicar todo lo que aprendió por medio de su carrera.
Pide este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de la cuota de su universidad y estar así al día con sus obligaciones. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en:
Alberto is someone who works and goes to school at the same time.  He says it's very demanding, but he does it because it's the only way he can grow.  He's studying accounting so he can have his own business and apply everything he learned in his program.

Alberto's requesting this loan to pay his university fees so he can be current with his obligations.

He's grateful for this opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Marhamatkhon

texts.ru: Мархаматхон добродушная женщина. Ей 43 года. Она вдова и имеет 2 несовершеннолетних детей. Она более 23 года работает в средней школе учительницей. Мархаматхон опытный педагог. Она имеет свой педагогический подход. Мархаматхон хочет, чтобы ее дети тоже получили хорошее образование. Ее дети учатся в частной школе. Она должна оплатить за учебу своих детей. Однако у нее нет денег, так как у нее маленькая зарплата. Мархаматхон запрашивает займ а сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учёбы детей. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Marhamatkhon is a kind-hearted 43 year old woman.  She is a widow and has two minor children.  Marhamatkhon is an experienced teacher, having taught in a middle school for more than 23 years.  She uses her own approach to teaching.

Marhamatkhon wants her children to have good educations, too.  Her children go to a private school and she must pay their tuition.  However, she doesn't have the money because she earns a small salary.  Marhamatkhon is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) for paying the tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her children's tuition

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 52-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 15 years to 30 years. She describes herself as confident. She operates a farm where she keeps cows which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favorable place and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenges as pests and diseases. 

Alice will use this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy animal feeds and drugs for her cows. Her business goal is to serve large-scale customers within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a prosperous business. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: buy animal feeds and drugs for her cows

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат 38-летняя замужняя женщина с тремя детьми, проживает со своей семьей в районе Бохтар. Она занимается выращиванием крупнорогатого скота. Сабохат в основном разводит коров молочной и мясной породы. Она занимается этой деятельностью более 20 лет и имеет большой опыт в животноводстве. Сабохат ухаживает за скотом сама, а куплю и продажу осуществляет ее муж. Они работают совместно. Ее муж также является певцом. Он поёт на свадьбах и получает дополнительный доход. 
Сабохат сейчас просит кредит для животноводства. Она хочет купить корову и увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе.
texts.en:
Sabohat is 38 years old, married, and has three children.  She and her family live in the Bohtar region.  She is in the business of raising cattle.  Sabohat primarily raises beef and dairy cows.  She has been in this business for more than 20 years and has a great deal of experience in animal husbandry.  Sabohat looks after her cattle herself, and her husband does the buying and selling of the cattle.  They run the business together.  Her husband is also a singer and sings at weddings to earn a supplemental income.

Sabohat is requesting a loan for her cattle business.  She wants to buy a cow to enlarge her herd.

loans.use: to enlarge her herd with the purchase of a cow

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 35-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 2 years to 17 years. She describes herself as confident. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a conducive environment with market availability and sufficient water. Her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations.

Irene will use this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm. Her business goal is to be dealing with large-scale customers within five years. She hopes that she will be successful in the future. This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. She will use the anticipated profit to start another business.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer for use on her farm

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is a farmer. She lives in the village of Qarakert in the Armavir region and has been involved in agriculture for many years. Zhanna lives with her two sons. Her husband is a migrant worker. With the help of her two sons, Zhanna owns a small farm. It includes three cows and three calves. Zhanna gets milk and uses it in cheese production. She also cultivates watermelon. The income that they gather from their agribusiness is highly important, as it helps them to cover basic costs. Now this hardworking woman asks for this loan to be able to increase her livestock with three more calves and enlarge her agribusiness.

Zhanna has taken out a loan from a local financial institution before but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to work during recent times, she has been able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Zhanna and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for three calves

loans.name: Gulbarg

texts.ru: Гулбарг порядочная женщина. Ей 35 лет. Она вдова и не имеет детей. Гулбарг живет одна. Она более 2 лет работает в местной больнице. Она работает в отделе кадров. Гулбарг честно выполняет свою работу. Гулбарг является одной из успешных кадров. Она хочет расширить свой кругозор, получить второе высшее образование. С такой целью она поступила в университет. Она учится в очное отделение. Гулбарг успешно справляется и с учебой и с работой. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulbarg is a clean-living 35 year old woman.  She is a widow and has no children.  Gulbarg lives alone.  She has been working in the human resources department of the local hospital for more than two years.  She goes about her work honestly.  Gulbarg is one of the most successful of the staff members.

Gulbarg wants to broaden her horizons and earn a second degree.  With this goal in mind, she enrolled in the university where she takes a full course load.  Gulbarg is able to successfully handle both her course work and her work in the hospital.  She is requesting a loan of 4,500 somoni (TJS) to pay her university tuition.  She is relying on your kindness..

loans.use: to pay her university tuition

loans.name: Abdullojon

texts.ru:
Этот молодой мужчина фермер. Его зовут Абдуллочон. Он у себя дома в коровнике выращивает крупно рогатых скотов. В работе ему помогает его жена и брат. Абдуллочон женат и имеет детей. Его дети ходят в школу, и для их образования он старается всеми силами. 
   Абдуллочон просит кредит, чтобы купить крупно рогатых скотов. Он собирается кормить и выращивать их в коровнике. После определенных дней откорма Абдуллочон продаст их мясо на рынке родного района Вахш. Такой деятельностью он занимается около 4 года. Причина по которой Абдуллочон берет кредит это не предвиденные семейные расходы. Ему не хватает часть суммы для покупки скотов. Абдуллочон верит, что он сможет собрать часть недостающей суммы с Вашей помощью. Помогите ему!
texts.en:
This young man is named Abdullojon and he is a farmer.  He has a barn at home where he raises his cattle.  His wife and brother help him with his work.  Abdullojon is married and has children.  The children go to school and Abdullojon does every thing he can so they can get an education.  

Abdullojon is requesting the loan so he can buy cattle.  He plans to feed and raise them in his barn.  After fattening them up for a certain number of days, Abdullojon will sell their meat at the market in his native Vakhsh region.  Abdullojon has been in this business for 4 years.  He has to take out this loan because he had some unforeseen family expenses.  He doesn't have all the money he needs for this purchase.  Abdullojon believes that, with your help, he will be able to come up with the rest of the money.  Please help him!

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Violeta María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
La señora Violeta tiene 52 años de edad, hace algún tiempo atrás su esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene  cuatro hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella y la menor estudia en universidad.
Doña Violeta para salir adelante y para que no les falte nada a su familia se dedica al comercio vende aliños, especias, sobrecamas, carteras y ropa entre otras cosas, tiene un pequeño local en el mercado local en el cual los fines de semana vende sus productos, ella también se desplaza a otras ciudades en los días de feria que hay en esos pueblos todas las semanas, los productos los compran en Santo Domingo, ella lleva más de 5  años con el negocio de los aliños, empezó con los créditos de la Fundación Espoir por lo cual esta agradecida ya que con esto ella y su familia salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar aliños, carteras, sabanas entre otras cosas. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito  desde hace ya 17 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante. Su sueño es que su hija sea una profesional.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents are farmers and raise animals. It’s an area of great vegetation.

Violeta is 52 years old and her husband passed away some time ago. She has four adult children and two of them still live with her and the youngest attends university.  Violeta sells salad dressing, spices, bed spreads, wallets, clothing, and other things.  She has a small shop in the local market, where she sells her products on the weekends.  She also goes to other towns on days where there are fairs each week.  She makes her purchases in Santo Domingo.  She has had the salad dressing business for more than five years and she started with a loan through Fundación Espoir, for which she is grateful and through which her family gets ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy salad dressing, wallets, bed sheets, and other things.  She was a founding partner of the credit group 17 years ago and she likes that it helps her get ahead.  Her dream is for her daughter to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gina Jaqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito La Inmaculada, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Gina, tiene 46 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero no ha podido tener hijos. El marido es chofer.  
Doña Gina con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y para no depender de su marido se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa, ella le envían la mercadería desde los Estados Unidos la cual es de muy buena calidad y del gusto de sus clientes. Son 3 años  que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para pagar la ropa que está por llegarle. Lleva 6 ciclos  en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos. Su sueño es comprar un carro para salir a realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “La Inmaculada” credit group meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua. This area is known for being very dynamic, where the majority of its residents are farmers and raise animals. It’s an area of great vegetation.

Gina lives here.  She is 46 years old, in a common law marriage but doesn’t have any children.  Her husband is a driver.

Gina sells clothing of all types, door to door and from her home, in order to earn some money on her own and not have to be completely dependent on her husband.  She has her merchandise sent to her from the United States and it’s of good quality and to her customer’s liking.  She has had this business for three years and things are going very well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to pay for clothing that is on the way.  She has had six cycles in the credit group and she likes the ease of getting loans.  Her dream is to buy a car so she can make her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: For the last 35 years, Josephine has been farming, which has been very profitable and earns a good income. She has applied for a second loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from VisionFund Kenya after repaying her first loan successfully. Josephine intends to use this loan to boost her farming activities by buying planting seeds, fertilizer and herbicides. Her monthly income right now is 17,000 KES and she hopes to use profits realized from her expanded business to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya and to improve her current business. In the future, she hopes to be a well-established farmer in her area.

loans.use: to buy planting seeds, fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Carlsyne

texts.en:
Carlsyne is a 29 year old single woman. She has two children and describes herself as confident.

She has a clothes store and has been involved in this business for two years. She operates in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale.

Carlsyne says her biggest business challenge are price fluctuations, and she will use the KES 20,000 loan to add to her stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

Carlsyne's business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma is 46-year-old woman from village Jalaurta Sachkhere district. She lives with her husband, son and father-in-law, who gets monthly assistance from the local government. Her husband has a monthly income of 350 GEL from money transfers. The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have one milk-cow whose products are sold locally, and a plot of agricultural land belongs to the family. They cultivate the land and get a small income from its products. As Irma's husband doesn't have his own activity except transfers, he wants to do his bit for the welfare of the family and start his own activity. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Irma's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 4,000 GEL to purchase working tools abroad, pay the toll for them, and open a vehicle repair workshop. Irma's husband will work as an artisan and generate income from private orders. The business initiative will be profitable because of its location and being the only workshop in the area. The family relies on the good will of the lenders and awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase working tools and open a vehicle repair workshop

loans.name: Medilyn

texts.en: Medilyn is married with an only child. She manages her own cafeteria to make a living. She took out a new loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to buy more ingredients to cook in order to increase and improve her offerings. She wants to improve her business to have a better source of income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to cook in her cafeteria

loans.name: Rafikzhon

texts.ru:
Этого продавца муки зовут Рафикжон. Он веселый и жизнелюбивый мужчина. Рафикжон старается работать и зарабатывать ради своей семьи и получает от этого удовольствие. Его профессия стала для него любимой работой. Для Рафикжона такая работа приносит хороший доход, и он может приятно проводить время. Рафикжон общительный мужчина. Он помогает продавцам определиться с выбором муки и масло, и выбрать продукт, который больше им подходит. 
   Рафикжон хочет взять кредит. На сумму кредита он планирует расширить свою деятельность и купить необходимое количество муки и бутылок хлопковых масел. Рафикжон надеется,  его маленький бизнес будет процветать после полученного кредита.
texts.en:
This man is named Rafikzhon and he sells flour.  He is a happy and life-loving man.  Rafikzhon tries to work and earn money for the sake of his family and this brings him satisfaction.  For him, the profession became a beloved job.  This kind of work brings Rafikzhon a good income and he enjoys spending his time this way.  Rafikzhon is an outgoing person.  He helps people with their choices of flour and oil, and with which products will best fit their needs.  

Rafikzhon wants to take out a loan.  He is planning to use the loan to expand his business by buying the necessary quantities of flour and bottles of cottonseed oil.  Rafikzhon hopes that his small business will flourish after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to buy flour and oils

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
Rodita is a hardworking entrepreneur who makes nipa roofing in the Philippines. Rodita has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables and fruits.

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of nipa leaves and bamboo to make nipa roofing.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of nipa leaves and bamboo to make nipa roofing.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 39 years old and married with one child in school. Rowena works very hard to provide for her family.

Rowena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. 

Rowena requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

In the future Rowena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 28 years old and comes from Nakuru. He is married to Mercyline and they are blessed with two children aged seven years old and one month old.

Charles has been operating his small food kiosk for the last five years and to enable him buy stock like baking flour, sugar, charcoal and cooking fat to be used in his food stall, he has applied for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES.10,000 and his intention is to use profits realized from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay back his loan to VisionFund Kenya and expand his current business.In the future, Charles hopes to be a successful businessman .

loans.use: to buy  sugar, cooking fat, baking flour and charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Mary Lou

texts.en: Mary Lou is a single entrepreneur who manages her retail business to make a living. She has been selling used clothes for more than a year and she earns well for her needs. She joined GDMPC and took out a loan to buy additional used clothes to resell. She wants to improve her business for a better living in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothes to resell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita owns and operates a nipa hut manufacturing business in their village and she has earned well enough from this so that she was able to repay her previous loans from GDMPC successfully. Currently, Lolita borrowed a new loan to purchase additional palm leaves and woven nipa mats to resell in order to cater for demand and fill orders. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional palm leaves and woven nipa mats to resell

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh, 34, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including one son and her husband. Her husband is a worker in a storehouse. 

Trinh earns money through her business selling food for breakfast. She would like to get a loan to buy food and new furniture for her food stall. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy food and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri is a 42-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, his student son and his pensioner mother in the Ozurgeti district. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. They have a plot of agricultural land where maize and nut trees are grown. They always have high quality products, which are sold to local markets at a good price. 

Badri has a car workshop and he repairs cars. He needs additional equipment for his workshop and requests a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2,500 Gel for purchasing this equipment. When the equipment is purchased, he will get more orders from his customers and thus the income will increase. The Start Up program will be a great support for him.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Isaac's Group

texts.en:
Isaac is a member of this group in Chwele District.  He is pictured here in a group of 4 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 56 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Isaac has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
							
Isaac is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 10 years.  Isaac works as a farmer to provide for his two children.  The community and other farmers know Isaac as friendly, hardworking and trustworthy.  Other than farming, he is also involved in his community groups such as the men's group and prayer group. 

Isaac was not with One Acre Fund last year, and hopes he can have a better harvest this year with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in the group.	

Isaac has just enrolled with One Acre Fund this year and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Isaac joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member.  Isaac plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers and that is why he has joined them.   

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Isaac and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 63-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from 19 years to 26 years. He describes himself as confident. He operates a dairy farm where he keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a conducive environment, good for dairy farming, and his primary customers are small scale. He describes his biggest business challenges as pests and diseases.

Francis will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy stock of animal feeds. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be prosperous. This is his first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. He will use the anticipated profit to build a home for his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of animal feeds

loans.name: Grigol

texts.en:
Grigol is 44-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and pensioner mother in a small village of Zestaponi district. Grigol's wife works as a teacher at a local school and is paid 400 Gel per month. Grigol is involved in agricultural activities. He has a vineyard and a plot of land where walnut trees are grown. Grigol produces wine and sells it locally. 

Grigol decided to start a new business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $ 4500 for purchasing a minibus. When the minibus is purchased, he will begin to sell fruits and vegetables. The new business initiative will be a great support for the family, as Grigol will have his own stable income. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a minibus and sell fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 57-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a retail store where she sells sandals, cooking pans, thermoses and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a place with potential and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price inflation. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of sandals, cooking pans and other items. Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will better be able to provide for her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to cater to her family's needs.

loans.use: to add to her stock of sandals, cooking pans and other items.

loans.name: Muhammadzoir

texts.ru: Этого молодого человека зовут Мухаммадзоир. Он женат и является отцом двухлетней девочки. Мухаммадзоир со своей семьей проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Он после окончания школы не смог поступить в университет из-за финансов и начал зарабатывать на жизнь. Последние два года Мухаммадзоир занимается предоставлением услуги такси в своем городе. Ему нравится его работа, однако сейчас он не может продолжить работу, поскольку его машина имеет технические неполадки. У Мухаммадзоира на руках нет достаточной суммы, чтобы отремонтировать машину и поэтому он обратился за кредитом. На сумму от кредита он хочет купить запасные части машины и отремонтировав его продолжить свою работу. Мухаммадзоир просит поддержки, потому что кроме услуги такси у него нет другого источника дохода.
texts.en:
This young man is named Muhammadzoir.  He is married and the father of a two year old girl.  Muhammadzoir and his family live in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  After finishing school, he couldn't go to the university because of his finances, so he started to earn a living.

For the last two years, Muhammadzoir has been in business offering taxi services in his city.  He likes this job, but right now he isn't able to work because his car has mechanical problems.  Muhammadzoir is asking for a loan because he doesn't have enough money on hand to repair his car and get back to work.
