Therefore, Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her sons would be able to buy an auto rickshaw body. 
She hopes that she would be able to make enough savings until the time of their marriages. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her sons buy an auto rickshaw body.

loans.name: Thanh Yen Group

texts.en:
Hue, 43, is working at agricultural production, including cultivating rice and raising chickens with a monthly average income of 3,000,000 Dong (VND). She lives with her husband who is also a farmer, along with her 2 children. For extra income to cover their living expenses, she and her spouse have also been working for a local construction employer.

Currently, she's facing a challenge of crop damage from the last harvest. Both of her 2 children are still at school and she wants to expand her business to cover their tuition fees as well as give them a better standard of living. For that reason, she wants to take out a loan to buy more chickens and ducks to diversify her business activities and increase her family's income. 

With her business profit, Hue hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her business to do well, and her children to do well in school. Hue is the team leader of Thanh Yen Group of 12 members. In the picture, she stands at the first from right.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and ducks

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu lives in West Point, Liberia. She is 32 years old. She is married and has two children aged 1 and 8. Since 2010 she has been selling soap, body cream and others items in her community. She received a small amount from her oldest brother to start her business, which she learned from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a profit. She is requesting her 5th loan to purchase more body cream, bath soap and many other items for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, bath soap and many other items for her business.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 30-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 2 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

Lubna wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.en:
Aziza is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the wholesale market and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Aziza requested a loan of PKR 50,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the winter season.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, who is 57 years old and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is single, and she manages her house as she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.

Virginia operates a market stall. She sells vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantity of vegetables and sells it per kilo. She also sells different repacked products, such as peppers, laurel leaves, potassium aluminum sulfate, and other products. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory.
 
Virginia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 27 years old and has three children, two of whom in school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a retail gasoline business in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Liza has been in this business for one year.

In the future Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Saruni

texts.en:
Saruni is 55 years old, comes from Naivasha, and is married to Mary. They have seven children who are all in school.

Saruni has a farming business that he has been running for many years. He has applied for his first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him to buy seedlings and fertilizers to use in his farm.

He hopes to see his business do better in the near future and be the leading farmer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Kipngeno

texts.en:
Kipngeno is a married man and he has six children. He describes himself to be determined. 

Kipngeno operates a transport business where he owns a taxi for transporting customers from one place to another. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a favorable place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns. 

Kipngeno will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy fuel and spare parts for his taxi. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future he will prosper. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy fuel and spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 39 year old single woman. She has 2 children, ages 7 years and 12 years. She describes herself to be confident and determined. 

Lucy operates a retail shop where she sells drinks, tomatoes, washing soap and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are small scale customers. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of tomatoes, drinks, sugar and other items she sells. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to start another business.

loans.use: add stock of tomatoes, drinks, sugar and other items to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 56-year-old married man. He has 5 children between the ages of 17 and 26. He describes himself as confident. 

He operates a retail stall where he sells hoes, cooking stoves, spades, and water cans. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a conducive area and his primary customers are small scale buyers. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be low returns. He will use the 10,000 KES loan to purchase cooking stoves, spades, and water cans. 

His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.  He will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land. He also does dairy farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to purchase cooking stoves, spades, and water cans.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a married woman. She has one child who is aged one. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in tastes and preferences of customers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a large boutique within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will economically sustain her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet is a 36-year-old married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are both small scale and large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests which attack cereals. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of cereals. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to add stock of cereals.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en: Kache is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail stall where she sells fish. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her family challenge to be shortage of water. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have access to water easily. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Benjamin Rafael

texts.es:
Benjamín, se dispone a adquirir tintas, papelería, y repuestos para su fotocopiadora, por lo que necesita capital para efectuar su compra, Así su negocio seguirá funcionando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Con el crédito anterior invirtió en productos necesarios para que su negocio continúe activo, le dio como resultados un aumento en sus ganancias, ha cancelado sus deudas y sigue cubriendo los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Benjamín is preparing to buy ink, stationery and replacement parts for his copy machine, so he needs capital to make his purchase. In this way his business will keep functioning and giving a good service to his customers.

With the previous loan he invested in products he needed for his business to remain active. This resulted in an increase in his earnings; he has paid off his debts and continues covering his family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy ink, stationery and replacement parts for his copy machine

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy the needed materials for her gardening business. She has had this business for fifteen years now and it continues to grow. Her income from the business is helpful in their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would now like to apply for a 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizer needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her cover their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes to have more varieties of seeds and plants to plant and dreams of having other sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening supplies and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene didn't manage to buy calves with her previous Start up loan, as the prices were too high. She purchased only a horse, which her husband needs for transporting firewood from the forest for selling. 

Elene repaid her loan, and now she is requesting a loan again for starting an animal husbandry business.

With this Start up loan, she will buy several calves, raise them, and sell them with a price mark-up in fall season. 

Elene hopes the family will get a good income after selling livestock, and they will improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy several calves and start a livestock business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James used the previous loan to buy iron sheets to roof his house. He is a hardworking 18-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling milk. He also runs a video hall, which has enabled him to boost his income. 

James faces a challenge of unpredictable weather changes, which leads to price fluctuations of milk sales while his vision is to own a dairy that can supply the whole region and to construct a permanent residential house. 

James is requesting a loan to buy milk to sell and renovate his video hall.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell and renovate his video hall.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 23-year-old farmer living in Kisii with her 2 children, both of whom are of school-going age. Janet has been farming for 8 years, producing and selling milk, eggs and tea. She really enjoys farming as it is her main source of income. Her major challenge is she cannot access the markets easily because of poor roads, especially during wet seasons.

Janet chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have good customer service; they help the farmer to grow economically by giving them asset finances. Janet's highest expense comes from school fees. Through the income generated from the use of the loan, she will be able to cover her children's school fees and also improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shamillah

texts.en:
Shamillah is a thirty-five-year-old hardworking woman with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. In order to raise money to support her family, she started with five hundred thousand shillings but currently her business is worth two million. The good mother that she is, she desires to educate her children, buy a plot of land and build a permanent house for a residence. 

Shamillah’s main hardships are weather changes that lead to low food production hence high costs of food from farmers. This can lead to low profits and inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands. Her dreams are to venture into agriculture and expand her business into a hotel. 

Shamillah is requesting a loan to buy tables, chairs and food for her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and food for her restaurant

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is a farmer who raises cattle,  and sells produce  and  goats to earn a living. 

He started this business to educate his children and sustain his family.  His business is affected by challenges such as high transportation costs and weather conditions. 

He has a vision of owning a big produce store in two years and move his business from the village into town.

Vincent requests  a loan to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Enid

texts.en:
Enid is a 32-year-old hardworking woman with 2 children living in Fort Portal,Uganda.

She is a tailor but also raises poultry in order to earn money to support her family.  Like most responsible mothers, she desires to educate her children to attain degrees.  Customers who do not pay on time and diseases that infect poultry pose threats to her business. Her dream is to start a tailoring school.  Enid intends to use the loan to buy fabric and  poultry feeds.

loans.use: to buy fabric and  poultry feeds.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is from Miasnikyan village of Armavir region. She lives with her husband, father-in-law (in the photo) and her two school age children. Karine's husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and Karine, together with her father-in-law, has been involved in agriculture. They own a farm which includes livestock of a pig, cows and chickens and also cultivate wheat, tomatoes, sunflowers, watermelon, and greens. Karine and her father-in-low work hard to gather a good harvest and by selling it in the local open market gather income for their living.

Now by applying for this loan, Karine plans to purchase a cow, a pig and forage for feeding the livestock. She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to hard work during the recent times, Karine and her family were able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments of this loan. So, Karine has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Karine hopes and waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, a pig and forage for feeding the livestock.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is from Armavir town. He is an enthusiastic student at Armenian State Economic University in the department of marketing. Edgar lives with his mother and two sisters. Edgar's father is a migrant worker in a neighboring country who works hard to sustain his family financially. Together with his studies, Edgar doesn't manage to work and help his family financially. Because of the difficult financial conditions that the family currently faces, it is very difficult for Edgar to save money for his education. So, by applying for this loan Edgar wants to pay for his university tuition. He hopes that lenders will assist him to continue his education at the university which will be a huge support for him.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi is from Dalarik village of Armavir region. She lives there with her husband, mother, son and daughter. Together with her husband, Armenuhi has been involved in  agriculture for many years. They are running a farm which includes 20 chickens, a cow and calf. The couple also cultivates watermelon and greens in the arable land which is located near the village where they live. 

Armenuhi has applied for this loan to be able to purchase 3 pigs, forage for feeding livestock, fertilizer and seeds. She has taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but because of hard financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. However, Armenuhi and her husband were able to become financially stable due to their farm. Ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments of new loan, Armenuhi has now applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Armenuhi will be very grateful to lenders for giving her a second chance to improve her agribusiness and sustain better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for 3 pigs, forage for feeding livestock, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Nshan

texts.en:
Nshan is from Taperakan village, of the Ararat region. He is a farmer with ten years of experience in running a farm. The farm includes arable land where Nshan cultivates tomatoes and grows different types of fruit trees (apricot, peach, grape, and apple). Nshan works hard to be able to gather a good harvest and to sell to local resalers. The income that comes from his agribusiness is the main source of his family's income. Nshan is a father of two grown-up children. 

Nshan has taken a loan from a local financial institution before but, unfortunately, he wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Nshan was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, Nshan has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan will be a huge support for Nshan, giving him a second chance to improve his farm and gather more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse, an ox, and forage for feeding livestock.

loans.name: Nashwan

texts.en: Nashwan is a 27-year-old man. He is married and has children. He lives in Hodeida, Yemen. For the past two years, he has been driving a bus, which has been a profitable business.  It is the main source of income for the family, but he also needs more support to cover the costs from time to time. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to help him cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts for the bus. This will increase the capacity of the bus to work extra hours and enable Nashwan to improve his family's income.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing necessary spare parts for the bus that he drives.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 32 years old and lives in West Point which is one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado county. 

She is single and has 2 children aged 1month and 16 years old. Only one of her children is in school and they both live at home. 

For the past year, she has sold soft drinks, cold water and used clothing. One problem she faces is the rainy season.

She requests a loan to purchase soft drinks, cold water and used clothing for her business. She likes her business because of the way people respond to it. She plans is to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, cold water and used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est une femme de 34 ans célibataire mère de 3 enfants de 7 et 22 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, macabos, ignames) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de vivres frais ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Julienne is a 34-year-old woman who is single and the mother of 3 children aged between 7 and 22. She is a retailer and has been selling seasonal fresh food (cassava, macabo - a tuber similar to taro root - and yams) at a local market for the past 16 years. She knows her suppliers well and she knows her customers, whom she has acquired over time thanks to her experience, especially well. Unfortunately, she constantly suffers from stock shortages because she is forced to sell all of her merchandise before being able to buy new stock because of her limited capital. She would like to increase her inventory of fresh food so that she is better able to satisfy the continuous demand of her clientèle without suffering from stock shortages. She plans to save her profit so that she is able to expand her business and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fresh food (cassava, macabo and yams).

loans.name: Anastasie Marie

texts.fr: Marie une femme de 43 ans,  mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 17 et 27 ans. Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'elle gère elle même depuis 03 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, elle ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'elle lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité . Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Anastasie Marie is a 43-year-old woman who is the mother of 4 children aged between 17 and 27. She is a shopkeeper who has opened a small shop which she has been running for 3 years. It is thanks to her business that she is able to meet her family's needs. Over time, she has acquired a growing and loyal clientèle due to her warm welcome and the good relationships she maintains with her neighbours. Unfortunately, she is unable to satisfy her customers completely, which is why she currently needs this loan for her business, as it will enable her to increase her inventory of essential products. This will increase her sales and therefore her profit margin. Part of the profit will be reinvested in her business in order to expand it, and part of it will be used to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of essential products.

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en: Susannah is 46-years-old and lives at the West point area, which has the most populated market in Montserrado County.  She is married and has 10 children; only three attend school and live at home. She described herself as a hard-working woman.  For the past eight months, she has been running a local restaurant.  She sells for six days a week from 7 AM to 5 PM.  She likes her business because of the ways customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared-taxi every time to get her goods at her business table.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, meat, rice, pepper, oil, Maggi cubes, etc. for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She likes to say thanks to the lenders who are supporting BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, meat, rice, pepper, oil, Maggi cubes, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Pricious

texts.en:
Pricious lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 24 years old, single, and she has two children who live at home and attend school. 

For seven years, Pricious has been running a table where she sells pigs' feet in the local market. One of the problems she faces is low income. She enjoys the interaction of her customers and the profit she makes. 

Pricious is requesting a loan to purchase more pigs' feet for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs' feet for her business.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 39 years old and lives in West Point. She is married to a local businessman and has 6 children. The last child is 16 years old, and only five of them are currently in school, and live at home. 

For the past 16 years, Annie has been selling coal in the local market. One of her major problems is during the rainy season she has less customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal for her business. She hopes to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 27 years old and lives in West Point. She did not go to school and she has two children, ages three and six years old, who are attending school.  

Tina has been operating a local restaurant where she sells delicious Liberian soup and rice. One of her main challenges is that she can’t keep up with the demands of her customers, due to the lack of capital for her business. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, rice, oil, coal, pepper, meat, etc. for her business. In the future, Tina hopes to, one day, be a house owner.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, oil, coal, pepper, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
A $600.00 loan is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working. Adelina will use this loan to buy stock to keep in her store like hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, sprite, sagiko), cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and salt. She is generating a good income from selling.

Adelina has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, sprite, sagiko), cigarettes, coffee, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Elizabeth Phillip

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 39-year-old married mother of four children. Three of the children go to school. She heard about Finance South Sudan Limited through marketing posters. She does her business in Munuki Town, in Juba County, South Sudan.

Elizabeth is a businesswoman who owns a retail shop that sells items like soaps, eggs, toothbrushes and toothpastes among many other household goods. She has been doing this business for about three years. She is taking out a loan worth 1,500 South Sudanese pounds to enable her to buy more stock like eggs, soaps and many other items for the business. The loan will enable her also to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy items like toothbrushes, toothpastes, eggs and soaps

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Благодаря своевременной финансовой помощи от КИВА в бизнесе Марии ее доход вырос на 2 000 гривен. Для хозяйства она смогла даже приобрести маленький трактор.
Мария готовится к новому весеннему сезону и хочет купить семена для парника на 10 000 гривен. Она надеется, что выручка и дальше будет продолжать расти и у нее получится достроить собственный дом, где проживает ее семья.
texts.en: Thanks to the timely financial aid from Kiva, Mariya's business income rose by 2,000 hryvnia.  She was even able to purchase a small tractor for the household.  Mariya is preparing for the new, spring season and wants to purchase seeds for her greenhouse with 10,000 hryvnia.  She hopes that the profit will continue to rise and she will be able to complete the construction of her own house, where her family lives.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her greenhouse

loans.name: Albertinha

texts.en:
Albertinha is applying for a loan of $ 1,500.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin).  She is a 32-year-old-married woman. Albertinha runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy items for her general store such as coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, cigarettes, slippers, Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite, Sagiko, eggs, fish, and water.  She makes good money selling these items and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Albertinha lives in a town near the school and her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people (including students) come to buy.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, cigarettes, slippers, Fanta, CocaCola, Sprite, Sagiko, eggs, fish, and water.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of this group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 52 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Wycliffe has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.
	
Wycliffe is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 11 years.  Wycliffe works as a farmer to provide for his 5 children.  The community and other farmers know Wycliffe as an experienced and hardworking farmer.  Other than farming, he is also involved in community groups such as the men's group and savings group.  Wycliffe described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund in 2008, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund so that he could learn new farming methods.  Because he is an active community member, Wycliffe has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Wycliffe's life because he received training and was able to feed the family.  In the future, Wycliffe hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to invest in a business.
  														
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Wycliffe and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seed and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento SAN MARTIN está compuesto por ocho integrantes de los cuales seis  son mujeres y dos varones que se dedican a distintas actividades, la presidenta del banco es  la señora Primitiva tiene 43 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Primitiva va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que se acerca la época de Navidad y desea comprar también panetones, la señora Primitiva enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
The SAN MARTIN Entrepreneurship Bank is formed by eight members, of which six are women and two are men. The make a living from a variety of businesses. 

The president of the bank is Primitiva. She is 43 years old and makes a living by selling items of basic need in her neighborhood store, which is located in her home in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz. This loan is her first sequence in the institution. Primitiva is going to use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her business. Her motivation for asking for this loan is the need to stock her store because the Christmas season is approaching. She also wants to buy panettone. 

Primitiva faces challenges in her work such as competition, as there are a lot of neighborhood stores in her area. She is going to use her profits to keep buying merchandise, thus increasing her capital, and to be able to have a warehouse, as this is one of her wishes. She feels happy and grateful for this opportunity she is being provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
Mark is a 31-year-old married man. He describes himself to be highly self-motivated. He operates a retail shop where he sells bread, milk, washing soap, salt and other household items. 

He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with a market and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds . 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to add stock to his inventory of milk, sugar, rice and other items to sell in his retail store. His business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to add stock to his inventory of milk, sugar, rice and other items to sell in his retail store

loans.name: Polly

texts.en: Polly is a 33-year-old, married, hard-working, man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in produce selling as his main source of income. He has other side businesses, like farming where he earns an extra living. He started this business in order to educate his children and sustain his family. He faces a challenge of high transport costs and weather changes that affect his produce business. He has a vision of owning a big produce store in two years time. He is requesting a loan to buy more dry food items to sell in his produce business.

loans.use: to buy more dry food items to sell in his produce business.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam used the previous loan to pay workers who were making bricks for him. He is a 63-year-old married man with two children, aged 17 and 14. 

Adam deals in brick-making to earn a living. With the proceeds from his business, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Apart from that, he also owns house rentals, from which he earns money to support his family. Adam hopes that in the future, he will own a factory that makes bricks, though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demands. Adam intends to use the loan to pay workers who are making bricks for him

loans.use: to pay workers who are making bricks for him.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 41-year-old farmer living in Litein with his wife and 3 children, all of whom are of school-going age. He has been farming for 4 years. He produces and sells tea, milk and eggs. In farming, he loves mostly tea and dairy farming because they do well in Litein. The challenge he faces is unpredictable climatic conditions.

Paul chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer friendly services to their customers and their loans are at a lower interest rate. Juhudi Kilimo helps farmers to manage their assets which adds more income to them. Through this loan, he will construct a greenhouse and thus have a variety of plants which will generate more income for him. This will improve his family's living standards and he will educate his children.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Rubik

texts.en:
Rubik is from Pshatavan village of Armavir region. He lives there with his wife, mother and two children. 

Rubik is involved in farming. Near the village where he lives with his family, Rubik owns a small piece of land land and grows sunflowers, greens and apricots. Realizing the importance of this agricultural income for his family's living, Rubik would like to expand it. Rubik would like to use this loan to purchase land and enlarge his crops. 

Rubik has already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to repay it. However, thanks to recent hard work, Rubik was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way and was able to cover the monthly payments. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. Rubik hopes for lenders' support as that is very important for him to enlarge his agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for land.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a 24-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  She is grows cocoa and also buys from other farmers in order to raise money to support her family.

Unpredictable weather and price fluctuation affect her business growth.   Her desire is to become a leading cocoa grower who sells directly to the cocoa company.  Harriet requests a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en: Ararat lives in Gay village with his wife and three children (ages 22, 20 and 17). Ararat is involved in cultivation of the land. Specifically he cultivates greens in the greenhouse, as well as owns a plot of land where he cultivates tomatoes and peppers. He sells the gathered harvest locally and gathers income which is vital for his family's living. Due to the hard work of Ararat and his family members, local resellers know him as a hardworking farmer and prefer to purchase products from him. Now by asking for this loan Ararat asks for financial support. As the greenhouse that he owns is too old, Ararat needs to purchase pipes and a plastic cover for it. The loan will also be used for purchasing forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Ararat's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Ararat will be very thankful to lenders for their good will and support.

loans.use: to pay for pipe and a plastic cover (for the greenhouse) and purchase forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Satta

texts.en: Satta is 37 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has four children, ages 2, 12, 16, and 19. All of them are in school and live at home. For the past two years, Satta has been selling rice by the cup in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes good profits. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business. Satta hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en: Kumba lives in West Point. She is 37 years old and is a parent of three children. Her children are between 3 and 10 years old and in school. Kumba did not attend school. For the past four years she has been selling door locks, hinges, nails, etc. in the local market. She will use the profits to build a place where she will be able to sit and sell. She learned this trade from her friend. She is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc. to expand her business. Kumba plans to build a house and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, etc. to expand her business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 31-year-old lady who enjoys doing hand embroidery. She has done hand embroidery for about 10 years. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to acquire a customer base that allows her to contribute to her home expenses. 

To help her continue her operation, she requests a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones. These items will help her to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful that she can target more customers and therefore increase her income. 

She is in her 4th loan cycle and has a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 27-year-old married woman with four children. The man shown in the photo is Nazia’s husband.  He is a driver  and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has driven a rickshaw for many years in order to meet the family expenses. The rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Nazia has applied for a loan of 50,000 RS for her husband to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transportation services to his passengers. 

Nazia is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a 63-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son and grandson in the small village of Sachkhere district. He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood. His parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family.
 
Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Zurab was unable to study for a professional career. Zurab works hard on family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and potatoes. He always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. As the family has only seasonal income, Zurab decided to start dairy farming and seek credit from local financial institutions. However, his attempts to obtain credit were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Zurab's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1500 GEL for purchasing a milk cow.  After the cow is purchased, the family will start producing dairy products, including cheese and yogurt for selling. They also will use the milk products for feeding the family.
 
The new business initiative will give Zurab a chance to have financial stability and a monthly income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is a 39-year-old man from the village of Natanebi. He lives with his mother, wife and 2 school-aged sons. His mother gets monthly assistance from the local government. Avtandil and his wife are involved in the same activities. They have a nuts reception unit where they sort nuts and bring them to the factory. Their income approximates 500 GEL monthly. 

Avtandil has a desire to start another activity and increase his family's income. The startup program, which is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of $3800 for opening a store for flour and bran. He has already arranged the place for this store near his house. Avtandil is a very enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to ensure that his children receive a good education for progressing in life.  This credit will be a great support for the family. Avtandil is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to open a store for flour and bran.

loans.name: Dayanna Alexandra

texts.es:
Dayanna Alexandra estudiante de Técnico Profesional Arte Gráfico y Publicitario, inicio el interés por las Artes Gráficas desde muy pequeña en el colegio, hay aprendió diferentes clases de perspectivas y diferentes planchas de color, al pasar los años en clase de informática tuvo diferentes lecciones para aprender a manejar el programa de Scratch. 
Al ingresar al grado décimo en el colegio le dictaron clase de Arte Gráfico, Medios Audiovisuales, Ciencia y Tecnología, donde aprendió los diferentes planos de fotografía, realizo páginas web, alto y bajo relieve, volumen y sombra de objetos.
En la segunda mitad del año 2013 ingreso a la universidad para estudiar Arte Gráfico y Publicitario aprendiendo y poniendo en práctica todas las enseñanzas de los profesores, actualmente ingresa a II semestre de esta carrera y está esperando con ansias todas las enseñanzas de los profesores.
Meta a corto Plazo, ingresar a II semestre en la universidad y seguir adquiriendo conocimiento en el Arte Gráfico y la Publicidad.
Meta a Mediano Plazo, estar graduada de técnico Profesional en Arte Gráfico y Publicitario e ingresar a trabajar en una empresa donde pueda poner en práctica lo que aprendió en la carrera y así seguir ayudando a los papas y hermanas, sin dejar de seguir estudiando y tener el titulo de profesional.
A largo plazo, Alexandra colocara la propia empresa de publicidad para ofrecer oportunidad de trabajo a jóvenes que tengan el mismo interés por el Arte Gráfico y la Publicidad para que puedan costear la carrera siendo jóvenes.
Gracias.
texts.en:
Dayanna Alexandra is a student of Technical Professional Graphic Arts and Advertising. She became interested in graphic arts at a young age when she was in elementary school. There she learned about perspective and different color palates. In computer classes over the years she had lessons on how to use the program Scratch.  When she entered 10th grade she had classes in Graphic Arts, Audiovisual Media, and Science and Technology, where she learned about different kinds of photography, created web pages, studied high and low relief and the volume and shadow of objects. 

In the second half of 2013 she entered university to study Graphic Arts and Advertising, learning, and putting into practice all the knowledge she is acquiring from her instructors. Currently she is ready to start the second semester of the program and is eagerly waiting to learn from her instructors. Her short-term goal is to begin the second semester at the university and continue to study Graphic Arts and Advertising.  Her medium-term goal is to graduate as a Professional Graphic Arts and Advertising technician and begin to work for a company where she can apply all the knowledge she acquired in the program.  In that way she will be able to continue to help her parents and sisters without having to interrupt her studies so she can go on to earn a professional degree. 

In the long-run, Alexandra sees her own advertising company offering job opportunities to young people who have the same interest in Graphic Arts and Advertising so that they can afford to study for such a career while they are young. Thank you.

loans.use: to pay tuition for one semester

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Khon is 44 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and raising animals for more than ten years and earns approximately $1 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Her children are garment workers and earn a daily income of $15. To improve her family’s earnings, Khon is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase cosmetics and clothes to sell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and rebuild her house to make it bigger and more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothes to sell.

loans.name: On

texts.en: On is a single, 18-year-old woman who lives with her mother and two siblings in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has worked in a garment factory for more than two years and earns approximately $5 per day. Her siblings are also employed by the garment factory. They earn about $10 daily. To improve her family’s finances, On is requesting a loan of $1,300 to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher. By doing so, she would be able to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her house to make it more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell when the price is higher.

loans.name: Jesibel

texts.en:
This is Jesibel. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Jesibel would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jesibel dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes that her children will finish their studies.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a single mother of three school-aged children. She also takes care of two orphans.  She has been in her used clothing business for 1 year. Christine has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She  gets additional income from two rental houses. She travels door to door selling used clothes six days a week. Her major business challenges include the weather and thieves. She wishes to get a permanent business site and become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of the low interest rates. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is a 40 year old woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

Veronicah will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be financially stable within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will excel in her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 47-year-old married woman. She has 3 children between the ages of 16 and 25. She describes herself as loyal to her customers. 

She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her primary customers are local customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add float ( money for customers to withdraw in the M-pesa business). Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have steady employment. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to add float( money for customers to withdraw in the M-pesa business).

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 32-year-old single woman. She describes herself as a goal-oriented person. She operates a retail shop where she sells clothing. Her business is located in an area with market and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase stock of clothing for her shop. Her business goal is to own a boutique shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first  loan with SMEP-DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: purchase stock of clothing for her store

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia Lucila tiene 40 años y es soltera,la socia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Lucila is 40 years old and single. The member has a grocery store where she sells such staple items as rice, sugar, milk and oil.  The member works from 8:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. and has been doing this for 7 years. It has been going very well for her.

Lucila's dream is to expand her grocery business. She is asking for the loan so she can buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.  She is very happy about the loan and promises to make every payment.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a hardworking man with two children, aged 4 and 2 living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop to earn a living. With the proceeds from his shop, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Apart from that, he also owns a motorcycle for transport business.

Edson hopes that in the future, he will own a wholesale business, though he faces a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demands. Edson intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Daviti

texts.en: Daviti is a 42-year-old man from Rustavi city. He lives with his wife and both are involved in agricultural activity. They have one milk cow, the products of which are sold locally. They also cultivate a plot of agricultural land and get fruits and vegetables which are used for trading. Daviti has a desire to expand his agricultural business and set up a poultry farm. He requested a loan of 550 GEL to purchase a specific kind of chickens and then sell them for a good price. The startup program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan and increase the productivity. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To set up a poultry farm

loans.name: Nubar

texts.en:
Nubar is from the Ghukasavan village in the Ararat region. She is a farmer with 15 years of experience of running a farm with her husband. Nubar mainly cultivates greens. She owns a greenhouse which is too old and needs to be renovated. As the income that she gathers from selling greens in the local open market is hardly enough for covering daily needs, Nubar and her husband aren't able to save money for the renovation of the greenhouse. Now by applying for this loan Nubar asks financial support from SEF to be able to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse. As this is Nubar's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Nubar will be very grateful to lenders for support and their good will. 
Nubar lives together with her husband and 21-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Sali

texts.en: Sali is back again thanking lenders for their help and requesting another loan for the same purpose; to buy used clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell

loans.name: Al-Hosam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Hosam. This group consists of four members who live in Aden, Yemen.  The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 190,000 YER. 

Safia is 40 years old and has four children. She couldn’t continue studying in school because she needed to work to help her family in paying for food and rent. She currently has a business selling incense and perfumes. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. The loan of 60,000 YER from AMB she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for incense and perfumes. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward. The small girl that appears in the photo is a daughter of one of the group members.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to expand her business.

loans.name: Rodrigo Hernan

texts.es: El señor Rodrigo tiene 48 años, casado con 2 hijos que tienen la edad de 20 años y 18 años, él trabaja como mecánico hace ya bastante tiempo, tiene su taller que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Pura Pura, este préstamo es el primero  que tiene con la institución, el señor Rodrigo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de repuestos y algunas herramientas para su negocio,  Se siente muy feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan de mejorar siempre su taller y así de esta manera genera más ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Rodrigo, 48, is married and has 2 children ages 20 and 18. He is a mechanic and has been doing this work for a long time now. His repair shop is located in the Pura Pura area. This is his first loan with the institution. 

Rodrigo will use this loan to purchase spare parts and some tools for his business. He is happy for this opportunity offered to him to improve his shop. This way he will generate more revenue to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha tiene 45 años, casada con dos hijos de las edades de 21 y 16 años, ella se dedica  a  la crianza de ganado para su posterior venta, ella vive en la localidad de Cullucachi, este préstamo es primero que tiene con la institución, la señora Bertha va a usar este préstamo para compra de ganado ovino para tener una mejor producción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es mejorar sus ingresos, La señora Bertha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su negocio y calidad de vida, la señora Bertha va a utilizar los beneficios mejorar sus ingresos, la señora Bertha desea para su negocio crecer en la crianza y venta de ganado ovino, Ella es una persona muy  trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de seguir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha, 45, is married and has two children ages 21 and 16. She raises cattle to later sale. She lives in Cullucachi. This is her first loan with the institution. 

Bertha will use this loan to purchase sheep to have a better production. She is requesting this loan is to improve her revenues. The challenges Bertha faces are improving her business and her quality of life. Bertha will use the loan to increase her income. Bertha wants her business to grow in the raising and selling of sheep. 

She is a hard working and enterprising woman with a desire to continue ahead and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es: La Señora JANNETH sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y venta de pollos a la broaster, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para elaborar sus pollos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de una broastera más grande  para elaborar pollos ya que la que tiene le quedo muy pequeña, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer y  seguir mejorando su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Janneth continues with the same activity of Broaster-style chicken production and sales. She says that the previous loan went really well as she used it to purchase ingredients and supplies to cook her chickens. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase a bigger Broaster pressure fryer to cook her chickens as the other fryer is small. 

She is happy and grateful to Kiva lenders for the opportunity that they give her to grow and continue improving her business and therefore her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell rotisserie chicken.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 37 year old married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows, which produce milk that he sells. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area conducive for dairy farming and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be outbreaks of animal diseases. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feed. His business goal is to be able to reach a wider market area within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a 46 year old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a farm where she keeps poultry. She has been involved in this business for 16 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are chicken meat sellers. She describes her biggest business challenge as the outbreak of poultry diseases. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and add more poultry. Her business goal is to own a large poultry farm within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to sustain her business. This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy animal feed and add more poultry

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 46 years old and lives in Tappita City, Nimba County with her fiancee and nine children who range in age from eight to 28 years old. Only two of her children are currently in school. For the last 30 years, Annie has been in business, and currently sells dried meat in a local market. She earns a good profit, has many customers and opens her business six days in a week for 12 hours a day. She is requesting a loan to buy more dried meat to sell. Her goal for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more dried meat to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 42 years old and lives in Tappita City, in Nimba County. She is a sixth grade dropout. She is married to a doctor and they have five children between the ages of three and 23 years. Only four of them are in school. All of the children live with her at home. 

For five years, Mamie has been selling bread. She is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, flour, and sugar for the business. She sells six days a week, spending 12 hours each day at her business. She described herself as a businesswoman.

The price of flour and sugar is the main problem she faces. She started this business with money her husband, and she learned business from friends. She likes her business because of the ways in which people respond to it. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, flour, and sugar for the business.

loans.name: Old Tax Park Development Association. Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a member of Old Tax Park Development Association Group. She is a single woman with four children, who runs a banana stall in Kisugu market. The four children are all in school and their tuition is obtained by selling bananas as well as vending second-hand clothes during the children’s holiday. 

Harriet intends to acquire more income in the future, expand her business, and see her children through school. She will use the loan to buy used clothing, so that she can get money to pay for tuition for her children's first school term. Harriet is hard-working and honest.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Adriana, a sus 29 años de edad, está felizmente casada y es madre de una pequeña hija por quien lucha día a día para darle sustento y bienestar.
Durante su vida productiva trabajó en diferentes empresas pero, hace 6 meses se le presentó la oportunidad de adquirir una tienda de abarrotes, con unos ahorros que tenía pudo comprar el negocio y comenzó a generar ingresos de manera independiente, con el ánimo de estar más tiempo con su familia. Trabaja sola todos los días y ofrece productos de la canasta familiar, hasta el momento ha tenido muy buena acogida en el sector, lo que le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer y posicionar su negocio en el mercado, desea invertir para aumentar el inventario y tener más variedad para ofrecer a los clientes, es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará mecato, granos, lácteos, panela, café, huevos, carnes frías, productos de aseo, entre otros, así podrá satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de los compradores, generando un aumento en las ventas y por ende, en el margen de utilidades que deja su labor. Adriana es consciente que para sacar su negocio adelante y lograr un reconocimiento favorable en el sector, debe trabajar con disciplina y constancias, además de prestar un excelente servicio para hacerle frente a la competencia y así generar mejores ingresos para dar a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Adriana, age 29, is happily married.  She is the mother of a young daughter, for whom she struggles daily in order to ensure her care and wellbeing.

During her working life she has worked in different companies, but six months ago she had the chance to get a grocery store.  With some savings that she had, she managed to buy the business and started to earn her living independently, with the added bonus of getting to spend more time with her family.  She works alone every day and offers basic staples.  At this point, she has been very welcomed in the neighborhood, which has allowed her to earn money to support her husband with the financial needs of their home.

With the goal of positioning and strengthening her business in the market, she wants to invest in order to increase her inventory and have a bigger variety to offer her customers.  It is because of this that she is asking for the support of a loan.  With the loan she will buy pastries, cereals, dairy products, brown sugar, coffee, eggs, cold cuts, and cleaning products, among other items.  In this way she can meet the needs and tastes of her customers, creating an increase in sales and consequently in the profit margin of her business.  Adriana is aware that in order to get her business ahead and achieve a favorable amount of recognition in the sector, she should be disciplined and steady in her work and also provide excellent service in order to face her competition.  In this way she can earn a better income to give her family a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy pastries, cereals, dairy products, brown sugar, coffee, eggs, cold cuts, and cleaning products, among other items.

loans.name: Xhevit

texts.en: Xhevit is in his fifties and married to a woman who was born with a disability. They have two children in their early twenties. He has been a farmer for almost 20 years, selling fresh produce in the farmers' market in a nearby city. In Albanian cities, there are specific places set aside for this purpose, but the number of people seeking to sell produce in them is larger than the number of stalls. That's why some people sell wherever they can, including in the streets, where they display their products on cardboard, or by going door-to-door. They make sure to start selling at around 6 a.m. and leave at around 2 p.m. so that they have time left to work on other activities. Xhevit is requesting a loan to repair the family house, which is where we see him photographed.

loans.use: to repair the family house.

loans.name: Ismete

texts.en:
Ismete is 45 and an Egyptian mother of three step children. She lives in a main city in southern Albania where the majority of her community lives.  Just like other members of her community, she sells used items like clothing and sometimes shoes. “My husband does seasonal work in Greece; we try very hard, yet we remain very poor. This will be my first loan and I am very grateful to the loan officer who made me aware of my eligibility for a loan through his institution. Other institutions I had gone to in the past had said 'no' because people in the range of my income were not eligible,” said Ismete.

Ismete is requesting a loan to buy second-hand clothing to resell and to repair a damaged balcony of her home.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing to resell and to repair a damaged balcony of the family home

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La señora Lucila, tiene 24 años y un hijo de dos meses, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida ella vende pescado frito desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a esta actividad, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la isla Suriqui,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Lucila va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos para la elaboración del pescado como chuño, papa y maíz al por mayor,  la señora Lucila la va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimos platillos,  se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan ya que esta es la única actividad a la que se dedica ya que es un negocio familiar.
texts.en: Lucila, 24, has a two-month old son. She makes a living by selling food. She had sold fried fish for several years. She sells her products in her food stand, located in her home in Suriqui. This is her first loan with this institution. Lucila is going to use this loan to buy wholesale supplies for making fish including potato starch, potatoes, and corn. Lucila is going to use the profits to keep buying supplies to prepare her delicious dishes. She feels happy and grateful for this opportunity because it is her only source of work since it's a family business.

loans.use: to buy products for making fried fish.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en: Raymundo has owned and operated a transportation service for six years, earning well for the family. He was able to successfully repay his previous loans from GDMPC used for motor repair. Recently, he borrowed a new loan to cover maintenance costs and purchase new tires to improve the services. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to cover maintenance costs and purchase new tires

loans.name: Margarita Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Margarita, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijas de 15 y 12 años de edad, la mayor  estudian en colegio y la menor en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Margarita al ver lo difícil que estaba la situación económica y que su esposo en ocasiones no tiene trabajo decidió hace dos años empezar un negocio de venta de ropa la cual lo realiza en sus tiempos libres ya que también realiza trabajos de limpieza en una casa de la localidad, ella se da tiempo para realizar esta labor, atender su hogar y además vender su mercadería, nos cuenta que gracias a sus ganancias ellos han podido solventar ciertos gastos generados por los estudios de  sus hijas como de la alimentación de la familia.
Este crédito es para  comprar ropa de todo tipo y aprovechar esta época que es cuando más vende. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijas.
texts.en:
The "Calle 1 de Enero" communal bank meets every fortnight in Montecristi, which is known for it's rich pre-colonial culture and it's nationally and internationally recognized handicrafts. This is the home of the Panama hat. 

Margarita lives here. She is 32 years old, married and from this union has two children aged 12 and 15. The oldest studies in High School, the youngest in Primary school. Her husband is a bricklayer. Seeing how difficult their economic situation was and with her husband not having work at times,  Margarita decided to start a business. She sells clothing in her spare time. She also cleans a house in the city. She takes the time to do this cleaning, take care of her house and sell her goods. She tells us that thanks to her income she has been able to pay certain educational expenses for her daughters and food for the family. 

Margarita will use this loan to buy all types of clothing and take advantage of this time of year when sales are the best. She has been with this communal bank for 4 loan cycles now and likes the help provided by the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her daughters.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Hayde  Eugenia

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle 1 de Enero se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi,  conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Hayde, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos son mayores de edad,  el menor tiene tres años  y aun no estudia. Su esposo es maestro. 
Doña Hayde es maestra en una escuela de la localidad, pero con la finalidad de ganars algo extra también se dedica a la comercio en sus tiempos libres, ella vende ropa de todo tipo así como también productos Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a  puerta aunque  sus mejores clientes son sus compañeras de clases y madres de familia que siempre llegan a la escuela a ver a sus pequeños y allí ella les ofrece sus productos y logar sus ventas, lleva dos años  que se dedica a esta actividad en la cual le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de temporada. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Credito y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
