The “1 de Enero” credit group meets every two weeks in the Montecristi settlement, known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and its nationally and internationally known art.  It’s the place of the famous straw hats.

Hayde lives here.  She is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  Three are adults and the youngest is three years old.  Her husband is a teacher.

Hayde is also a teacher at a local school, but she is also a merchant in her spare time, so she can earn some extra money.  She sells clothing of all types, and also Avon (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and ladies’ accessories).  She sells on door to door although her classmates and mothers who go to the school to see their children are her best customers.  She offers her products there, has been doing this for two years and things are going very well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics, and seasonal clothing.  She has been with the credit group for four cycles and she likes it because the loan payments are easy.  Her dream is to have her own boutique.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es:
Ana, se encuentra descapitalizada y está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de maíz, aderezos, quesillo, chicharrón y gas propano para fortalecer el inventario de su materia prima, de esta manera tendrá ingresos que necesita para continuar trabajando y dando a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Con la inversión del crédito anterior Ana ha podido seguir trabajando por un tiempo, en su momento sus ventas aumentaron y cancelo sus cuotas, asís mismo las condiciones familiares cambiaron.
texts.en:
Ana does not have working capital and is requesting a new loan to invest in buying corn, seasoning, cheese, sausage, and propane gas to strengthen her inventory of raw materials. Then, she will have the supplies she needs to keep working and to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

With her previous investment, Ana was able to keep working for awhile. It increased her sales and she made her debt payments. Her family condition also changed.

loans.use: to buy corn, seasoning, cheese, sausage, and propane gas.

loans.name: Solomon's Group

texts.en:
Solomon’s group has six lead farmers and is located in Kakamega North District. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 56 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. As the Kiva group representative, Solomon is pictured on the right of the group with his hand raised.

Solomon is 50 years old and has been a farmer for 20 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children. The community and other farmers know Solomon as hardworking and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community including the men's group and prayer group. Solomon described his harvest last year as poor and hopes he can have a better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Solomon joined One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Solomon joined One Acre Fund so that he could try new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family. Because he is an active community member and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Solomon has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Solomon's life because he was able to save money and was able to feed his family. In the future, Solomon hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and save for the future.

Solomon and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers with the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Cecilia's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 7 group leader farmers in Webuye District. Cecilia, on the right in the photo with her hand raised, has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 63 other farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 KES.
							
Cecilia is 63 years old and has been a farmer for 50 years. She works as a farmer to provide for her 8 children. The community and other farmers know Cecilia as an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community as part of the savings group and prayer group. Cecilia described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group.
							
Cecilia first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2008 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Cecilia joined One Acre Fund in order to get new farming methods, earn enough to feed her family and send children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers. Cecilia plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send children to school, save for the future and buy a cow. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Cecilia’s own life was improved because she has more profits from her harvest, was able to save money and feed the family.
  							
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Cecilia and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.	

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of this group in Webuye District.  He is pictured here in a group of 5 One Acre Fund group leader farmers.  The group leaders represent a total of 57 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here.  Wycliffe has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised.  He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet.  Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.						

Wycliffe is a reliable member of the community.  He is married with 8 children.  Wycliffe is 54 years old and has been working as a farmer for the last 45 years to support his family.  In addition to this, Wycliffe is very active in his community and is involved in the men's group, savings group, prayer group and the burial committee.  He described his harvest last year as good.  He hopes to continue working with One Acre Fund and to continue enjoying the success he is having with the One Acre Fund farm packages.		

Wycliffe first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season.  Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send children to school.  He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers learn about One Acre Fund.  Wycliffe plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future and buy a cow.  He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers.  Wycliffe’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family.
  	
One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Wycliffe and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase better harvests of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Al-Nours Group

texts.en: Al-Nours is a group of five ladies from al-Hodeida, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB. Sayda is a 41-year-old married woman with four children.  Four years ago, Sayda decided to help her husband. Her husband works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothes, but, unfortunately, the money he makes is really not enough. In the beginning, Sayda started going to door-to-door, selling others' products. After she's had enough experience in selling cosmetics and clothes, she intends to have her own business selling clothes, perfumes and incense; therefore, she asked for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy clothes, perfumes and incense to resell. She hopes that she will make profits from buying a lot of products and selling them to new clients in different quarters and places in her city.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense to resell.

loans.name: Ruman Yueil

texts.en:
Ruman has expanded her business with the previous loan she received. She is managing the business quite well and says thank you to Kiva through Finance Sudan for the loans that she has received. She has been able to pay school fees, too, for the children.

She is now borrowing a loan worth 2,000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable her to buy more stock like beans, oil, flour and many other items to enlarge her stock.

loans.use: to buy beans, oil, flour and many other items to enlarge her stock.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 46-year-old lady. She is passing her life with her husband, three daughters and a son.

Razia is taking a loan for her daughters, who are all very expert in the art of embroidery and knit very fine bridal dresses. Due to demand, they are facing a shortage of materials. Therefore, Razia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can reduce the shortage of raw material. With this loan, she will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, precious stones, sequins and pearls of various colors. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Channarith

texts.en:
Channarith is 30 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He is a construction foreman who makes an income of $9 daily. His wife sells cakes. She earns about $5 per day.

Due to a lack of funds, Channarith is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase construction materials to fix his house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to purchase more construction tools to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchsae construction materials to fix his house

loans.name: Vasil

texts.ru:
У Василя — участок земли на 45 соток, на которых уже стоят две рабочие теплицы площадью 15 соток. Василь занимается выращиванием капусты, помидор и перца. В основном он работает сам, иногда помогают родители, но в период посева и сбора урожая берет наемных рабочих.  Василь еще совсем молодой, ему только 24 года, у него есть жена и ребенок.  
Василь хочет закупить пленку для перекрытия теплиц и удобрения на предстоящий сезон, для чего ему нужна сумма в 10 000 гривен. Работа в теплицах непростая, но Василь продолжает заниматься этим делом, ведь оно приносит ему неплохой доход. Со временем Василь планирует расширяться и построить еще одну теплицу.
texts.en: Vasil has a 45-sotkas land plot, where he already has two working greenhouse of 15 sotkas each.  Vasil is involved in growing cabbage, tomatoes and peppers.  He primarily works alone and sometimes his parents help, but he hires workers during the sowing and harvesting periods.  Vasil is still very young - he is only 24 years old and has a wife and child.  Vasil wants to purchase plastic for covering the greenhouses and fertilizers for the upcoming season, for which he needs a sum of 10,000 hryvnia.  The work in greenhouses is not simple, but Vasil continues to be involved in this business since it yields him a decent income.  With time, Vasil plans to expand and build another greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy plastic film and fertilizers

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es: El señor Cecilio, cultiva desde hace muchos años citricos como Limones, Naranjas ademas cosecha Piña Papaya, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Abono, Urea, Triple ya que sus arboles estan empezando a florecer y desea aprovechar para darle un mantenimiento antes que nazcan los frutos, el comercializa su productos en los diferentes mercados de la capital. el espera que su producto cada vez sea de mejor calidad gracias a los cuido y mantenimiento que les proporciona en cada temporada, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le ha brindado.
texts.en: Cecilio has grown citrus fruits like Lemons and oranges for many years now. He also grows pineapples and papaya. He will use this loan to buy urea, fertilizer and Triple (a compounded fertilizer formulated for citrus fruit). His trees have started to flower and he wants to fortify them before the fruits start to grow. He sells the product in various markets in the capital. He hopes that the harvest gets to be of better quality each time thanks to the care and maintenance that he provides them each growing season. He is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva for the support they provide him.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and materials.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, age 41, earns an income by operating a farm, where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a customer-friendly environment and her primary customers are small-scale farmers and members of the community. She reports that her biggest business challenge is the outbreak of animal diseases. She describes herself as determined.

Sarah and her husband have six children. 

Sarah's business goal is to be able to serve large-scale customers within five years. She hopes to be successful and prosperous in the future. 

This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en: Vicenta cooks and sells a variety of snack items in the local community for a living. She has been doing this for four years, earning well to aid her husband's income for the family. Her previous loan from GDMPC used in the business was successfully repaid with her great effort and determination to improve their living. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to  expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients and utensils

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es: La Señorita Cinthya tiene 37 años y es casada,  estudia un diplomado en su área ya que ella es licenciada en auditoria, trabaja en la universidad católica que tiene su sede en la localidad de batallas este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución La Señorita Cinthya va a usar este préstamo de para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como pago de diplomado, material de estudio y una computadora para terminar sus estudios que durara el tiempo 1 años, la Señorita Cinthya enfrenta retos en su estudios que son el estar trabajando y estudiando a la vez tiene esa dificultad de tiempo por que pasa clases por las noches. Viven en la zona  Bicentenario, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es de ser una profesional muy competitiva se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Cinthya is 37 years old, married, and is studying, since she is an auditor and works at a catholic university, headquartered in Batallas.  This is her first cycle with the institution.  Cinthya will use the money to pay various expenses; including paying for her degree, study materials, and a computer to finish her studies that last for one year.  Cinthya has challenges in her studies, which include having to work and study at the same time.  The time demand is great and she attends classes in the evenings.  She lives in the Bicentenario area.  When she finishes school, she wants to be a competent professional and she is happy for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay education costs.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en: Leonarda has been in her tailoring business for more than 21 years, earning good enough for her basic needs. She works hard in her business and was able to repay her previous loan from GDMPC successfully; she used it in buying textiles and other sewing materials. Aside from this, she also opened a general store to improve her income. She borrowed a loan recently to buy additional grocery goods to resell. In the future, she is planning to expand her business or perhaps buy another set of sewing machines.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Gail

texts.en: Gail is running a retail store selling assorted groceries and snacks in their community for a living. She has been doing this for five years, earning good enough for the needs of her only child. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more grocery goods and snacks to resell. She wants to use her profit as additional capital to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods and snacks to resell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy more stock of Yakult (a pro-biotic, milk-like product) needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy more stock of Yakult needed in her business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilia hopes that her business will grow bigger and dreams to have a better living. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of Yakult (a a pro-biotic, milk-like product) needed in her business.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Sana is 22 years old, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income for household expenses. He always tries to establish his business by offering the latest cosmetic products. Nowadays the latest cosmetic products introduced in the market are very demanding and expensive as well. Due to his full contribution for household expenses, he does not have savings to purchase the cosmetics.

Sana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kit, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount the business would be enhanced.

Sana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To buy cosmetics products for resale.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Adela tiene 31 años, es casada desde hace más de 11 años y tiene tres hijos; de 11, 10 y 7 años respectivamente. Vive en casa propia y regularmente no sale a pasear, ya que le gusta estar en la tienda.

Tiene más de 8 años con su tienda de abarrotes, también vende chicharrones preparados, frituras y dulces; en sus ratos libre se dedica a vender productos por catálogo, en especial cosméticos. Este préstamo lo pide para surtir mejor su tienda y tener mayor mercancía que ofrecer. 

El principal logro que Adela ha logrado gracias a su negocio es tener su casa propia, y su gran reto es hacer crecer más su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela runs a small business and is a client of Kubo Financiero. She is 31 years old, has been married for 11 years, and has three children aged 11, 10, and 7. She owns her house but doesn’t go out a lot as she likes to tend her grocery store which she’s run for eight years. In addition to groceries, she sells prepared chicharrones (pork crackling), fried items, and candy. In her free time Adela sells products, mostly cosmetics, from a catalog.

The loan she is seeking is to buy more stock for her store so she will have more merchandise to offer her customers.

Adela’s main achievement has been the purchase of her home, thanks to income from the store. Her greatest challenge is to grow the business.

loans.use: buy more stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, está acompañada, tiene dos hijos de 15 y 12 años, son una familia unida que se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante, se dedica a elaborar producto de loza, es un oficio que aprendió de su madre, desde hace 16 años lo hace de manera independiente, trabaja de 5:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido dificultades en esta actividad económica.
Comprará barro, leña, nacazcol y arcilla, ya que son su materia prima para elaborar sus productos y luego entregarlos a sus clientes, con lo que espera tener un aumento en su producción, cumplirá en menor tiempo con sus pedidos, tendrá más clientes satisfechos y tener más ganancias con las que cancelara sus cuotas y cubrirá parte de sus gastos familiares.
Eva sueña con tener un negocio más rentable, para seguir teniendo los ingresos necesarios con los cuales cambiara el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Eva is in a common-law marriage. She has two children ages 12 and 15. They are a close family who support each other to move forward. She makes a living by making pottery, a skill she learned from her mother. She has done this work independently for 16 years. She works from 5:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. So far, she hasn't had any difficulties with this economic activity.

She will buy mud, firewood, black dye, and clay because they are her basic materials to make her products and then deliver them to her customers. With these supplies, she hopes to increase her production, fill her orders more quickly, have more satisfied customers, and have more income to pay off her debt and cover some of her family's expenses.

Eva dreams of having a more successful business to keep having the necessary income to change her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy mud, firewood, black dye, and clay.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia: 

Martha es casada, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos; dos estudian, uno trabaja y su bebé. Su esposo se llama Juan, son originarios de Huitzilzingo,  viven en la casa de sus suegros y tienen una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 18 años.

En su tienda venden abarrotes, refresco, dulces, café instantáneo, pan y palomitas. El negocio se encuentra en la casa, que se encuentra en una avenida principal en el centro de la colonia; lo abren desde las 6:00 am hasta las 10:30 pm y la atienden entre los dos. 

Pide este préstamo para comparar más mercancía para su tienda de abarrotes, como refrescos. Su negocio les ha permitido tener mayores ingresos poco a poco, y con este ingreso adicional han logrado cubrir sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Martha runs a small business and is a client of Kubo Financiero. She is 37 years old and married with four children. Two are students, one is working, and the fourth is a baby. Both she and her husband Juan are natives of Huitzilzingo and live with Juan’s parents. They have run a grocery store for 18 years.

In the store they sell groceries, soft drinks, candy, instant coffee, bread and popcorn. The store is located in their house on the main street in the centre of their neighbourhood. It’s open from 6 am to 10:30 pm, and they run it between them.

Martha is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise for the store, such as soft drinks. The business has gradually provided an increased income, and with this additional money they are managing to cover daily essentials.

loans.use: buy more merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help toward the education of her children as well as in their personal, household and business expenditures. Aside from having a tailoring business, Jocelyn also has a tricycle unit for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy raw materials, such as fabric and thread, for her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jocelyn hopes to have additional sources of income and dreams of being successful in life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she also finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials, such as fabric and thread

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Créer Le 28 Juillet 2009, ce groupe est composé de 30 femmes qui ont un réel désire de changement dans leur condition d’existence. Elles vivent toutes dans un même village et partagent des liens forts de solidarité  et d’entre aide. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie. 
 
Madame Fatoumata  (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans, mariée  et mère de 03 filles et 03 garçons. Son  activité s’inscrit dans la vente de produits agricoles plus particulièrement l’huile de palme et la patte d’arachide. C’est une activité qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années et jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ce domaine.

Son nouveau prêt, elle compte se procurer au moins trois bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme pour la revente au détail par litre ou selon le besoin du client. 

Les bénéfices environs 15 000 à 20 00 F CFA sont utilisés pour la nourriture et la santé des membres de la famille.
texts.en:
Created on July 28, 2009, this group is composed of 30 women having a real desire to change their living conditions. They all live in the same village and share strong ties of solidarity and mutual assistance. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and rainy season agriculture. 

Ms. Fatoumata (standing at the far right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of 3 girls and 3 boys. Her business involves selling farm products, particularly palm oil and peanut butter. She has been in this business for several years and enjoys good experience in this domain. 

With her new loan, she intends to procure at least three 20-liter containers of palm oil to sell retail by the liter or according to the customer's needs.

The profits, about 15,000 to 20,000 francs CFA, are used for food and healthcare for family members.

loans.use: to procure palm oil to resell

loans.name: Yorleny Maria

texts.es: Yorleny es una joven de 32 años, cuenta con el respaldo de su pareja,  procrearon 3 hijos que son menores de edad quienes van a la escuela, Yorleny se dedica a su pequeño negocio de pulpería que tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación, pero en la actualidad no cuenta con suficientes productos para ofrecer a su clientela por la falta de recursos económicos, por lo que acude al crédito para invertir en el negocio y mejorar las ventas e ingresos, de la misma brindar una mejor manutención a sus hijos y apoyar a su pareja e ir mejorando las condiciones de la familia.
texts.en: Yorleny, 32, counts on the support of her partner. They have 3 young children who go to school.  Yorleny runs a grocery business out of her house, but because she currently lacks economic recourses, the store doesn't have enough product to offer her clients. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business in order to improve sales and income, which will also help her take better care of her children, support her partner and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy basic grains, meat, soda, juice, desserts and cereals among others.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri is a housewife living with four persons in the family home in Bandung. Bandung is known as "The City of Flowers" and is located about 2-3 hours drive from Jakarta. Together with her husband, they run a small stall called "warung" that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and services bill payments for her customers. 

She felt interested in joining Ruma because she wants to expand her business. She is glad that her business was assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has had around $30-$31 per day in sales on average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

Currenly, Sri is taking a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends. 

In the future, she plans to put aside the extra income for her children's education and family saving. Sri thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and service bill payments on weekends.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 35-year-old farmer living in the Kisii area, an area known for its good banana production. He is married and has four children, all of whom are of school-going age. 

He has been doing farming for 15 years, and he produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, and bananas. He enjoys mixed farming because it generates income for him, but his major challenges are poor roads and lack of good markets.

James chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they meet the needs of small-scale farmers, and the interest rate on the loans is easily achieved. Through this loan, he will purchase a dairy cow, which will bring in more milk, and thus more income will be generated. 

This will enable him to manage his children's school fees and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a business selling accessories in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional accessories to sell. She has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories to sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has really benefited from the previous loan that he received. He is very thankful to KIVA through Finance Sudan for the loan, which enabled him to buy more stock and expand his business and even employ one person to help him run the business. 

Charles has changed his business and is now a mobile phone dealer selling mobile phones, chargers, and memory cards; he also provides phone-charging services. Charles has requested this loan worth 4000 South Sudanese Pounds to enable him buy more stock such as mobile phones, chargers and memory cards for his new business venture.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories, chargers, and memory cards

loans.name: Ziyodullo

texts.en:
Ziyodullo is 31 years old and married with two children. Being a responsible father, he works hard every day to generate income so that he can cover his daily costs and send some of his children to school.  He is dedicated to the farming business, growing crops and vegetables on his own land. 

In order to contribute to improving his family's living standards he has worked hard from early morning until late evening for five years. He has a tractor. He uses this tractor for his farming business. He has additional income from animal husbandry. 

Ziyodullo would like to develop his business, which is why he is asking for a loan in the amount of 10,000 TJS to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds for the new planting season

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a turner.

Dinh has been running a general store in the front of her house for four years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business and to buy different products such as candy and soft drinks to restock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income. This will help her improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy products such as candy and soft drinks to restock her store.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of nine One Acre Fund lead farmers. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo. These group leaders represent a total of 83 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. John has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

John is married and has nine children. He is 57 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee. John has been a farmer for 30 years. John described his harvest as excellent last year but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.

John first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. John joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, try new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader and, as an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. John plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. John’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest, more farm training, and more farm group support, and he was able to feed the family.

John and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers with the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to access hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is an 18-year-old business woman who is single and living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is successfully running a business selling groceries using door-to-door service. She also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a high school within the community to help students improve their academic success.
  
Irene intends to use this Kiva loan to open a stall and stock it with products such as clothes, hair relaxers, shoes, soap, rice, sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, bread, shoe polish, snacks and cotton wool. The shop will be the only one in her area, and she believes it will do a brisk business. This will enable Irene to earn money so that she can continue her own education.

loans.use: To open a stall and purchase stock for it

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La socia Isidora tiene 37 años,es casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,la socia prepara diferentes comidas como pollo al horno,saltado decarne y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Isidora is 37 years old, married, and has two children.  She sells different foods such as baked chicken, meat dishes, and soups, works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, and has been doing this for five years.  Things are going well for her and her dream is to have a restaurant.  She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients such as chicken, meat, and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Santos Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Santos del Carmen de 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad quienes estudian la escuela primaria y secundaria, ella lucha por sacarlos a todos adelante con una carrera profesional, Santos del Carmen se dedica a la comercialización de cerdos los cuales compra  en las comarcas y los vende en la ciudad a un mejor precio, solicita el apoyo de crédito para invertir en este negocio del que sobreviven su familia.
texts.en: Santos del Carmen is 48 years old and is the single mother of four minor children who attend the local elementary and middle schools.  She strives to get them ahead in a professional career.  Santos del Carmen sells pigs, which she buys locally and sells in the city for better prices.  She is asking for a loan to invest into this business on which her family depends.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kadidatou Aliou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 17 Mai 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Ce  groupe en sein des femmes très braves et désireuses d’apporter un plus à leur foyer. Elles habitent toutes le même village. Il existe une parfaite solidarité entre les femmes. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce et la fabrication de savon traditionnel.

Madame Kadiatou  (debout à l’extrême droit avec la main gauche levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe, elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants dont 05 garçons, elle est une femme très déterminée dans ses activités de même au sein du groupe. Elle est vendeuse de poisson fumé, séché qu’elle achète au marché hebdomadaire dans un pays frontalier pour la revente au détail dans le village et les villages alentours.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter pour chaque semaine au moins ½ panier de poisson fumé et séché pour la revente au détail.

Les bénéfices, elle les utilise en partie pour augmenter son épargne et soutenir son mari dans les charges scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created on May 17, 2011 when their 'banc villageois' was inaugurated. Within it are women who are good and honest and who wish to do more for their households. The women all live in the same village. An unshakeable solidarity exists among them. Their main work involves small-scale commerce and making traditional soaps. 

Ms. Kadiatou (standing at the far right with her left hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of eight children, including 5 boys. She is a very determined women in her work and within her group, too. She sells smoked and dried fish that she purchases at the weekly market in a neighboring country. She then sells the fish retail in and around the village.

With this loan, she intends to purchase at least a half-basket of smoked and dried fish each week to resell. 

The profits will be used in part to increase her savings and to support her husband in covering the children's education costs.

loans.use: to purchase at least a half-basket of smoked and dried fish each week to resell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 50-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 5 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low demand. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to add stock of clothes. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bright future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 65-year-old married woman. She has ten children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes.

loans.name: Wanjiru

texts.en:
Wanjiru is a 39-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 7 years to 19 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells foodstuffs. She has been involved in this business for eleven years. Her business is located in a place with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to add stock of sugar, rice, bread, drinks and other items. 

Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, rice, bread, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Generosite A Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyangwi est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre de l’association d’affaire « Générosité A »,senior entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 37ans, et mère de 9 enfants qui, 7 étudient et deux autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits(pagnes). Elle installe ses marchandises au marché central de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint est fonctionnaire de l’Administration publique. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 140 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite  étendre son projet de commerce et construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kyangwi, age 37, is a brave merchant and a member and the president of Générosité A Group. She's energetic and an experienced senior entrepreneur. She's the mother of nine children, out of whom seven go to school. The other two are still kids.

Kyangwi sells clothes ("pagnes", a kind of colorful African cloth). She displays her products at the central market in her town. She started her business with support from her husband, who is a public administration employee.

Later on, she got a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running her business for 15 years. This new loan will be used to buy 140 pieces of pagnes. She wishes to expand her business project, build a house, and feed her children and send them to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially during this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy 140 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Te-Girl

texts.en:
Te-Girl is 35 years old and lives in West Point, which is one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She has two children, ages 8 and 12 years old, who are in school and live at home. 

For ten years now, Te-Girl has been selling palm oil from a table in the local market. She enjoys how fast her product is finished. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. 

Her dreams are to achieve a store and educate her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado County. She is 35 years old and completed twelfth grade. She is single with two children, ages 5 and 7, who live at home and attend school. 

For five years, she has been selling pepper, soap, rice, oil, coal, etc. One of the problems she faces is a small income. She enjoys how her customers buy from her and the profit she makes sometimes. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, soap, rice, oil, coal, etc. for her business. 

In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, soap, rice, oil, coal, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto has been farming for more than ten years and was able to provide for his family's basic needs. He plants and harvests corn to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. Aside from this, he also earns by working for hire in the neighborhood. Despite the difficulties in earning money, Roberto was able to repay his previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) successfully. He used it for improvements on his farm. Recently he borrowed a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer for his corn production business. In the future, Roberto would like to save in order to create an emergency fund for the future and to purchase more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando tiene 29 años, casado tiene dos hijos pequeños de dos y tres añitos, el se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de Pizza desde hace mucho tiempo, vende  en su puesto de venta que se encuentra  que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Vino Tinto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor Fernando va a usar este préstamo para la compra de conservadora para conservar sus alimentos siempre frescos, y también insumos para la elaboración de sus pizzas,  el señor Fernando enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que por la zona  hay muchas pensiones que se dedican a la venta de comida rapida ya que es una zona comercial, el va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos para preparar sus riquísimas pizzas,  se siente feliz y agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan en permitirle hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 29-year old man who is married and has two young children, ages 2 and 3. He makes a living making and selling pizza and has run his business for many years at his house in the area of Vino Tinto. 

This is his first loan with the institution. Fernando plans to use it to buy a refrigerator to keep his food always fresh, as well as the ingredients for the pizzas. Fernando faces some challenges in his business, such as competition in the area. There are many stores that sell fast food in his commercial neighborhood. 

He will use profits to keep buying ingredients for his delicious pizzas. He feels happy and grateful for this opportunity that will allow him to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
This is Antonina. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used buy more fruits and vegetables. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also sells different products like snacks, seasonings and condiments.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables that are needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Antonina hopes to expand her business and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be enterprising. 

She operates a retail store where she sells household goods. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a place with potential, and her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of sugar, rice, bread, drinks and other items. 

Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, rice, bread, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 37-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a tire-repair business where he repairs tires. He has been involved in this business for ten years. His business is located in a place with potential, and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more materials for repairing tires. 

His business goal is to be financially stable within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more materials for repairing tires.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Campo Bello Group

texts.es: Nancy tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña de 7 años de edad que está cursando el primer grado de la escuela. Nancy se dedica a vender joyería de plata que compra a proveedores de la frontera con Panamá, cuenta con una buena clientela ya que la joyería es de calidad y a buen precio, lo que facilita la venta de la misma. Ella desea este crédito para adquirir más joyas que le solicitan sus clientas. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad de los trámites y la baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old and a single mother to her little 7-year-old daughter, who is in the first grade. 
 
Nancy sells silver jewelry that she purchases from suppliers near the border with Panama.  She has a good clientele, as her jewelry is of good quality and well-priced, which makes it easier to sell.  She would like this loan so that she can get more of the jewelry that her customers are requesting. 

She chose Fundación Mujer for its straightforward procedures and its low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

loans.name: María Nela

texts.es: Maria Nela es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, de 33 años de edad. Casada y madre de tres hijos. De oficio estilista, se dedica al negocio de estilismo. Inicio su negocio hace pocos años; estudio un curso de belleza en una academia de la ciudad, y con el apoyo de su mama instalo en su casa su propio salón de belleza. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio demandado. Su meta próxima es ampliar la capacidad operativa y la infraestructura. Solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevos productos de belleza y contratar a más personal. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a que el negocio tenga una nueva imagen y obtener mejores ingresos. Su plan futuro es ampliar el negocio, y abrir una escuela de belleza.
texts.en:
Maria Nela is 33 years old and a native of Esteli. She is married and mother of three children. By profession she is a stylist and she works in her beauty salon. She opened her business a few years ago, having studied hairdressing at an academy in the city. With the help of her mother she installed a beauty salon in her house. 

Today her business is in demand. Her next goal is to amplify her operational capacity and infrastructure. She is requesting a loan to buy new beauty products and hire more staff. She estimates that the loan will help her new business with a new image and bring in more money. Her future plan is to expand her business and open a beauty school.

loans.use: to buy new beauty products and hire more staff.
